text: I'm giving this place 3 stars only because the wait staff was good. The food and value were very disappointing. I have frequented Texas de Brazil and gone to Fogo de Chau and this place comes in at the very bottom of the bunch. The salad bar has no labels on 80% of the items- so anyone with food alergies beware. Everything was overcooked (mushy or dry). The extra items you order for the table were no better. Greasy spinach. The fried bananas tasted like deep fried mystery items. And the meats. 2 standouts- beef ribs and Tritip. Everything else was bland or overcooked. And the meats didn't all come out unless requested- and seriously- who is requesting Chicken Hearts??? And at $100+ for two people, no value for the expense.

We decided to come to this restaurant to celebrate a friends birthday. You could really tell it was a great establishment as soon as you walked in.
First of all the customer service was impeccable amazing great can't ask for anything better they were always on point. Then the food came out and it was to die for and your plate was full can you just wanted more because it was so good. Wait there's more don't forget about the sides wow they are amazing and you got everything you wanted and if you wanted more you got more.
All I can say is the food was terrific the service was impeccable the restaurant was nice and clean. the restroom was kept very spotless and the dessert was amazing we had a fabulous time and we will be back.

THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST STEAKHOUSES! I love the meat! They make it very well, no black spots it's just perfect! Juicy, crunchy whatever you want! The salad bar is ok, the tomato soup is very good! The salads are plain but still good for a snack before the meat comes in, it was my aunts birthday and I asked them to make it special and they made a little cake for her they also sang a happy birthday song! For desert I recommend to order the mousse cup both flavored the chocolate and fruit. I love this steakhouse and I RECOMMEND for you to go here it's beautiful in all ways!

I cried on my wedding day, and no, they were not tears of joy. I had dealt the entire time with Anna, who was in charge of event management. We agreed on all of the prices and everything was set in stone for my wedding reception. I gave her my credit card and asked her to charge the rest of my balance after I knew the final count. She responded to my email thanking me for giving her the credit card information and said she would charge my card. I was coming from Delaware so I wanted to take care of all of my payments before I arrived in Vegas so there wouldn't be any surprises. 

  All seemed to be going well during the reception. Everyone was having a good time and the waiters were attentive. All up until my brother comes up to me and tells me how they asked him for a credit card to pay. EXCUSE ME?? I went up to the manager and told him I paid Anna before I left. Oh, and where was Anna by the way? Not there of course. She didn't even show up to oversee anything. I told him I didn't bring my credit card with me. I thought all of this was already taken care of and my credit card info was in Anna's email. In the end, my parents had to give THEIR credit card info because I didn't bring mine stuffed in my dress (and mean, what did they think?) It was very upsetting and embarrasing. After emailing Anna the next day she tells me they don't normally charge your credit card until after the reception in case more people come than you plan. So why the hell didn't she tell me this?? Then I would bring my card with me!! The Dj ended up eating (and he was the only extra person we had) and of course we had no problem paying for him, but if they had just said that night "We need (so and so) money for your DJ it would have been a hell of a lot easier than them saying "We need thousands of dollars to pay for your entire reception party. It was very disorganized and handled completely incorrectly. And I still have yet to get a sincere apology out of anyone.     

    I regret having my reception there and wish I had gone with Pampas on the Strip or El Segundo Sol. Both had excellent communication and were very helpful. Honestly, even if it's a little more expensive it's worth going with somewhere on the Strip because after paying for transportation for all of your guests to get all the way to Via Brasil it evens out anyway! Also worth noting, we had our welcome party at La Salsa Cantina and it was EXCELLENT! Great service, the sweetest people to work with, and we had a blast! I even paid a little too much on my deposit because we had less people than I anticipated and it was refunded within a day. 

   Oh and one more thing...They still owe me $100! They had me down as having an extra guest that I didn't have. After emailing them 3 times to tell them this I don't feel it's worth my time, but just thought I would note that screw up too!        
  STAY AWAY!!

All you can eat...say what?

Since my boyfriend and I wanted to go on a fancy date we decided to give this place a shot since we did try Texas De Brazil and liked that place. Most of the people I have talked to about Via Brasil said it was way better, so why not try it.

Salad bar:
They had lobster bisque soup, white rice, salad, sauteed mushrooms, and yummy delicious items to choose from. (Beware: as tempting as it is don't go over board because you want to leave room in your tummy for some meat)

For all you meat lovers they have many different types of meats to eat. The Prime Rib and top sirloin was my favorite. Also, they do have Salmon, which I enjoyed. You also get to choose 3 sides to eat with your meat...we ordered the grilled asparagus, broccoli, and fried plantains. 

I would totally recommend this place! The staff was very friendly and the food was delicious!

I went for the brunch special at Via Brazil steak house, I was completely satisfied with every aspect of this experience. The protein servers were all professional and well spaced out. I don't like it when they stack up on me at the table. The salad bar had a great selection of brunch favorites and classic Brazilian cuisine. The Mimosa girl was a great addition and was a joy to have table side. Waffle and omelet station was also a great addition. Though a temporary set up, it looked professional and the staff stationed there were neat and the waffle toppings were awesome. The bar and wine display are really nice and looks very upscale. The waterfall by the private banquet area is also a great touch of class.

I have only one criticism about this place. The main dining area does have too much of a cafeteria feel. It is too open and bright it loses something in the dining experience. Maybe a darker flooring and window treatments can tie it all in. 

Besides that, if you want a great table side experience with great staff and food then this place for brunch is a great option with a great price.
Absolutly amazing food and customer service!!! I highly recommend this place. Steak picana was perfect and the fried bananas were cooked to perfection. High quality food and service. A+

2.2 stars.  Sorry, but no.  Excellent service of low quality, way over-salted food.  Salad bar had three kinds of lettuce but a very strange selection of other items.  I was trying to figure out just how to make a regular ol' salad with baby gerkins, radishes, and lettuce...is that a salad?  Not to me.  There weren't even any onions!  There were quite a few flies though.  Several were buzzing around the salad bar.  A few visited us over at our table, too.  Salmon and clams were very fishy smelling.  Even after drenching my seafood in lemon, I couldn't eat more than one bite of each due to the overwhelming fishiness.  
I feel bad fo the staff here.  They are trying very hard at this labor intensive set-up.  It's not their fault they have to serve such horrid crap but they do it with a smile.  $40 per person on this low quality for the Prime Rodizio is WAY over the top.  If they had more volume, they'd be able to turn the quality up and the price down.
I had a $15 gift card that I got in the mail, so we tried it.  Not worth it, even with the discount.  I am a foodie and regularly spend anywhere from $20-$200 per meal with no alcohol.  I can aslo handle McDonalds.  I could not handle Via Brasil.  I got a severe headache the next day, rare for me, which I believe is from the abundace of salt that I ate at Via Brasil.  Fortunatley, it went away after I guzzled lots of water.
I won't be able to go back to Via Brasil and I cannot recommend it.

I love Brazilian Steakhouses and have been to 3 others here in Vegas. Via Brasil is by far the best one I've been too. My experience there is always great and their food and customer service is superb. It's rare for me to go to a restaurant and enjoy everything they serve, but I can honestly say that I enjoy everything at Via Brasil. I would recommend this place if your looking for good food and a great atmosphere. Make sure to go on a empty stomach, because there is a lot of food!

My experience at Via Brasil was AWFUL. The service was slow and the food was nothing to write home about. You're better off going to Samba or Fogo de Chao where the service and food exceed Via Brasil's by far. This awful and regretful experience began as follows (this is a short version of what happened as I've omitted several other problems we experienced).  I had a fairly large party bringing in a fair amount of business into this unprofessional establishment.  When it came time to pay for the check, methods of payment were provided.  The waitress came back to my table and hand selected her choice of credit cards (neglecting the ones she didn't want to use) and OVERCHARGED each card by over $60 per card which EXCEEDED the check amount.  When I asked why she conducted the transaction this way she simply said, "that's just what I was told." I immediately asked her to correct the charges and provide correction for the wrong doing.  She came back twice still charging credit cards incorrectly.  To make matters worse, the manager lied and ended up charging me an unauthorized deposit.  The manager said the money would be placed back onto my credit card in 24 hours.  To this day, the money has yet to be refunded AND they charged an amount different from what was said would be charged.  The manager was rude, unprofessional and incompetent. She clearly doesn't know how to correct her wrongdoings so  she unprofessionally rushed my party out the door. This was by far the worse dining experience I've ever had.  If I were to rate this negative stars I would.  I highly advise anyone who is thinking of going to Via Brasil to avoid it and spend your money elsewhere. I would also urge the owner to fire the current manager who was present during our dining experience and hire a manager who is capable of handling and conducting him/herself in a professional and intelligent manner.
Amazing food!  Prompt service!!  Comfortable atmosphere!!  Can't say enough good things about this place.  First visit here and DEFINITELY will be here again very soon!

The beginning was great, then it went down hill.   Was told there were 18 types of meat, while we only got offered 8 types.  Never saw the other 10 missing types of meat.  We spent over $110 for two people on dinner and never got dessert or a coffee, everything is a la carte, (extra). I made a point to call them before I bought my two groupon coupons, but after we ate there the bill was an additional $35 on top of what I paid online.
Im disappointed we did not get to try the dessert & coffee.  No filet mignon, or veal was offered, where was the missing 10 meat types.???
Hands down BEST Brazilian restaurant in town.  Weekend brunch is phenomenal.  Eggs tri-tip Benedict is out of this world.
My all time favorite place in Vegas area. I go there for special occasions. Always happy with their meat selections and salad bar.
Great job!!! Atmosphere is excellent the meat .... AWESOME!!! I would definitely make this my restaurant of choice. If you love meat and plenty of yummy sides this is the spot!!

First off I will say I love Via Brazil as far as the food quality. I praise Via Brazil to everyone I know saying how great the quality of meat and salad bar drinks and dessert. 
Also, the facility is beautiful but the service is "okay" overall everyone is very nice but I was very disappointed the last time I was there.
On 11/7/14 (Friday night) I made reservations for my a birthday dinner for my boyfriend and his father... I called the day before making the reservation. Lets just say it was a process. I was put on hold for a moment after letting them know I needed to make a reservation, all fine and dandy right? A moment later a woman got on the phone with a very thick accent. As I was giving my information she could hardly understand what I was saying. I had to spell out every word. She started to get frustrated and I could tell so I asked if there was someone else I could talk to, she put me on hold without saying anything and another woman got on the phone. This lady spoke better English and the process sped up. Near the end of the conversation I let the second lady know that it was going to be a birthday celebration and specifically gave her the names of the two men. 
We arrived there early so decided to have a seat at the bar before dinner. The bartender was very nice and told the boys happy birthday after I had mentioned it. (2nd person I told) 
Then we went to our table and the dinner was very good as usual. After dinner they bring around a display of desserts that you can choose from. I thought maybe you have to pick a dessert then they put in a candle or something. I then loudly announced "birthday boys what would you like" as the waiter was standing next to our table. I casually said maybe some cheesecake? The waiter left & we were waiting for the celebration, instead the waiter brought the check which in total we spent over $300 and told us to have a good night...
As you can see there was no birthday celebration, candle, song, or anything of that nature.. VERY DISSAPOINTING.
When we were walking out my boyfriends mother and I approached the front desk person and let them know that we did not receive any birthday dedication and we were sadly disappointed seeing how I specifically made the reservations for this occasion and not to mention spend over 300 dollars!! 
She then said "im sorry, next time"........
Next time?? We did not make a scene or call the manager but I know now not to use this place for celebration. The customer service overall was rough and I thought for a higher end steakhouse we would get some type of acknowledgement.

I ate a sampling of their food at the Taste of Las Vegas Food Festival and was very disappointed.  The flavors were lacking, meat was tough and all around seemed to be of poor quality.  I'm not sure if this was just because of the venue however I would think they would want to make a great impression at the festival to drive more busiess to the regular restaurant.

Hubby and I came here on a spur of the moment - and boy were we glad we did!  From the warm & friendly greeting by the hostess to the cheery goodbye when we left, the service was impeccable and the food was beyond amazing.  The salad bar was ultra fresh and it could have been very easy to fill up on just that - excellent risotto and black beans/rice were top notch.  Now on to the meat - oh my goodness!  The prime rib and sirloin were the best but every morsel of meat was beyond delicious - even the lamb which I normally don't care for.  We are definitely looking forward to our next visit already :)

I highly recommend stopping in for happy hour at Via Brazil. The food was amazing and our waitress was very friendly. I ordered a caipirinha and it tasted just like the one I had when I had when I visited Brazil last summer. The crab cakes, lobster bisque and steak were so delicious! Much better than the other places in town. I cant wait to come back!

Delicious food and incredible customer service! The staff is very attentive and the pricing is reasonable. My fianc√© and I each ordered the Sterling dinner - such a variety of meats and flavors. You can customize the cooking of the meats per person right at the table, and the salmon just melts in your mouth. The sausage was our favorite (although, everything was tasty). As a side dish, you must order the friend bananas. In sum, this place is a must try!

Vegetarian's should just keep on walking !! Ive been there a number of times now and they have never disappointed.  The quality, flavor and large selection of items is second to none. This is a great place to go after a good workout!!! Just dont weight yourself after your done!  Friendly quick service , how can you beat ?

Very pleased with our experience. It was our anniversary and 2 birthdays to celebrate. The salad bar and unlimited sides were great. The 21 meats were moist and wonderfully prepared. The staff came round every couple of minutes, service was exceptional. Our complimentary champagne and desserts were appreciated as well. 

I definitely recommend this restaurant to all.

OMFG.. this place was a meat-fest!! I find myself not knowing where to start as I did when I sat down to start eating! 

First off, it is a pretty fancy restaurant. My boyfriend made reservations for his mom's birthday and he told us that we needed to dress "smart casual" which was on the website or something. We were all like.. "wtf is smart casual?". Anyway, it definitely isn't a jeans and t-shirt type of restaurant. The atmosphere is very nice and they have some nice waterfall type thing. It wasn't too busy for a Saturday night but it the live jazz music really set the mood (versus the corny christmas music they played while the two musicians took a break I'm guessing).

I started off at the salad bar which isn't only limited to "salad". They had rice pilaf, beans, beef carpaccio, artichoke hearts, hearts of palm, ravioli, risotto, and more. Everything was delicious and I was quite excited to try the beef carpaccio since I have never before. Really good and the saltiness of the parmesan cheese made it more palatable, in my opinion. (I love raw fish but always iffy when it comes to raw meat)

The waiters come around with their sticks of meat. My favorite was the sirloin.. omg.. it was soooo juicy and delicious. The flank was tough, dry and had no flavor. The prime rib was excellent. I have never tried lamb before and boy, that was goooood. I didn't get the chicken but I did try the bacon wrapped turkey which was ah, okay. Nothing special. But boy, that sirloin was winnahhhs! I'll be dreaming about that for a long time!

For dessert we got passion fruit mousse (too rich and sweet for me), creme brule, and flan. I am not a dessert person whatsoever.. so to me.. it was all too rich and sweet. 

Service is beyond excellent. They are very polite and quick! Always a "your welcome" when saying thank you. We asked one of the guys (manager, I'm guessing -- he was wearing a suit) for the fish since we hadn't seen it yet, and not even one minute later, the salmon came around. The bf's sister asked for the dessert menu and again, the desert cart came around within just a few seconds! 

Overall, their food is awesome and their service is even more awesome. Since the bf and I are poor college students, we can't afford to eat here too often.. but I'm glad that we decided to take his mom here.. the experience was definitely worth the money!
The supreme meat option is awesome. Plenty to eat, lots of variety. The staff was very polite.

The food was great.  Everything was cooked to perfection. The only negative I have is that they weren't prepared for the big parties that came with Easter Brunch. We'd arrived early for our reservation and had waited outside on their patio. They'd gotten confused with our reservation because we found that we had 1 more child so a party of 10 instead of 9 so they switched our reservation with another party and didn't explain the confusion or switch. There did seem to be a bit of disorganization which was quickly remedied when pointed out. All in all, a good experience but with some room for improvement.

I seem to be always here for happy hour but who can blame me?! The food is always really good and the prices are very reasonable. The guy at the bar is always super helpful and very attentive as well, especially when it gets busy and packed.

The customer service is so great but the food is super amazing.  Enjoying a wonderful passion fruit mango martini.  Filling up on all this meat. The spinach tastes so fresh.   Marinated mushrooms are very good but the fried bananas is so delightful!!!

Went to this place for Easter Brunch and had the worst service I have ever experienced. Had to wait 30 minutes past my reservation time. Ordered dessert and never received it but it made it to my bill. Salad bar is terrible, meat mediocre. Don't waste your time and money.
I love this restaurant! I had my birthday party their this past summer and the staff was fantastic! Food is always amazing and the happy hour specials are great too!

I'm not certain this is a fair evaluation.  The food and service was absolutely fabulous.  However, we went on Halloween Eve, and there was a DJ with music that was almost ear splitting in volume, and I have a hearing loss.  My party could hardly converse. The folks partying at the bar in costume, however, appeared to be having a great time.  We are going back when our hearing returns, and I will update this review.

This place was a great date night place. The staff was all very attentive and really catered to your needs. 

Right when you walk in, you feel this expensive atmosphere. The deal is like this, for one person it's about $43.00, so for me and my husband was about $86 for all the meat that we can fit in our belly. 

We decided to order some drinks - I had a Passion Fruit Brazilian drink and my hubby a Remy Martin on the rocks. Those alone were $36 so if you don't want to get a hefty bill, order water! Definitely recommend it to any of my friends

I really recommend this place for brunch, not only that, but dinner. I know there are other steak houses out there, however this establishment is all about customer service. I appreciate the owner and his wife being running around as well making sure everyone is happy. There food is so delicious! Please try it . waaay better than those other steak houses. Their employees are just so great!

Great selection of meats that comes by on skews...fill up till your hearts content.
The staffs are great and the service is great!!
Nonstop coming of both meat and request of food....lol..my tummy surrendered after an hour of devouring the meat and the rest of the food.
Boy, when you give them a green light of the meat to come, they come like flies!!!
And you better come here super hungry with lotsa spare to top it off with the desert!!!

We come here once per yr from San Diego. 
Fidel has has us coming back. The food is as awsome as his service. By the way the beef and baby back ribs are to die for. 

Thank you,

J.R. / the Burdick family.

Excellent customer service!!! The staff take care of you well making sure you get the meat you love and care you deserve.  Get up and they'll refold napkin. They do it all. The garlic steak is awesome. Save room for dessert because they have some great choices. I will definitely be back.

I was excited to spend Mother's Day trying a new place with my twelve year old daughter for dinner. Great customer service upon arrival as the hostess was able to get us in without a reservation. However, quickly took a turn with the misfortune of a negligent server. Took our drink order, water w/lemon, which he never brought. I had to ask another server to bring over. He followed up with very dry service once and asked if we needed anything else. I found myself pulling upon busers to assist for more water and bread basket. In fact, in closing of our meal, the buser is the one who asked if we wanted dessert as opposed to our servers closing of, "all done?" My daughter wanted to order a Shirley temple the entire course of our meal, sadly he never followed up after the water he never brought... Disappointing. The food however was enjoyable. A bit on the pricey side for poor service.

I moved out here three years ago and made reservations here for our first Valentine's dinner in Las  Vegas. Back then we waited more than an hour past our reservation time. Still not seated, we decided not to wait any longer and ate sushi.  We vowed never to frequent this establishment and we didn't up until this Valentine's day. Guess what?  Same thing happened. I was told I would have to wait an hour from my reserved time. I'm sure the hour would have turned into ninety minutes. We left the restaurant and found another place to dine. To the owner of this place...it's amazing you treat people like cattle by over booking thereby ruining our dinner plans. To those of you that have experienced the same situation, do as i will do, don't ever come here. We have choices of where to spend our money.

Loved the Brazillian meat carousel! I think I died and went to heaven when I encountered the "salad bar"!! Grilled Portabello mushrooms, Roasted red bell peppers and sooooo so much more flavorful little scrumptious melt in my mouth items! I especially loved the rack of lamb. The meat was so tender and juicy and had the right amount of savory golden crisp glaze  on the outside! The staff was amazingly friendly and sweet. We will definitely return for an encore!

Yum Yum Yummy Yum Fricken YUM!

I love this place and it was great memory for my wife and me. We celebrated our wedding reception here with 30 other people or so. The staff was very supportive and encouraging to all of us. The food was delicious! I do think their buffet bar can add some more variety, but in a Brasil restaurant it's all about the different meats they send your way anyway. The best thing I took away from the experience was the excellent service and delicious food. I would recommend this place to anyone who's planning their wedding reception.

Only one star because of the wait time and rudeness of the front end staff / management. We had a reservation that I showed up 20 minutes early for but was sat an hour after our reservation time. Another party that had a "3:30pm" reservation arrived 20 minutes late and was sat before us. I understand it was a holiday but I do feel that management could have been a little more prepared and not made us wait so long. When we were finally taken over to a table, it was small, not fully setup and there were 7 seats for a party of 8. When we asked if we could use the small table next to us we got attitude and said it was reserved. I said we had a reservation too and have waited for an hour. The lady said "oh so now you have 8 people" very rudely. I said no, we always had 8!! Finally after a bunch of back and forth (which should have never been) we were able to pull the table over and add to our table. Maybe they could have comped one meal or the drinks for the inconvenience  but not even an apology, just attitude!

The plus, the meats were really good and the guys carving the meat were very friendly. Could have used more sides but our server was busy and understandably since it was a holiday. 

Maybe we will come back, just never ever again on a holiday. 

Management - take note, when you realize your guests are upset, don't respond with rudeness and attitudes. Offer a free drink or desert. Make up for the bad experience so that you will have return guests!
Amazing customer service on point and food was amazing I never felt so happy and satisfied from a Resturant every penny was worth it..abregado!!!
Amazing!!!!! If you haven't tried it your missing our big time.....Customer service is out of sight do me a favor try it you won't be disappointed...

This is my favorite spot to take my family or employess here for steak. We had the 50 dollars deals.
Service - 5 stars. Drinks were served and refilled properly. Managers came to ask us for specific items we want and ensure they come out quickly. We did not have to wait. Plates were replaced often since there are more than 16 kinds of meats to enjoy.
Food - 5 stars. The steaks beats Sls, Lawrys many expensive steak houses on the strip and in the casinos such as Bellagio, Encore, Aria. I prefer this place over Texas the Brazil due to their very selective salad bar. You have to try the beef capaccio and many other items from the salad bar. Other steaks worth trying like NY, Tritip, Garlic steak, etc... they all come juicy, hot and delicious. I will never go to a regular steak house ever since their steaks will get cold half way due to the large steaks they serve. This is the inherent advantage of brazilian steak house.
Ambience - 5 stars. It is cozy and family oriented. It is not a bar. We always feel very welcome here. This is our 5th time in 3 months.

This is actually the first ever Rodizio I have ever tried, and I was really happy with the experience. The service was awesome, and it isn't that pricy for lunch. I didn't try the salad bar because I wanted to leave room in my tummy :) I loved the cheese bread (or whatever it's called) they bring to you when you first sat down; and out of all the different meats, my favorite was the sirloin. Sides taste pretty good too. I think the only thing that bugs me is its location since it's so far from the strip.

The food here is good. But don't order for delivery. You get a sloppy order with a FRACTION of what you get when you dine in. I ordered the beef carpaccio, among other things, and got 1/4 of what Ive ordered when dining in and they didn't even bother to include the crostini. Total rip off.

Have been coming to Via Brazil for a year now and they haven't disappointed me.  Fridays and Saturdays feature live contemporary jazz during dinner and their Sangria Rojas is a tasty accompaniment to the parade of succulent meats that make their way around the room.  The salad bar/buffet comes with the Rodizio meal(meats and salad bar
) or you can just partake of that alone and everything they serve is delicious.  The service is exceptional and I always feel like a princess when I'm there!  They also feature a happy hour mini Rodizio but iff all you want is to hang out at their awesome bar, the brazilian appetizers are great!

Not great at all, meat took forever to come around, beans had no flavor, the drinks were small n tooo strong to be enjoyable.... n it was hott in there, we were all sweating and eating, even had to ask for ice to cool down. they were obviously saving energy, poor servers were sweating n so nice.... Not pleasurable experience, wont be back. In our 4 opinions, we defenitly love Fogo de Chao more n their drinks are wonderful n worth the price, honestly. We spent over 250.00, way to pricey for a negative experience.

If I'm going to drop fifty dollars a head for dinner, I should absolutely be allowed to take my leftovers home. I paid for that food and it technically belonged to me. I just wanted to box up ONE plate. if I had known the Brazilian Steakhouse was cool with throwing away loads and loads of perfectly good food, I would've just ordered a bowl of lobster bisque.

Lobster bisque was good but could've been thicker, the bread rolls were ok, the top sirloin, turkey wrapped in bacon and sausage were my particular favorites but most of the meat was excellent. The side dishes were an absolute joke. We ordered fried bananas, the asparagus, the spinach and the rice side dish with the intention of sharing amongst the seven of us, which turned out to be impossible because they're single serving side dishes only. Restaurant was Pricy and ambient noise was loud enough to drown out companions waitstaff and others. 

Atmosphere was pleasant, the company was great so I did have an enjoyable time but I will not be returning, nor would I recommend via brazil

Very clean & neat -though dark & lacking life/atmosphere. 
The food was great w no complaints- it was funny to have garlic bread brought around as if it was meat.. Lol
I'm sorry but the atmosphere at Fogo De Chao wins.

I wish there was a negative rating because if there was this place would get it! Worst experience at a Brazilian Steakhouse, ever. My husband paid the extra $$ to get the "best" meat, of which he got none. Our waiter was amenable until my husband started asking where the chicken hearts and Leg of Lamb were, then he was conspicuously absent. After asking three different people for these items the manager showed up. Things went from bad to worse. He proceeded to make inane excuses and argue with my husband as to why the chicken hearts etc were not being served. About this time the "leg of lamb" appeared. Leg of lamb it was not. My husband knows leg of lamb. It got so ridiculous we ask for our check, with still no apology, and proceeded to leave. On the way out I stopped to get the name of the owner so I could complain. I noticed the girl was looking over my shoulder I turned in time to see the manager gesturing to her! He rushed over at this point and told me he was the owner and to take our business elsewhere! No problem $158 down the drain. If this gentleman was the owner I feel sorry for the employees and anyone who dares to venture into this ripoff, sorry excuse for a Brazilian Steakhouse. Would we return? NO!

I love this place! I can eat healthy with the happy hour menu which is wonderful. The food is exceptional in the dining room. Great Quality for the price. I look forward to working in Summerlin. So I can eat here.

Zero Start if it's Possible.
Service and Food was Good, not a big deal, but one thing that make me do this Review was about how annoyed I was while eating.
The manager ( Ana ) was super annoying, we didn't have a chance to finish our salad and she was asking if we have any request for the meats.
All I wanted was to enjoy my wine and salad before starting the meats, but every 5 minutes she was on our table trying to get some request from us. Super pushy! Made me feel like she didn't want us to be there. She was annoying the other 4 tables next to mine with the same thing, asking REQUESTS. The Restaurant wasn't busy at all and one thing that I saw that grossed me out was, the same manager ( Ana ) made one of our meat servers clean the floor because he dropped some blood from the meat in the floor. Then she made him come back and serve us.
That for me was the end of the line! Health department should take a look at this. If she does this in the front of the house, can you imagine what goes on in the back? 
The good news is that FOGO DE CHAO will open a Restaurant in Summerlin really soon. Now locals will have the REAL Brazilian steakhouse experience & enjoy ourselves  like we deserve, for almost the se Price.

The best churrascaria restaurant I've been to.  Above all the tender meat brought to our table was the service at Via Brasil.  Fidel was our server but it was a nice surprise that everyone helped serve our table.  It wasn't just the meat that was amazing but everything from sides to salad bar too.  I recommend going to Via Brasil if ever in the Summerlin area. You don't have to hassle with the traffic of going to the strip & even though OUR party was a little late for our reservation, we were seated within 5 min. Great place, worth a 5 star rating.

Took my bestie there for his birthday tonight and the service, the food and everything was great. Brandon was so helpful it made everything even better. The salmon, ohhhhh do not pass it up even if you are not a "fish person". So good! Oh and the beef flank is yummy. Lots of choices on the salad bar, they will just keep bringing you those sides and that meat- they don't mind if you need a break. Just flip your card over! We were there for over 2.5 hours and never felt rushed even when they got oobber busy! Great wine choices, even for the picky people!!! Go Go GO!!!

Made a reservation at 11:30 to take my wife for Mother's day.  This place was a fiasco. Very unorganized and understaffed for being a busy day.  We waited 45 minutes past our reservation.  We got a bunch of excuses as to why we were not being sat. Anna was rude and obviously overwhelmed with taking care of a large crowd.  She may want to apply at McDonald's. She is definitely out of her league here.  Was a shame. Was looking forward to eating here since we read other reviews about the food. The service was so bad we left and went to another steak house.

Had dinner at via Brazil steakhouse, first time there. Impressed with nice spread and variety on salad bar so much that we decided to skip the roaming waiters with their luscious cuts of meat, poultry and fish. Will have to come back for that part of the menu!  The service was excellent, very friendly and accommodating servers! They also have a great cocktail bar setting and a Sunday brunch that is well worth the small price!!

Just had my daughters 16th birthday party at Via Brazil and there is no way I can say enough here to show them how much we appreciate everything they did not only for us but all our guests.  First Anna was fantastic always on top of everything and anticipating everything we would need prior to our needing it.  The servers were absolutely amazing, it was a flawless dinner I was very impressed that they treated the 15-16 year olds there as adults and with respect.  They not only took care of 50 or so of us at dinner but also cut and served the cake for us.  Everyone from the kids to the adults were very impressed with everything you did and I would like to thank you for making her party the success it was.  I can't neglect to mention your hostess she was also amazing and we received many compliments how cheerful and helpful she was for our guests.  I have to apologize for not remembering your names, I was a little distracted that night.  We will always do our parties, get togethers or just dinner with you.   Thank you so much!

Went for Mother's Day Brunch, which was $34.99 each. It was okay, the only disappointments for me were their salad bar and the sides... both were just eh. Salad bar seemed small to me. Especially after my only other Brazilian Steakhouse experience being Fogo De Chao, which was absolutely mind-blowingly amazing. Anyway, Via Brasil's meats were delicious, and I didn't need any extra seasoning or sauce. The service was decent, and the restaurant itself looked clean and classy.

Great restaurant!!!! My husband and I went for Valentines day and let me just say that the atomosphere was perfect.  Candlelite, very romantic tables.  Great service and even better food.  Love it, can't wait to take my son back so that he can try all the great meats!

My daughter held her wedding reception here last night with friends & family that traveled from California and Chicago and I was amazed with our dining experience. Anna helped my daughter arrange everything through emails & when we had our first in-person meeting the day before our event, everything was exactly the way we wanted it. We had a group of 30 people and every guest felt like they were the only one in the restaurant. The food was outstanding, fresh and presentation was impeccable. Clean plates were provided readily & without prompting, the open bar drinks were delicious...its extremely difficult to pinpoint favorites but several guests raved about the lobster bisque, prime rib, garlic steak, turkey wrapped with bacon, warm garlic & cheese bread, mozzarella served warm & gooey, flank steak....EVERYTHING was wonderful. I highly recommend Via Brasil for any & all of your dining needs.

Ok. I'm not exactly a newbie when it comes to brazilian steakhouses. I enjoyed my experience here and savored the special touches. The server pulled my seat for me and pushed it to the table and placed my napkin on my lap. At one moment, I had dropped a few crumbs and was going to clear them, a server came over with a special rake to take care of the crumbs. 

The food was delightful. On the salad bar, I loved the aspargus risotto, scalloped potatoes, grilled asparagus, fresh mozarella, and marinated arthichokes. The grilled items: corn on the cob, mozarella, pork tenderloin, sirloin, tri tip, baby back ribs, beef ribs, and prime rib. 

The service here is a cut above some of the others, in my opinion.

I went back to Restaurant again ! 
And I had a great time this time (^ ^) 

Even tho I went there last minute last seated / close time .. But stuff never made us feel hurry up or not enough time, not enough food because we came late .. 

We had alooooooooot of food and food was soooooo delicious as usual !!!!

I love all of skewer but I love their shrimp and melt cheese is very special for me cuz I can't get other restaurants these two things ! 

Anyway I still like this restaurant and I wanna go back anytime we want to have a Brazilian big BBQ dinner !!

Excellent atmosphere and food.  All you can eat of the best tasting meats in the universe. You must try this resturant, you won't be sorry. Start with the salad bar then, all the meats you can eat from steak to heavenly tasting chicken and so many o5her meqts you probably can't even think of.

We come here all the time. You can't beat the food and the service. Ask for Fidel he is amazing, he is always there to get what ever you need.
I recommend everyone to come here and share in this experience

This was my first experience at a Brazilian steakhouse.  Quite fun!  LOVED the lobster bisque soup!  My favorite.  The meats were endless, but my favorites were the sausage, the seasoned steak and the turkey wrapped in bacon.  It was a fun and different experience that I would enjoy repeating.  Our waitress was very good and personable.

I cannot put into words how amazing this place was. My husband and I were married at Always & Forever Wedding Chapel (review coming) and didn't have any desire to do an actual reception. I found this restaurant online and they were AMAZING. They arranged transportation for our entire party from the chapel to the restaurant, and back to the strip. We were in the private room and it was perfect. The staff was attentive, fun, energetic, and so polite. It was almost like I wasn't in Vegas anymore. For 89.99 a person we had unlimited meat....excellent, yummy, and a choice of 20 meats....and unlimited premium drinks for 2 hours. The food was phenomenal. The experience was fun for all our guests and everybody had a wonderful time...it was perfect. 
Anna, the event coordinator, was so great! She was there to greet our party, explain how the process works, and made sure every need was met. I can't recommend this restaurant enough...it was the perfect way for us to celebrate our wedding with all our family and friends.
Better than Texas de brasil. Still expensive but it was a ton of food, it just kept coming

I will never recommend this place, they have the worst management ever, the staff is nice but they don't know what is happening. They all seemed confused. They charged us $12 per person for entry because they had a brizilian festival in the parking lot, but when you sit in the resturant you can't see the show, and they have a band inside singing conflicting with the festival music outside for salsa dancing. It's was so noisy and uncomfortable. And they have a no "re-entry policy".

The salad bar is ok. The meat is not that good. They didnt have filet mignon or lamb althought its on the menu. It's the one of the worst resturants I have been to.

I don't write negative reviews, but I wouldn't want anyone to have this bad experience.

I don't think there's anything about this place that couldn't be described as a homerun.  Really, great food with great service.  If you come for brunch, I highly suggest the bacon-wrapped filet.  Mmm.
Very disappointed.  Unprofessional.  Overpriced.  This place is a ripoff.  Lack of customer follow-up.  This business won't last.

First time in this restaurant and was feeling like home. As a traditional brazilian girl I love rodizio style and this restaurant offer so many types of meat, my plate was always full of meat and the side dishes are amazing, I almost got all of them because I miss brazilian food so much and in Vegas is so hard to find a good and authentic food. The salad bar had a good variety as well and a lot of hot dishes like chicken milanese my favorite.

The servers were amazing, my table was always clean, my water glass was never empty and the wine was perfect. An amazing combination for a perfect dinner.

Coming back soon to try the brunch that sounds really attractive, Rodizio + Breakfast. Will stay there for at least 2 hours

I LOVE THIS PLACE! As soon as you walk in the door, you know there is class behind the operation, and class indeed it is at its finest. The hostess and staff are always friendly, on-the-spot and very professional as well as personable and fun - yet it is not expensive.


DO YOURSELF A FAVOR - if you haven't yet, go in and see for yourself how amazing Via Brasil Steakhouse and everything about it is! I have visited many times and have had the wonderful and always perfect rodizio dinner, which is ridiculously beyond words and well worth the nominal price; I'm going to focus on another aspect of this paradise in the south Summerlin area of Las Vegas - their happy hour. 

SATISFACTION - It began with a group gathering reserved in their private room, and I was so impressed with the hospitality, service, food and prices that I decided to arrange with the owner a happy hour with a social group. 

Since then, I have held the same get-together there at least monthly, and I am a regular there on my own. Here is why:

TRY IT, YOU'LL LIKE IT - Every menu item (over 30) is specially priced during happy hour, which lasts longer than most "bar" happy hours: 5pm-close, Sun-Thu; 5pm-8pm, Fri-Sat. Everything I have tried is spectacular, and our members love the place, so we continue to return. The selection of food, spirits and wines from around the world and all this restaurant has to offer is a reflection of the owners, who are awesome, kindred people!

YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED - Dressy or casual (respect yourself). The list of what I have always enjoyed at Via Brasil Steakhouse is too immense to list. Here is the link to their website:  http://viabrasilsteakhouse.com/

Everything was excellent...salad bar was top notch but try not to load up on the hot dishes if you want to make room for the meats. My faves were the beef ribs, garlic top sirloin and filet wrapped in bacon. I love the option to choose your sides, too (yucca fries were great). They also had servers going around with some type of baked mozzarella and hot garlic bread. 

The only thing that bothered me early on was the GM (the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars).I received a buy one get one free email for being part of the e-club. I gave my email when making the reservations. Apparently they wrote the email address incorrectly but the GM approached us at our table (as we were barely starting to eat our salads) accusing me of using someone else's coupon because my email wasn't in their database. I repeated my email address to make sure he had the right one but he didn't bother listening or double checking. So I said I can show the email on my phone and he immediately said I probably had someone forward it to me. After showing the email on my phone which was obviously sent to me directly, he realized they wrote the email wrong. He didn't really apologize for his mistake nor his approach. It made us feel uncomfortable but we chose to ignore it so we could enjoy our meal. Other than that, all the servers and front staff were very friendly. A sincere apology from the GM would have been nice.

I had the pleasure to dine at Via Brasil at least 4 times and let me tell you how amazing this place is:
I love the atmosphere love the events that they plan thru out different times of the year. Big screen for soccer it's amazing. 
However, the meats are just delicious, salad bar is rock star, service is better every time I eat at Via Brasil, got to love the wine list & cocktail list, all together a class act operation one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.
Plus the owners are super cool writing this review makes me want to go there for dinner tonight.
Love, love, love Via Brasil.

Went here for dinner to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and I gotta say it was a wonderful experience! The food was delicious and service was awesome. Carollin was so friendly and attentive! Definitely will come again if/when we return to Vegas!

I went to this place with high hopes being that it won Best of Las Vegas. I was very disappointed. I can not say the food was bad but for the price should have been much better. The prime rib, top sirloin and flank steak were all the same tough. The staff was the only part of the evening that was good. Very attentive and helpful. If this place was only $20 instead of $43 I would consider going back. For the little extra I will stick with Texas de Brazil.

My husband & I are big big meat lovers! 

We frequent Via Brasil not only for delicious meats but also for EXTRAORDINARY service! Texas de Brazil nor Fogo de Chao can compare to the attentiveness of every staff member! 

Via Brasil's service cannot be compared, that alone keeps us coming time & time again!

What a great dining experience! Outstanding salad bar and side dishes and the meats were out of this world. Little secret dish - try the pesto bread dip sauce in the mashed potatoes! What sets this place apart from the other Braziilian Steakhouses is that most of the employees are from Brazil and really care and are knowledgable. Also, the price is about 1/3 less then the others. Give yourself a treat and check this place out!
Great Happy Hour.  The flank steak and chimichurri sauce were amazing and the cocktails were great, but dangerous - they went down way too easily.

Salad bar was little to be desired. They bring the cheapest cuts of meat. I asked for shrimp for over an hour and they finally tried to bring me two shrimp, ha! They were tasty but come on two grilled shrimp? The filet mignon was wrapped in limp bacon and the size of a fifty cent piece. They are not worth my time, Texas De Brazil spins circles around this place. Never again.

Went here for our monthly visit and for Mother's Day. As always the food was great. The service was over the top. Fidel was on top of his game today making sure we had everything we needed before we needed it. Great job. Anna was as friendly as always. Hands down the best Brazilian steakhouse in Las Vegas.

Don't eat at the salad bar. It's just filler. Overall, if you are in Vegas, and can get here, you should go. This is a meat lovers dream. So much good food and great, attentive service. Not a place for veagans. The atmosphere is very spacey and open. Hope to eat here again soon.

Great for this type of restaurant.  Meats were actually cooked well considering the volume and method of service.  I would say only 2 types of meat came out overcooked.  The bacon wrapped turkey was overly salty.  The restaurant was practically empty, could have been because it was a Thursday? But the buffet was still fresh and the meats still came out as if cooked just for us.  Overall this place fulfills your need for variety without giving up too much in terms of quality.  Atmosphere can use a little work, I know its Vegas but this place is borderline tacky.  Wine recommendation was fabulous.

I have to say that you're service sucks! I had a reservation on the 14th for 7:30. We got their and the host said they were running 30 minutes behind. I came back after 40 minutes. She still said the place was extremely busy that they were just sitting the 7:15 reservations. It would take another 30 minutes. I don't understand how there were 4 empty tables and no one was sitting anyone down. No supervisor present and what really sucks is that my wife wanted to really come to this restaurant. Had family out visiting us and they also left disappointed. No apology from anyone and what should be really embarrassing to you all is that I am in the restaurant industry and I actually wanted to take charge of your restaurant and apologize to your guest. And I bet no one even apologize nor gave anyone a discount for such service. What really sucks is that no one from your company will reach out.

In comparison to other brazilian steak houses this place was ok. Ok because the meat kept coming as quickly as i put it my mouth until i said no more. However, the salad bar was lacking in everyway it lacked 90% of what texas de brasil had. period. It sucked to the 10th degree. Whats the deal with ordering the side dishes separately, why not just place it in the salad bar. Its management trying to control cost i believe or trying to make you feel your getting more than usual than other places. Lastly the WAITER was nice but the way they present the way you should eat was shocking. Here is what the head waiter said. i will paraphrase " go ahead and eat the salad bar first and when you done i will bring another plate so you can start eating meat" REALLY SERIOUSly ???U never want to say fill yourself with you pathetic salad bar and when your almost full then you can eat meat. WE WERE AMAZED AT THAT REMARK. I guess it came from management because you never say that to a customer. you should just simply say enjoy the salad bar and start eating all the meat you want. This place is a bit pretentious they should just keep it real and not try to be something better than "the other guys" because it was not.

Update: after posting my last review I was offered a free meal and a refund on the over charge. A wonderful gesture. We happily enjoyed the meal with much better service then. However, we were never given the refund. I had multiple emails saying they would refund it that night but nothing ever happened. It seems like that experience perfectly sums up Via Brasil, trying but falls short.

I went here on a date with my boyfriend and ate here for my first time the other night and everything was absolutely incredible! We walked in without having any reservations and were greeted and seated right away. The hostess was super friendly and informative.

 Shortly after being seated we were greeted by our server. He had a charming personality and thoroughly explained how everything worked.

We then headed for the salad bar and they had so many wonderful choices. They had options between salad, appetizers, meats & cheeses, pasta, chicken, soup, and more. I got the Alfredo pasta, potato sald, seafood salad,  and bruschetta. My favorite thing was the seafood salad. It tasted so fresh and was just simply amazing. 

After eating the salad bar options, we then started the meat service. (We also had the Pao De Queijo brought to our table as soon as we sat down-which is bread with a cheese center). The meat was absolutely phenomenal and so many options. I got things like beef short ribs, grilled shrimp, lamb, new york, rib eye, filet wrapped in bacon, turkey wrapped in bacon, pork, Brazilian sausage, picanha, and there was so many more that I can't entirely remember. My favorites were definitely the turkey wrapped in bacon and the grilled shrimp. All of the meat was juicy and full of flavor. We also got some side dishes of friend bananas and sauteed mushrooms. They were incredible. 

Our server made sure to check in on us to see how everything was, made sure we always had water in our glasses, made sure we had certain meats brought to our table (and at the exact temperature we requested) and brought out our side dishes right away. The manager also personally stopped by and introduced herself and made sure everything was to our liking as well, she was so sweet. 

We finished off our meal with banana flambe, and it was just spectacular. 

For the price of the meal we got we received meats, side dishes, and we were able to eat from the salad bar all you can eat, it was definitely worth it. 

I will be returning multiple times cause everything passed my expectations. I also plan on booking a private event here in the near future as well. 

If you're a meat lover, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND checking this Brazilian steakhouse house out. You won't be disappointed

Two words: Happy hour.

Their food is on-pointe, and with happy hour prices, it doesn't get much better than this.

A word of advice tho: avoid it during the holidays.  Service gets spotty during those times.

Really liked it! The meats were the best, delicious & tender! The lobster bisque was amazing! They have a waffle/egg bar, we had a waffle prepared while we waited, so warming and delicious! The best service ever, quick and friendly! Great Sunday Brunch for the price! We'll be back!

I have been here 3 times and every time has been such a great experience. The staff is so welcoming and always friendly and knowledgeable. We always get the $50 option and every option is delicious. Absolutely no complaints with this place.

Service is exceptional. Everyone is so friendly and constantly making sure all of your needs are met. The food is delicious and if there is something you want that they are not bringing around, all you have to do is ask and it will be table side in no time. The options on the salad bar are definitely more then just salad my family enjoyed the clams and the goat cheese stuffed jalape√±os. The Parmesan and mozzarella bread they bring before your meal is very good and gluten free since it is made with yucca instead of flour. Must try, highly recommended!

Yes it's pricey but it's so worth it! I just came back from the lunch here and I think I paid about $40/person and the tip. I've been to approx 5 different churrascaria restaurants in 3 different cities, but this is by far the best. I love everything here, especially lamb, garlic sirloin, fish (salmon), fried banana, risotto, and caramel flan. This place does train their service stuff well. You may feel that someone is always watching you when you eat, but as soon as you finish eating, drop a fork, or empty the water glass, someone always come right away to accommodate your need. I asked the server if he's got any lamb, and even though there was only 4 of us in the restaurants that time, he went back to the kitchen and prepare one just for us. Managers are also very friendly. Ambience here is sophisticated... subtle Brazilian music, spacious floor plans, contemporary objects, perfect for someone's birthday party or dinner date. I'd love to come back soon, but first I have to digest the food first.

Went there for the first time last week with my nephew, husband and son. When we are craving Brazilian Steak Houses, we would always go to Texas de Brazil at Town Sq. But we had a certificate so figured we try it out....when calling to make the reservation, the hostess joined us up for their email club, and when she asked for my birthdate and saw my birthday was the week before, told me we would get my meal comped due to it being my birthday month. Or If your a first time customer, you receive 20% of your whole bill.

Food was delicious and their prime rib was the best I or my family, have ever had!!!

And the service, was amazing and rivaled any 5 star restaurant!!!

Definitely give this place a try! You won't be disappointed.
Incredible service. Great salad bar with unusual items. The meat is as tender as can be. Favorite restaurant. Exceptional service from waiters to management.

Best Happy Hour in Las Vegas....In Summerlin at the corner of Ft. Apache and Charleston. 

Via Brasil offers good quality and provides great service. Have tried their Rodzilian dinner with beautiful salad bar and lovely meats, Sunday Brunch  (includes the same menu) and Happy Hour..  Beautiful room - more restful than the competition and very attentive service and friendly bartenders. . 

Happy Hour customers agree with me it's the best one in Las Vegas even with their recent price increases. .  Beer, wine, well drinks, mojitos and Capirinhas  range  from $4 - $6 dollars during HH.   HH Food is generally  small plates with some entree alternatiaves.   . Very large HH menu.  Some of my favorite dishes: Caesar Salad 4.50  (best in town and good portion) you can add chicken or steak to make it a meal.  Beef Carpaccio 6.50,  Asparagus Risotto  6.50 (large portion), They also have small portions of the steakhouse options which are yummy.  Restaurant has a lot of options for group events as well (Private dining room etc...)

This is a family run operation. The son and his wife manage this location and are always welcoming and friendly.  Friendly customers. This is my go to spot in Vegas.   Sign up for their email club and receive $25.00 off your first visit!

We waited 30 minutes after our reservation time . Meat was just ok. Salad bar wasnt much of a salad bar ... Service was the worst I ever experienced . Felipe was the worst server I had.  He ditched us in the middle of us eating so we were confused on who was our server . We order dessert and never got it . I wouldn't waste my time going there .

Went there for happy hour and fell outside and fractured my wrist in 3 places. Instead of coming out to see if I was okay they came out and started taking pictures of me like I was going to sue them or something.  The mojitos were excellent though and the happy hour food was good. I went back again with my cast and had dinner with my girlfriend for her birthday.  The service was extremely slow and the food was so so. I haven't been back.

What can I not gush about this place, 5 Star all the way! The food is delicious and plentiful. Every time I have been there I have never waited more than 5 minutes for a meat dish to come by the table. The wait staff is very professional and attentive. I never went without a refill of ice tea, even when the place was packed and jamming.

If you are worried about price they also have a locals night on Thursday and lunch on Sunday with discounted rates. Even at full price it is worth it. Bonus kids 5 and under are free.

If you want to get snu snu later in the evening, then take your date here.

Amazing food!!! Highly recommend, my favorite meat  is the House Sirloin, I went with my friend and we have had a great dinner. A pleasant place and nice friendly service.  Can wait to come back!! The best  steakhouse in Las Vegas!!!

Being a virgin to Brazilian style steakhouse dining, I was a bit nervous. This place is great! GO HUNGRY! There are soooo many meats that you will be so stuffed. Take time and enjoy it. We were in a party of 6 so the waiters were constantly circling through offering the next meat. At times it was overwhelming, but once you get the hang of it (flipping your card to start/stop service) it was pretty fun! Definitely recommend.

Via Brasil is an amazing restaurant. I went there for my birthday, which we also combined with my dad and best friends'. As soon as we enter we were kindly greeted by the hostess and taken to our table. Then as soon as we sat down the waiter was already filling our water glasses and welcoming us. We then made our way to the appetizer bar which is full of tons of different appetizers, soups, and salads. My favorite from the appetizer bar was the chicken marsala and the lobster bisque. Once, we were ready for meats they brought out so many different flavorful meats and all of them were exceptional ! Once we were so stuffed from all the food, they brought us out cheesecake with a candle in it and sang happy birthday. By far the best birthday dinner that I have been to. Since then, my mom and I go to their happy hour every other week and we absolutely love it.  Such an amazing restaurant and we absolutely love Anna!

I had a horrible experience there Sept. 26, 2013 during happy hour.  I was in a group of 25 people from meetup.com that met there that night. Everything was going fine till at the very end as I finishing up my final drink.  We ran individual tabs and I already paid my tab.  Apparently because I was one of the last to leave the table I was accosted by a Via Brasil employee about someone else in the group whom I did not personally know who did not pay her tab and the employee demanded me to pay her tab.  I told him I already paid mine and I shouldn't be penalized because of a deadbeat I didn't personally know.  Then I started being treated like I myself was a deadbeat because the whole staff subsequently circled me and threatened the police on me if I didn't pay.  I looked around and noticed everyone else in the group was gone.  I had no choice but to pay and I ended up doing so by slamming the money to pay for the deadbeat's tab on the table and I let them know that they were over the top on me and they don't care about potential future business they could have received from me.  I let the group leader know by email about the experience later that night and the next day she did meet me and paid me back, which was nice.  Over the next several days I called Via Brasil to speak with the owner to discuss my bad experience because the staff was so hard up about collecting the money from me even if I did not personally owe them that money...I was told each time the owner was not there and I left messages that went unreturned.  The same occurred with an email I sent to the owner.  Via Brasil should be ashamed for hiring people who will use extreme measures to get their money even from people who don't personally owe a tab left behind by someone else.

My siblings and I surprised our parents with a dinner reservation here for their birthdays, and they both had a wonderful time. Reserving a table was very easy, and we requested that the servers wish our parents happy birthday in the most "attention-arousing way possible." The waiters brought out platters with my parents' names written in chocolate, and trick candles that would not blow out. All of the staff were incredibly friendly, the food was incredible, and my parents both had an amazing experience.

The company at which I intern for occasionally hosts work dinners at Via Brasil, and we always have an incredible experience. I have been to Texas de Brazil many times, and while they are both viable options, I prefer the setting and location of Via Brazil slightly more. Via Brasil is typically less crowded and less expensive, and the food is equally incredibly as that of Texas de Brazil.

Altogether, Via Brasil is a perfect option for dinner any day of the week, and the staff are always very friendly and willing to accommodate any special needs/requests. One specific waiter even remembered my meat preferences during my dinner, and offered me "well-done" portions of each of the meats. Via Brasil is highly recommended by me, my family, and the company at which I work.

Love this place! Surpasses Fogo de Chao and Texas de Brazil bar none! Food is always on point and the service is beyond expectations. Felipe,Fidel and Gerardo are always very accommodating and greet us with nothing but Joy! Defiantly a good go to place that never fails!

OH....MY....GOSH..... sooooo AWESOME!
gal pals Susan and Justin went with me to eat at Via Brazil. We started by ordering a pitcher of PINEAPPLE SANGRIA. 
The glass was 9 bucks and the pitcher 23.00  didn't take a rocket scientist to figure out which one to order.  It was delicious, so tasty , remarkable white wine and fruit sangria that really went well with what was to come. 
Since I am a carnivore, and this is a carnivores dream- I have to say it was amazingly good. The salad bar had so many tasty items - I don't suggest filling up on these ... because the main attraction is the meat. 
and ohhhh the meat was soooo good. 
They start your meal with these little cheesy rolls .. they are like a hot chewy cheezit. YUM!
Then the salad bar... Parade of meat. 
Our server was completely awesome wish I could remember his name. 
We had a great time and even a fit of giggles from being so ECCLECTIC! 
Pricey so this is a once in awhile treat - but have to say it is worth every penny. I would go back just for the sangria... but the meal is so yummy I would HAVE to stick around for that too. 
Vicious Cycle. 
I suggest trying it ... eating is believing.

We always love to come here. Tonight we came for my birthday and I was also awarded a $25 off coupon in my email. The sides all come included. I recommend the fried bananas because its almost like a dessert at the end of your meal. Yum!!

This is an update to a former review I had written. I have come to this restaurant at least six times with my family since our first visit.  Yesterday I took my husband there for Father's Day, what a huge disappointment..  We kept returning because the service was always so nice and of course the food is delish. But yesterday the service was nothing short of TERRIBLE. The waiter stopped by only a few times. That meat service was only coming around every so often. Not constant like before. They were rotating the pineapple around like crazy though... The meat service was VERY slow. We tried to order the sides (mashed potatoes, etc) and the server tried talking us out of it since he said the kitchen was taking forever to get them out. We ordered mashed potatoes, asparagus & fried bananas. We were brought out asparagus and mashed potatoes, no bananas. We did not get our sides until the end, after we were done. We were so fed up with the service that my husband asked for the check and wanted to leave. The meal took 1.5 - 2 hours (and not due to the fact that we wanted it to last that long) to get our slices of meat to fill our bellies.  The check was $160 for 4 people (brunch prices, we typically spend over $200 due to dinner prices) and we felt so ripped off. We expect a certain level of service when we pay that amount of money for a meal... not to mention it ruined my husband's Father's Day meal.  Don't think we will be returning.

Amazing! The staff is friendly and very knowledgeable of their menu. They offered a great selection of perfectly cooked meats. Their salad and pasta bar is dangerously delicious... save room for the meats! They have an impressive wine list as well as a delectable choice of desserts. 

I recommend:
- sun dried tomato risotto
- salmon with passion fruit sauce (my favorite during the meal)
- garlic steak

Also... look at the cool picture of Pele on the bathroom door. ;-)

This place has a great ambiance.  Try to dress a little nicer and not too casual.  Excellent food and service.  They have the best Happy Hour menu including seafood. Next time I would like to try their weekend brunch buffet for only $24.99 per person including unlimited Mimosas and other drinks.

This place is amazing. Wonderful service, atmosphere and food!! We asked our daughter where she wanted to go for her birthday and out of her mouth she picked Via Brasil. This is one of her favorites places! She is treated like a queen. Thank you Via Brasil for making her birthday wonderful!
I really enjoyed my meal. The endlees parade of handsome men bringing me food helped too!

An excellent dinner choice. Buffet starters and salad bar has plenty for everyone. The meats are well prepared and are fresh and hot, easy to have your fill, come hungry! Service is warm, personal and professional.

We came here for a paint night/happy hour event.  There was four of us in our group & this was our first and probably last time we will visit this place.  One of our friends ordered the chicken skewer appetizer and it was severely undercooked.  It came out half pink and white with pink juice dripping off the chicken.  Our friend thought the pink juice was from the sauce so she took a bite.  She tried chewing it but she ended up spitting it out cause she said there was something hard in the chicken making it inedible.  So she took another bite but ended up not being able to chew that piece either as she then realized it was still raw.  We flagged down the server who was beyond busy trying to accomodate our entire paint night group of around 40 guests by herself, which was ridiculous.  The server was notified and took the undercooked chicken back and our friend ordered some more bacon wrapped shrimp and fries which were both good but took quite awhile to get as was our drinks.  I ordered a white wine sangria, which was pretty good but took about 20 mins to get.  At the end of our paint night event the server brought us our bills and failed to take off the undercooked chicken skewer.  We brought it to her attention and she said "oh, you wanted that off your bill?"....Uh YES since it was RAW & inedible!  So she said she would check with her manager.  She comes back with another server and let us know that the manager could not take it off since some of it had been eaten.  We all stood there dumb founded and informed her that two bites were taken however both bites had been spit out since they were raw.  Our friend then asks to speak w/ the manager.  The other gal that was w/ our server comes back and informs us that she was able to get the manager "to bend" and was able to get it removed from the bill.  WTF..."to bend" to remove undercooked chicken that was inedible!!!  First off this entire experience was rather poor to begin with.  Clearly they were understaffed and management should know better than to have one server handle almost 40 guests by herself w/ one busser, hence the reason my freaking sangria took 20 mins to bring out.  Additionally the manager should've come out and apologize personally for the undercooked chicken, thats a health hazard & just plain nasty.  And lastly, the servers need to bring out itemized bills to all their guests, as we were all given just the credit card signature receipt only.  I had to ask for an itemized receipt.  Perhaps this business should invest in hiring qualified management instead of cutting corners by inadequately staffing the restaurant during peak times resulting in poor customer experiences.
great restaurant. sat at the bar so didn't do the all you can eat. the food was slow, that's my only complaint. friendly staff. nice high ceiling restaurant. feel good ambiance

We had reservations for New Years Eve.  Close to home
entered the restaurant with Music the DJ was great.  Our table was
above the buffet area was the BEST.  Rang in the New Years'
dancing after dessert was served.    Waiters' were attentive ... 
we had to leave room  for dessert.  Party Favors/Hats, Champagne ...
different than most New Years' Eve (where we were in crowds)
From wonderful greetings, service, food, especially atmosphere..
Via Brasil made our New Years wonderful.

We've had dinner here a few times and it's the best Brazilian restaurant in town. One of my favorite date night places. Ambiance is top-notch and the service is always 5 star. The food is delicious ---  flavorful and options are aplenty. The variety of foods at the salad bar is great. The best bread (the little balls with cheese inside) I've ever had. But, hands down, Via Brazil has the best happy hour menu, food and drinks, in town. Love this place!

My wife and I go here a couple of times a month. My wife loves the picanha. I like a wider variety of meats. The turkey is probably my favorite but the prime rib and picanha are also what I look forward to when we go. The meat comes around faster than you can eat it. My daughter loves the salad bar and goes just for that.

Tips: The Sunday brunch is the best deal out of all of them. It is $25 with many of the same meats along with breakfast items.  If you sign up for their email newsletter they will send you $5 off coupons for brunch. They will also send other coupons now and then for dinner.

They only get 2 stars because the owner needs to learn some serious people skills! I have eaten there twice, the first time was on a week night and there were only about 8 tables seated. Everyone bent over backwards for us, which I expected because they had the time to do it. We liked it so much that we decided to book their New Year's Eve Party. We were 5 minutes late to our 10:30pm reservation and then stood for almost 10 minutes waiting to check in because a large party was standing in the entryway. The hostess (turned out to be the owner) saw us standing there and ignored us. When we finally got to check in she told us that they had given our table away so we now had to wait. After waiting 10 minutes I asked how much longer it was going to be because we had been told the food service stopped at midnight. I couldn't understand her answer because the DJ music was so loud. When I told her this she started screaming at me that I could stop yelling at her and that if we didn't like it we could walk out because she didn't need people like us. When I tried to explain that I was speaking loudly because of the music she cut me off and screamed at me some more. The other hostesses and guests were in shock. So I decided to ask her name. Her answer was that she was the owner and I could call her the owner or I could get out. Since there were no other options for dinner at that point I asked how long it was going to be and she said she had to find somewhere to "put us". We were finally seated last after she seated 6 groups that came in after us. We reached our table at 11:05 and then sat for another 5 minutes before anyone came to the table. There were at least 5 open tables in the section we were in so it was pretty clear there shouldn't have been a problem "finding somewhere to put us". The hostess who did seat us apologized repeatedly for her behavior and said she was sorry there was nothing she could do. It was clear from our conversation with her and other staff during the night that outbursts like this are a regular occurrence and the staff are used to trying to make it up to guests who do stay and eat. I guess it should have been a warning when I saw her grabbing party favors out of a guest's hand and yelling at the woman that she could only have 1 item per person. 
Our server was wonderful once he realized we were his table. However it was clear the staff bringing the meat around had no idea how to navigate a full restaurant. My plate was constantly empty and we spent half the night craning our necks trying to find the closest meat server. The salad bar was the usual which surprised me for a party that they were charging so much extra for. It is tiny compared to other Brazilian Steakhouses we have been to and both times they have hit a big pet peeve of mine. They put the salad dressing in front of the tray of salad so lettuce drops into it during the night. By the time we got to the salad bar the dressing was full of lettuce, which is a health code violation. It has happened both times we have eaten there, so it is clearly not something they care to keep neat. The meats were so salty that I had to ask for center cuts. And after being promised they were serving food until 1am, they stopped bringing meat around at midnight. They put out a dessert buffet at midnight. By 12:20 there were about 20 items left and they were all stale like they had sat out all day before being served. The worse part was they didn't have any more so several people didn't even get dessert which was included in the higher price for the party. We finally had to ask for more fried bananas. Once the server realized we hadn't gotten any dessert he brought us something from their regular menu. 
The last thing that bothered me was on the check. The check had been rung up under a different server's name. When I asked about it we were told that our server was the "second" on a team and the name was the "leader" of the team.
