I asked where the leader was, and was told she had already left the floor for the night. I thought it was tacky that I was expected to tip a "team" of servers when only one person had spoken to us all night. I am not talking about leaving the bussers and such out. I don't think someone who never even spoke to me should get a tip from me. Especially someone who has already gone home even though we are still seated. 
We won't be going back unless someone else is buying for certain. If you do go, make sure it is on a slow night so you get good service and pray you don't cross paths with the owner.

Amazing restaurant with very courteous and attentive workers.  Fidel has been serving us since day one and we've been here a lot after that and he has never changed one bit.  He and his crew are the best as far as customer service is concerned.  Although it's off the strip, this steakhouse is HIGHLY recommended if you're looking for the Brazilian steakhouse experience with better prices and a much larger menu than the others (I'm a local so I know the prices and selections of the other restaurant).  Look for Fidel and you won't regret the drive to get here.  

.::HIGHLY RECOMMENDED::.

After hearing great reviews of this place, I was so excited to try it. Waited until the perfect night: Valentine's Day, to treat my special someone. I could not have been more disappointed. I made a reservation for 9 pm- arrived at 8:45 only to be waiting in a chaotic line for 30 minutes just to check in. Once I got to the front, the hostess informed me it would be (at least) an additional 45 minutes. I'm sorry, what is the point of a reservation if I will be seated OVER AN HOUR past my reservation time? I understand restaurants run behind at time, I've been in Food & Beverage for 9 years now and have experienced it all, but that amount of time is unacceptable. Ended up ruining the plans for our entire night. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
Extremely disappointed on thanksgiving day. I expected to spend my money on Turkey,They started circling with Meat,Chicken,Sausage. They should focus more on Turkey.

Via Brasil has a GREAT happy hour!!! Thanks a bunch to Newton and Jenna for introducing us to this place!! The atmosphere is wonderful and cozy and the food was AMAZING!!! Definitely try the Garlic Churrasco and the Tri-Tip Skewer!! The X-rated Caipirinha drink was delish and had a nice kick! It was nice that staff is friendly and on top of making sure that everyone is happy and satisfied!  Looking forward to coming back with more friends and family!!

Since it's my favorite steakhouse ( churrascaria) in town, no wonder we went for the meat feast on Christmas Day. One of our first experiences there was during the soccer World Cup in 2014. 
The place is so freaking popular that it was packed, lucky for us we had our reservation 
It's not my first time there , so it's tough to impressive me but with such packed place the serving team was on top of their game. If there was an Olympic sport "running with the meat skewers around people " these guys would take gold!
Of course caipirinhas helped the celebration mood
Anyway as an experienced fan of Brazilian food, soccer and culture I recommend this place hands down!

Took my daughter for her birthday dinner last night.  We had reservations and were seated right away.  I ordered the "sterling" menu while the other members of my party ordered the "prime" menu.  I don't know if most people don't order off of the sterling menu, but I had to wait 15 minutes for my first selection while the rest of my party was served.  Then I had to wait quite a while for every other selection that I ordered.  It seemed like they were cooking it to order.  Regarding the bacon wrapped filet - the bacon was completely raw.  The server said that he had medium well and medium filets on his skewer.  I ordered the medium well which at best medium rare.  There shouldn't be blood all over your plate after eating a medium well steak.  How does a steak house not be able to cook a steak properly? I tried one bite, but couldn't eat anymore. Head to wait at least 15 minutes for our check - then when he finally brought it back my credit card was missing.  Then when I got home noticed that he charged us too much. He charged us for two Sterling dinners and we only had one. Wow!  Definitely not worth anywhere near the price.  Will not go back!
Been here a few times and I am never disappointed!! The salad bar is really good and the meats are delicious!! The service is also fantastic!!

We went for brunch and it was an overall great experience! The customer service was on point, considering there was 20 of us. They were friendly with the kids (ages 3-7) and  noticed that they didn't eat very much so they weren't charged! Otherwise, it is only $5 for children ages 4+. I think that is a great deal and very accommodating. The food was fresh and delicious.

I can tell you it's my first time visiting this establishment and  it was pricy but you get what you pay for .  The staff was excellent .  The hostess was awesome.   They did a birthday song which sealed the deal .  This will definitely not be my last time as a patron .

Being someone that absolutely loves Brazilian establishments, I would not rank Via Brasil Steakhouse in my top 10!  The main reasons for my ranking was due to the price and the taste of the poultry items and salmon.  The bacon wrapped turkey was horrible...dry and overly salty.  I usually go by the mindset that anything wrapped in bacon is awesome, but that did not hold true for that item!  All the chicken items I tried did not impress and I made sure to pass on them the rest of the night.  The salmon with their mango sauce was ok , but the salmon was dry and didn't have much flavor either.  Now, the red meat options were amazing and well seasoned and prepared.  From the bacon wrapped fillet to the flank steak I could not get enough of the red meat items.  The wait staff was very good and constantly providing clean plates.  The salad bar was your standard Brazilian fare with nothing special, but for $45 a plate I would expect a more robust salad bar and better tasting poultry items.  I've had much better options from Brazilian restaurants that charge $25-$30 per plate. And what the hell is with the garlic bread on a skewer?
Well this is for sure the "B" location to Texas De Brazil.....from the service, to quality of meat and salad bar. This is for sure the step down, not horrible but just the B version.

We really would have liked to taste the food here. We have been here 2 times and both times we had to leave without any food. We came for Happy Hour and the first time the bar and outside were so crowded because there was a party or a social or something like that. We couldn't even get in to order anything - it was that crowded. Tonight we went there with a party of about 25 people (for Happy Hour) and we were able to order this time but after an hour of waiting for our food we left without any. Their excuse was that the others ordered salads and other small plates and we ordered crab cakes which takes longer. Really? I think they can't handle bigger parties and become overwhelmed. When we asked for a manager the server first told us there wasn't one there. Then when we voiced our reason for leaving he said he wAs the manager and they were short handed and the reason why it was taking so long. I am giving them the 2 stars because of the service. I really would have liked to try the food but he couldn't tell us when ours would be out so we left.

My brother and I went there a while ago and I have to say this to everyone.....
Avoid Via Brasil Steakhouse. The staff was BEYOND rude and I will never step foot in there again. Bottom line was that I was accused of skipping out on a bill that wasn't mine and they just plain Embarrassed me. I asked to talk to the Manager and I have yet to hear from anyone. I will not apologize for yelping nor will I remove this. The Via Brasil Steakhouse NEEDS to own up for their actions. I have NEVER stolen in my life and I have never been accused of it either ......until I went to Via Brasil. You lost a customer forever.

I am extremely upset that I had such a negative experience at this restaurant. 

I will start by saying that the two stars is simply for the food. They have really good food that is really authentic and homestyle Brazilian food which is hard to find in Las Vegas. 

We went to this restaurant a few times in the past few months and have not had the best service which is really a shame. We asked for a table for three. The restaurant was completely empty and had 3 tables seated. The hostess asked us to wait by the door for a few minutes to "see if they had anything available." We were a bit taken back since the entire place was empty, but patiently waited. About 15 minutes went by and the hostess just stood there staring out into space and wouldn't sit us for some reason. 

It was so frustrating that it seemed like they did not want our business. Being that we were so hungry we decided to just leave and drive 30 minutes to Texas de Brazil at Town Square. Totally worth it because they were super happy to help us and their service was phenomenal. 

I promised myself I wouldn't come back to this restaurant because I think customer service is the most important thing for me and this restaurant clearly needs to focus a little less time staring in to space and more time focussing on employee development and training.

Branch is just good, good price and nice selection of food and salad's
The servers are the Best and very friendly
My first experience here was about 2 months ago for wedding dinner party. Excellent, quick service and amazing food. Definitely on my top favorite places to dine!

Carnivore heaven!

21 different meats cooked to perfection! My favorite part was the bacon wrapped filet. It just melts in your mouth! And the ribs just fell off the bone! The salad bar had a lot to choose from. The service is great! Every person was courteous and helpful.
Enjoyed the food, great service and best in class items for the kids to use and take during our dine in experience. Pricing on point for a Brazilian restaurant, close for us, will return.
An exemplary selection of food in their happy hour menu! Highly recommend Via Brasil Steakhouse.

This was my first time here..we chose it for the happy hour ..perfect place to hang out with the girls loved the atmosphere. .tapas were delicious. .and the sangria was my favorite. .great service will surely be back

This review stems from sampling their food from Bite of Las Vegas so take it for what it's worth.
We ordered the filet, shrimp wrapped in bacon, & fries. The filet was tender, fresh, & delicious! Anything wrapped in bacon is good, but the shrimp wrapped in bacon was AMAZING & it came on a small bed of rice w/ a simple sauce. The fries were ok & a bit greasy. This was our first time trying food here so we didn't see if it was being made fresh or not, but it tasted as if it was fresh & not sitting like other booths.
If it tasted this good there, I can hardly wait to go eat at this place in person to get a full sense of the food & atmosphere. Def a place to check out for the food!

This place has the best service in town. The servers are very attentive and polite - the food, out of this world! Everything is cooked to perfection!! If you come here be prepared for an experience. I've been to other Brazil style steakhouses.. But this place takes the cake!! If I could give it 10 stars, I would!
This place is a hidden gem if you haven't been there you need to go @ least try it 1 time. I believe you'll enjoy it.

I love me some churrascaria. I would like to take a brief break from this review to let you know how much, to the tune of "I Gotta Feelin'":

Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday (Do it!) 
Friday, Saturday, Saturday to Sunday, (Do it!) 
Get, get, get, get, get with us you know what we say, say 
Churrascaria every day, churrascaria every day.

Now that I've gotten that out of my system, let's get to the food. I went to this place with my cousin, Paolo D. and we yelped while we were eating. How cool are we? As a result, I have a pretty sweet record of what we ate and how much I liked it. So let's get it started (another BEP reference in 1 review. Score!)

Non-meat items that I thoroughly enjoyed:
- Asparagus risotto - rich, creamy, just wish it spread on the plate more
- Fried bananas were delicious and subtle in their sweetness
- Cheese rolls tasted great when they first came out. 
- Caesar salad was really good just add garlic oregano dressing. I love salad.

On to the main course (aka, things that I love):
- Chicken drumsticks were the first thing I had, really flavorful and I highly recommend them.
- The Seafood in the salad bar was in desperate need of salt. Good thing they have the salt and pepper shaker handy.
- Skirt steak was surprisingly amazing and tender
- Garlic steak was not tender but really flavorful
- Beef Ribs were delightfully fatty and tender
- Parmesan pork was dry but had a nice crust
- Service was very attentive

So this is where I get annoying and nit-picky (not to worry, this is still a 5-star review):
- The "Brazilian Mashed potatoes" were really fluffy. Almost too fluffly. They tasted instant to me, although I am sure they are not. Is it possible that you can make something so well that it gives the impression that it comes out of a box? Possibly.
- I wish they had fruit or something sweet to break up the heaviness of everything. And no, I am not going to pay for dessert after stuffing my face with 20 kinds of meat.
- Salmon was okay but the passion fruit vinaigrette really brought a nice break to the meal
- Bacon wrapped turkey was meh

Overall, I think you should go here.
Came to Vegas to visit family and decided to go for cocktails. All I can say is WOW! Food was outstanding, service impeccable and the sangria was to die for. I know, without a doubt, I will be back!

The place was very formal inside. The salad - side bar was just ok. The ravioli needed work, mushrooms were good, all in all enough to fill you up. The meats were delicious! Turkey wrapped in baccon, top sirloin, skirt steak.. Yum you leave a satisfied carnivore. Service was spectacular. Only wish they included dessert since you pay 42 bucks per person pre fixe price. Worth going to.

I LOVE this place AND the staff. We have been coming here the last 5 years and they treat us like family every time we arrive. They are so kind to my little girl and treat her like a princess the entire time. 
The food? Absolutely delicious. Especially the corn-on-the-cob and the Blush Pasta they provide at the Salad Bar (my only complaint is I wish they made it more often).  But the meat is mouth watering, freshly cooked, and still sizzling when it gets to your table. This is by far one of the best restaurants in town and you'd be a fool not to try them out!

I will start by saying I have never left a review on a restaurant anywhere.  This was that bad!  The service was awful.  First we bought the upcharged meat selection.  It never came.  I finally asked them to bring some of the meat on the selection and took another 15-20 minutes for it to come.  When the manager came by and I explained what was going on, she started to argue with me.  I explained it was my daughters birthday and I did not want to argue.  I actually had to ask her to leave 3 times.  The food itself was a 3 out of 10.  The meat was tough, over cooked and low quality.  I will agree with other reviews here the other two Brazilian steakhouses in town are light years better than this place.  Don't waste your money.  The management of this place is an embarrassment.  Never again!

My first time here and this will be the last time here. The food was good and all but the food orders took super long to get to the table. I would say around 25 minutes just to get everything. The waiter was not descriptive in how the food orders would come out the happy hour dishes were literally for one person not s group of people. This was so disappointing in coming to this establishment I would rather go to Texas de Brazil.

Via Brazil Steakhouse is a place you need to come and eat. They have a meat and seafood option or no seafood if you want. The Salmon with passion fruit sauce is amazing. The sauce is delicious and sweet, but not too sweet. When you come, you must ask for the garlic bread and fried mozzarella cheese. But make sure u ask for the bread first, and put the cheese on top. Explosion in your mouth. They have a really good salad bar too. Just don't fill up on the salad, there are lots of good meats to savor. 

Service is great too. They are really attentive. 

Come and experience Via Brazil Steakhouse.

All you can eat, delicious beautiful meat.

The cheesebread is incredible.

The salad bar is fantastic and full of great cheeses and fancy niblits.

All the waiters are quick and snappy. And definitely nice.

The meat servers are also on a constant roll.

Atmosphere is casually laidback yet exciting in a way.

The prime rib. Holy crap. The prime rib. The best. I wouldn't mind a little horseradish on the side, but man even just alone it's so tasty.

I also love love the chicken hearts.

But it's all good. Meat lovers rejoice!!!!

:)

Stopped by a couple weeks ago for Saturday brunch and had to write this review to let the owners no how awesome their staff is. The host who just moved from New York recently (forgot her name) knows what customer service is all about !!!! I always feel welcomed every-time I come to eat here. My server was the best can't remember his name but it started with a V. I was by myself last time and he wasn't to pushy, clearly understood that I was chillin and didn't really need much and he checked on me literally just enough and always made sure I was good. It's kind of annoying to have that server that doesn't come at all, or comes every 2 seconds, but this guy was PERFECT! Awesome awesome staff and the food was amazing as always :)

This place is the best kept secret. I've been in Vegas for 7 years and never knew it existed. Great service along with a nice atmosphere. The meat was good, although I would have liked a little more flavor. The salad bar was the best hands down!!

The first time we ate here, I would have given it two stars.  Yesterday rated a 4, so I averaged it out at a 3.  
Our first experience was for dinner a year and a half ago.  The salad bar was pretty good, but the meats were strictly "meh."  So many of the non-red meats were super salty.  
Yesterday we went for the Sunday brunch because we had an offer for a free pitcher of bloody marys or mimosas.  We ordered the bloody marys and they were delicious.    There are fewer choices of meats for the brunch, but all of them were very tasty and fresh.  My favorites were the top sirloin and the prime rib.  For sides we were served fried plantains and some very bland mashed potatoes.  I guess for the brunch you don't get to choose sides.  The salad bar was very nice.  They had caprese salad, which is always a plus for me.  Also, the caesar dressing was very good!  To start the meal you are offered your choice of cheese rolls, banana bread or zucchini bread.  We got a basket of cheese rolls and munched on them throughout the meal.  
My biggest complaint is that there was no dessert included in the brunch.  I didn't have a lot of room left, but it is always nice to finish off a good meal with a little something sweet, imo.  We had zucchini bread and banana bread for dessert, but they didn't quite do the trick.

I enjoy the multitudes of meat at a Brazilian steakhouse as much as the next guy, but personally prefer other options to Via Brasil. The pricing is reasonable for what is offered, and I appreciate that salad bar-only ($26) is an option (and it includes a few hot dishes), but the main choices are Prime ($40) or Sterling ($50, +$10 for 7 additional meats). Assorted sides are included but dessert and drinks are extra for each package, a la carte available with HH at the bar/lounge. Management and servers were very nice and came by frequently to check on us. Interior is dark and upscale, with a large private area available for groups; gameplay discount menu available ($20 min).

We opted for the Sterling dinner. Salad bar was okay, with chicken marsala and marinara mussels available in addition to cold items and soup. The meats were all fairly good, but I was somewhat annoyed that we had to specifically request some of the additional featured meats for our category. We were able to try the NY steak, grilled shrimp, and rib eye but had to request others like the lamb chops. I would have tried the lamb leg and salmon if they'd been offered but the menu outlining our selection was not on the table and frankly that should be handled by the server not my memory. Meat quality was fairly good, with the garlic steak and bacon-wrapped filet being standouts. but most options were on the tougher side. Sides of asparagus and fried yucca were solid. 

TIP: Sign up for their mailing list for the occasional $25 discount coupon.

Superb service and mouthwatering choice meats at Via Brasil Steakhouse! I have been here several times. The restaurant is always clean and beautifully adorned with plants. The bar is located near windows with a great view. They have tables that are privately located for special occasions or centrally located near others and the cold bar. The cold bar is kept fresh and immaculate. The presentation is artistic - the chef's definitely take pride in their work!

I absolutely love their daily gazpacho. It is usually served in a small shot glass as a sweet sampling as they are generally made with a fresh seasonal fruit like cantaloupe or watermelon. I generally ask for a teacup to be sent to me tableside, so I can enjoy a bit more without taking five or more shot glasses. The cold bar has a hot section as well where they serve some seafood pastas and seafood soups. Their hot soups are very tasty. I don't partake in the pasta dishes since I am there for choice meats. 

I love the system typical of all local Brazilian restaurants that allows servers to know when you are ready for more meat. A circular color-coded yes/no card indicates when food should be offered or when servers should bypass the table. This allows the guest time to eat some of what they have before going back for more or from being bothered when full or not ready. It also allows the service to flow throughout the restaurant as serving staff carries choice meats that are hot and sometimes heavy.

The choice meats are broken into two categories of prices. There is something close to six select meats on the higher priced selection than the lower one. The price difference is $10.00, and it is worth the experience. Prior to service of meats, you can select from sauces and sides you'll want with your meal, and these are unlimited. I usually order saut√©ed mushrooms and the plantains. These are great choices.

I love the lamb chops, salmon, shrimp, and filet. They are my favorites! My favorites require more of the server's attention because most of these are not usually items that just make the rounds randomly. The lamb is cooked to order, so when you are ready, they will make it. The salmon is also typically not out often because it gets cold quick and is served on a wooden fire plate for flavor with a sweet sauce that makes it like a finishing selection to lead into dessert. I usually get the salmon last for that reason. The shrimp come out on a sizzling hot plate. The filet is well... a well seasoned choice meat. Although it is not meat, one item that is served is fresh hot mozzarella! I can be absolutely full and have a least two of these! This is a must try! 

What stands out among the other Brazilian restaurants in town are the service standards. The restaurant expectation is that any guest that gets up from his/her seat should come back to a folded napkin and their seat pushed back in if left out. I love the concept of dining and being treated like a valued guest. I wish more restaurants invested time in winning my patronage. Additionally, there is a managerially presents that is not obtrusive to guests. They use hand signals and eye contact to keep watch on staff and draw attention to details. This is excellent training because when a guest motions, the servers are more observant. I have dined in restaurants were eye contact and body language was ignored due to ignorant waiting staff, foreign customs, or poor training. This prompts guests to get out of their seat or call out in a restaurant - tacky.

My favorite server is Fidel. I usually ask for him when I visit. Although all the servers in this restaurant work seamlessly together, Fidel stands out among the rest. When I ask for something like my lamb chops, he puts that order in and checks back with me as to when I can expect them. When I am done, he asks if I want more. When I tell him I am ready for my Salmon, he goes to the kitchen for that as well. He makes sure my water is never less than half-full, he pushes and pulls my chair out when I get up or sit down, and he never seems to act as though he is rushed or bothered. He never makes me feel like I am eating the entire restaurant out of their lamb chops or shrimp. He truly makes me feel like I am his only guest. 

Definitely come to this restaurant hungry! Five-stars well deserved.
This place is amazing! A must visit! The service and the food is unbelievable! The meat is mouth watering and everything was delicious!  A+++ Lots of selection. come hungry!

About 1 or twice a month my family and i come here and i do have to say that the restaurant staff from the hostesses to the waiters all the way back to the chefs are very professional and have very great cutomer service, every time we come here we get the Cheers treatment where everyone knows us by name and the food is ALWAYS top notch and if at anytime we want something specials cooked they have no problem doing so. Thank you all at Via Brasil Steakhouse for being great.

Service is top notch! Entire staff was amazing Gerardo was our waiter and was such a sweetheart. It was our Anniversary and he even brought us 2 glasses of champagne. Can't say enough about the food, wow!! 
I did read in other reviews that the asparagus soup at the salad bar was very bland and i did find that to be true, that really was the only negative thing i can think other than that place was amazing!!

One of my favorite and best priced Summerlin Happy Hours -5 PM to 8 PM in the bar and patio area

They recently expanded their small plate offerings in addition to being able to get their meats by the ounce.

Love their fresh fruit Mojito's and Caipirinha's; and order a different one each time I go.

And as always, exceptional service and libation mastery by Coleen.

First time being to a Brazilian steakhouse and Via Brasil did not disappoint. The meat was perfectly seasoned and cooked, plus it was for Mother's Day brunch, so they had waffles, crepes and omelets made to order. I also had a Bloody Mary that was just okay but the coffee was exactly how I like it: strong!
Overall, I would definitely return.

Our friend who has been to the brunches at Via Brasil and enjoyed them suggested their advertised Happy Hours on Wednesdays and Thursdays.  They are supposed to be on the patio, but due to the heat and the fact they do not have misters, it was honored in the bar.  The bar area is very tight and in a short time, became very crowded.  We then discovered a Meet Up group was meeting there.  Eventually they did move the majority to the patio, in the brutal heat.  Our server became overwhelmed pretty quickly as it became apparent he was handling the patio.  I needed to ask about how an item had been prepared and it took awhile before he came back with an answer.  As time passed, our server no longer appeared.  We wanted to order more drinks and another appetizer.  We saw him coming in from the patio and waiting at the bar for the drinks he had to serve out there, a few times, and tried to catch his eye.  After 30 minutes, we gave up and decided just to just leave but we didn't even have our bill.  So after discussion, because we are honest people, we tried to figure out what we owed and left cash.  But one friend so other people moving to the table and was concerned about the cash.  And magically, the server appeared!  She told him we figured it out best we can.  I stopped at the hostess station and expressed our dissatisfaction but the young woman was slow in understanding our concerns and finally asked if we wanted to talk to the manager.  At that point, we just wanted to leave.  There were two issues: they shouldn't be hosting a Meet Up without enough room and servers and if they choose to do that, then the manager needs to swing through the bar occasionally and ensure that patrons are taken care of.  The server may have been new or not properly trained.  A good server would have made sure his other customers had been taken care of by someone else, if he couldn't.  Very disappointing experience and have no plans to go back or recommend.
One of the best Brazil steak joints in the Vegas valley. Everything is good. Tender mean, good waiter service, and a full bar.

We went for dinner last Saturday on a Groupon, the food was amazing,  the mussels in the salad bar were some of the best I've ever had, so tasty! The service was phenomenal, it truly was an enjoyable dining experience, we'll be going back soon.

Nice place. But that's it. If you want to try Brazilian food this is not the place.
They tried, but aside from some of the staff nothing was Brazilian at all. The meat was "slowly" coming toward us and it got cold all the time. With my complaint the "capit?o" that is the nickname of the Chef he then made sure that the meat got to us warmer. The only kind of meat I wanted came just 1 time. Picanha. The only piece of meat that I can say was good was caw ribs. The pork was coming with a weird sauce. Rice ok, beans cold and without any juice. The yuca was undercooked and oily. Salad bar was poor. Again was ok if you don't know the real taste. I hope they can improve. Send the chef to Brazil for a 5 day training camp. Good luck

I had been to Via Brasil previously,  years ago, and wouldn't have given it a very flattering or favorable review. However, I've been there twice in the past month and have noticed and appreciated a definite change. Keep in mind,  this is not Texas D' Brazil, however, to their benefit,  they've stopped trying to be. As compared to their competition,  Via Brasil offers different menus for varied wants and tastes. Yes, there are still Gauchos bringing savory meats but some items are by request, keeping them fresh. The salad bar is okay (again compared to the competition) but they've been hitting where it counts, with flavorful additions and service. Management is attentive and the waiters make a great effort to personalize your service. If you have a chance to do so near happy hour, take advantage and grab a great dinner.

My new favorite place!! Only $38.99 for the rodizio dinner and that includes like 18 different meats and the salad/mini pasta bar and all the sides made to order, for like $10 more you get 5 more meats including the lamb...but the salmon was my fav! There wasn't one single thing I didn't like...even the fried bananas were amazing. The staff was friendly and my waiter James was amazing and on it! Will def return!

What a huge Disappointment!!! From the start the service was horrible ... Had a reservation for 2:30 and showed up 45 minutes early and went to the bar !! The bartender was overwhelmed and we waited 15 minutes before I went to the bar and then was ignored for about 10 minutes ! 

During this time my wife had gone to the hostess and mentioned how long it is taking to get service and the hostess had the nerve to say you are upset over a drink ?? My wife said well yeah... We have a reservation and its Mothers Day  and we are sitting in the bar !! She then asked to speak to the manager and I watched the hostess approach the manager and tell him that a lady was complaining about the service in the bar .... Now let me paint a picture of what was going on in the bar at this time ! There were a total of 5 people sitting in the bar including the three of us and none of us were being waited on . It was the change between Brunch and dinner and there were three people behind the bar !! The manager , bartender and a young lady punching stuff in the computer !! At the drink station where the servers would pick up had 6 people waiting for their drinks for their tables !! 

Now back to the manager !! He completely ignored the situation for about ten minutes literally walking past us and in circles for about another two minutes until he finally asked if we are ok ?? At this time we decided we would leave and gave the feedback that they were clearly not staffed for Mother's Day and he had no idea what he was doing and the staff was very rude !! We will not be going back and Texas De Brazil will have our Business forever !! 

Completely frustrating and upset !!

Went for brunch today. Super disappointed in the salad bar. I guess I had high expectations going in because I was expecting something similar to Texas de Brazil. It was much smaller and nothing tastes great. The best part was the bottomless mimosas and bloody Mary's. The meat was okay nothing to fav over my favorite would have to be the garlic steak. Had a few issues checking out. But other than that it was okay. Don't think we will be back but that's only because I know we can get a better selection of food at the same price else where.

Never. Coming. Back. The manager/owner is a total jerk. We had Groupons that expired and should've been good for the value paid ($46). We had a $65 tab, and he wouldn't accept our Groupon at all...for the value that they've already received. Never coming back to this horrible restaurant. Go to Texas de Brazil, WAY better! Only silver lining was our server, Rachel, who was awesome! You can do better, girl!

I would have to say one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas.  The meats are always cooked on point.  The flavors are there, no sauce needed.

The salad bar and hot apps bar is a great touch.  There is always a coupon available or a deal you can find to save a few dollars.  Go at lunch and it almost half the price.

Many of the buffets around town are approaching $20-$30 per person, why not get real food for that price.

We did Mother's day brunch at Via Brasil. The experience of dealing with incompetent hostesses and a staff with no knowledge of a proper restaurant reservation system deserved 1 star. However, the experience consisting of the food and the waitstaff service (after waiting 50 minutes and then finally getting seated) was 5 stars. So to balance it out, my rating is at 4.

A little delay and backup of seating times on big holiday weekends is understandable. However, the Mother's day brunch reservation system was highly unorganized and every single party (whether a 2-top, 4, 6, or very large party 10+) waited on average one hour after their reservation time to be seated. Many people were very upset, some left, some (like us) stuck it out and the feeling was very chaotic.

That said, the waitstaff and the quality of the food really came to the rescue. Once you were actually seated it was business as expected. The quality of the food was outstanding and some of my favorites were the beef carpaccio and turkey wrapped in bacon.

I will also give management credit for giving us several gift cards and complimentary desserts as consideration for our extremely long wait.

I'm not sure if I have confidence in Via Brasil's reservation system to go back for a holiday weekend meal, but for a casual meal with family or friends, I absolutely would.

After posting my previous review about my 1-star experience on New Year's Eve, I was contacted by an employee offering to have me back for another meal and to refund my poor experience. I happily accepted, as I'm open to giving people more than just one shot.

Unfortunately, they messages they sent me were deleted (not by me...) and my attempts to contact them directly at the email address provided in the message have gone ignored.

Not only was my experience with their restaurant very poor, my experience with their customer service after the fact has been extremely disappointing as well. I can not stress enough how poorly I rate this establishment.

Came here for one of my birthday dinners and was pleased but have to say right off the bat that it aint no Texas de Brazil at all. At $45.99 per person I would rather give my money to Texas de Brazil any day. That being said the service was excellent but some of the meat either wasn't cooked enough, cooked too much, or actually tasted good. It was just intermittent on the food front. I'm not a salad eater so I can't comment much on the salad bar but that I tried some meats and cheeses that were ok. A lady came around with a alcohol cart and a man then came around with a dessert cart but I don't drink much and was too full for dessert it looked good though. If you have money to blow then give this place a try but for me it is a pass.

That's definitely my favorite place to eat in town. I am a meat lover so i am  never disappointed when i come here. Great meat selection and and a salad bar.  Our last visit was for a Christmas Day and that was again great choice. Even though it was very busy, and we have waited a little to get a table, we got a great service. Thank you Via Brasil for doing such a great job ! My son especially loves to eat picanha here.

I wanted to update my review by another great experience we had today. It's a real treat to visit this restaurant every time. My favorite picanha and beef ribs are soo delicious. We always feel very welcome by Ana , the manager, who always finds the time to have a little chat with us and make sure we got everything we wanted. Great, great place for a meat lover!

Been here many times before for brunch and dinner, usually great food and service.
Went for Mothers Day Brunch, reservations were for noon, which Via moved from 11:30 with no explanation just a phone call the week before, didn't get a table till 12:40. Prices were raised for the day, suppose to be Sterling menu only got a selection of 5 meats. Salad bar was out most of the time, waited 10 to 15 minutes for items to be refilled. 
Never again on a holiday, raised prices, poor service, limited food selection.

Great food and service! Just NEVER gamble there. If you hit a good win it can take over 2 hours for them to get someone to show up to pay you. Ruined our whole night and they offered nothing to compensate for the frustration.

Been going to this place since 2010 and amazed with how consistent it's been over the years and how it still has the amazing friendly staff. Great food and salad bar. Every time I go they know exactly what my order is and I don't have to say anything.

I am a regular here...well regular as one can be.  I come here about once every six months. That is about enough time to  forget about my last meat hangover and prepare myself  for the next meat hangover.  I always have this dooming feeling that this place is going to shut down, because it was unprofitable due to me and my husband eating atleast 5 lbs of meat, EACH!

Despite being somewhat buffetish, I think the quality remains high and consistent. Frankly, I am very discriminant about what I eat from the "buffet bar", while it show freshness, chose wisely, most of it is just filler and distraction from the more expensive meat.  I do eat the beef or salmon carpaccio and sample the soup and hot appetizers... all decent.  However, a little plate of roughage doesn't hurt and can be a welcoming break from the continuous onslaught of hot sizzling meat coming your way.  The meat and variety is awesome especially if you desire red meats. 

I notice a few cost saving changes that I think make total sense.  The table side, side dishes are smaller portions but still you can order as many as you want and I am pretty sure if you finish and want more,  they will bring you more.  Shrimp cocktail at the buffet is composed of small shrimps, where as before they were large ones.  Now the large shrimp come tableside, which are brushed with a delicious garlic sauce.  I didn't see much of a raw seafood selection anymore. 

Service was "good" this time, but in the dozen and half  times I've been here, I've never had less that good service and more often than not it has been excellent and cordial.

P.S.  read the fine print. if you have the recent Groupon offer, be aware it is more like buy one meal at full price get one half off.   If there are two of you, you cannot use two coupons, but you can use two coupon If you have four people.

Just go and enjoy.

My wife and I are locals, and this is our favorite restaurant in town. Food, service, and atmosphere are outstanding. Mary and I usually come in alone or with another couple. So when her brother called and said he was coming to Vegas with several clients for a golf weekend, where is a great restaurant "off Strip"? There was only one choice! First time bringing a large party in (10 people)....EXCELLENT 
As usual, Anna and her staff made it a wonderful experience! 
We can now add one more check to the list...
Great food
Great staff
Great atmosphere
Great dinner 
Great brunch
Great for couples
And now, Great for large parties

I was debating whether I should go to pampas, texas, or Fogo.  I have coupon from Fogo amd Pampas.  I was not too impressed with Fogo when I went there for lunch last time. I was expecting to get $20 email signup coupon from Texas which I never got.  Based on reading reviews from yelp, I decide to go to Via as I don't like "special" treatment given by pampas when people use coupon (won't give you the high quality meat and cut). I got the $25 discount from Via right after I confirmed my email address.  I made the reservation online the night prior to my visit for Friday 5pm (they don't offer weekdays lunch, only dinner on weekdays). 

Based on how I was granted at the front door, I believe they expect you to make reservation for your visit.  We were lead to a table at the far end, I asked if we can sit closer to the salad bar.  We actually ended up sitting couple steps outside the kitchen where we got all the fresh cut.  I got the sterling dinner ($50 each). It was not busy when we arrived, we are the second table with the BBQ grill. We got all the attention we want, different meats pilled up on my plate.
I have tried everything except  BBQ Pork Ribs, Salmon, Brazilian Pork, and Chicken Hearts.

Conclusion:
- Services (I showed them the $25 coupon, and I told them it is my first time in their restaurant, I get special treatment, server and manager visited our tables multiple times to check if everything is ok, how is the food).  My husband does not eat pork, they make the filet without bacon for him and with bacon for me.  
- shrimp was offered without asking

Must try:  Beef Ribs, lamb chop (juicy and tender)
Great: Tri-tip, Filet, Prime Rib, shrimp, asparagus, fried banana (crunchy and not soared with oil).  
Good / try one first but don't stuff your face with them: Picanha, garlic steak, flank steak, turkey wrapped in bacon, chicken kabab (too sweet for my taste), sausage (taste like hot links)
OK: Ribeye - I had high hope for it since that is my favourite cut, however I do not like the seasoning (not sure if that's the sage/orgeno, too strong for me) I told the meat guy that ribeye is the only thing I am waiting for, he got right on it and brought the ribeye out and cook it in front of us (and ask us how well we like the meat).
OK to skip: chicken drumstick 
- I wish they offer dorma and grilled pineapple for sterling dinner. 

Tip: if you are looking for a certain cut of meat, let the meat server knows, they will bring them when it is ready (that's how I got the garlic steak and ribeye)

Good place to take someone that can eat a ridiculous amount of food. The waiters hovered which was kind of annoying. Sangria was ok. They really pushed it and was a bit over priced. Otherwise the meats were good. Some kind of bland. Salad bar was nice but don't bother eating too much over there and wait for all those meats. Earlier the better. It gets a tad crazy there and you have to wait for the good stuff. You can request something on the list but dont hold your breath. They never did get back to us once it started getting busier so we just paid and left. Was an experience but just ok. Lamb chops were my favorite.
Delicious!  My husband I just celebrated our anniversary by having dinner here.  Great food and fantastic service.  The price is on the higher end, but totally worth it!  ENJOY!

Hands down the best Brazilian steakhouse in town. The food is excellent and the staff is very friendly. We stopped in for happy hour to take advantage of the low prices. I ordered two types of steak and they were both extremely flavorful and tender. I will be coming back very soon!

My wife and I ate here for the first time tonight.  I'm giving it three stars but don't ally agree with three stars meaning A-OK.  It was more average than anything compared to their major competitors.  The pros were the shrimp, salmon, side dishes.  I also liked the spaciousness of the restaurant and the tables not being too close together.  

The meats were okay but nothing special. My lamb chops were very small and very over done. The salad bar was also pretty small compared to the other places.

I found the constant upselling and pressure to buy drinks and dessert a little annoying.  It was okay at first but then became constant.  The assistant waiter and support staff was very good.  The speed of service was very good also.  I'm not sure I'd go back and have mixed feeling about this place.

This place is amazing. I've been to several Brazilian steakhouses in town and found this place to be one of my favorite. Lobster bisque is a must and my favorite cut of meat would be the picanha (sirloin). I could come here to just eat just those two items and will be more then satisfied. Finishing off with a Midori infused lemon zest ice cream was just overwhelming of lemon zest. Flavor is there but I would not recommend this unless you like eating lemon rind. Why I dropped two stars was because they were out of spinach and hubby saved room for dessert and the dessert he ordered was 86. To top off his disappointment they charged him for a dessert that he didn't get.

Celebrating our aniversary in Via Brazil was the best choice..The service was superb..and the food to die for..I recomend this restaurant highly..My recomendation is to bring an empty stomach...you are gonna eat!!

Service: made our months ahead reservations, restaurant was half empty, the host was going to sit us all the way back. People who doesn't have reservations for better table than us. 
Food: they use to serve clams on salad bar, but not this time. They charge us extra for grill pineapple (before was part of our meal. No fruits on salad bar. Parmesan chicken wings was terrible taste. We have to keep asking for certain meats.
Overall: we been here for the last 4 years. Next super bowl we are not planning to come back anymore.

I was extremely disappointed and embarrased with the lack of service tonight.  There was nine in our group and three ordered the Rodizio Sterling, so they can have the seafood. The salmon took an hour to serve, after informing us it would take 10 minuites. When it finally came, it was too dry, so a waste of money and our time waiting.  They came around only twice to serve two  shrimp at a time, which was served an hour inbetween. The Rodizio Prime, listed more meats than what was actually served. They kept serving the same three meats.  We asked our server to change one of the orders to the Prime because we had been waiting a long time for the salmon. The server didn't appologize. The manager spoke to us, who didn't seem to understand the frustration of her customers, nor cared that we were unsatified with the service. She was not friendly and for a bill that was over $500.00, was debating with us for a $10.00 reduction on the bill. They were not busy, so the lack of service was no excuse. The side dishes are all you can eat, but they never came around to ask us if we needed more. I was very embarrassed, because I recommend this resturant to our out of town quests, who actually paid for the dinner. I will not be returning, neither will the other quests in the party. Too pricey for the poor service and what a rip off. Make sure you count the types of meats they serve. They list alot, but only bring out a few.

This place had a very nice atmosphere and the staff did an excellent job of making sure we had anything we needed. Being able to make online reservations was a plus as this place was surprisingly busy for a Thursday night. Full menu was not readily served but all we had to do was ask the staff for it and it was out in a matter of minutes. We will definitely be making another visit to this wonderful establishment.

Came here two nights ago for NYE. I was able to make a last minute reservation that afternoon on open table. Had trouble finding parking in the lot directly in front of the building. It's a big shopping center so we parked on the other side. We came just a couple minutes before our reservation at 6:45 and the male manager rudely told us it would be a ten minute wait. Okay well I guess we will go to the bar. The bartender was very friendly and efficient. We waited closer to 20 minutes for our table. 
Out server Dante provided really good service as well as his two assistance. He had one guy who only seemed to do beverages and another one who picked up our plates and bring more side dishes. The sides were okay, a little under seasoned. The fried bananas were so good. They had the right amount of sweetness. There was constant stream of meat but it seemed be a lot of the same stuff. The sterling meal promises an upwards of 20 or more meats but I didn't feel like that was the case. The meat were well seasoned and delicious. The salad bar was okay, probably on the lower end of the spectrum. The salmon and chicken Marsala seemed to have been sitting there awhile. It was not very good. I wanted to try the flan but I was stuffed.
Wonderful experience, the staff was very nice and tentative..always one of my favorite places to eat at when I am in town...food is always on point!!

Decent happy hour here! Food was hit or miss but it was reasonably priced and the restaurant itself is beautiful. We loved the garlic churrasco, the bruschetta was way too dry and way too sweet. The ceviche was good and fresh, but I didn't care for the flavor much. The lobster tails that came out varied way too much in size. Two people in our group got huge tails prompting two other people to order it too, only to be served mini tails that were about a quarter of the size of the first offering. The manager did bring out additional mini tails after we brought it to his attention and gave us some free dessert. Great customer service! I would recommend this place for happy hour because there is so much to choose from and the prices can't be beat!
What an awesome happy hour item. You gotta try this! The meat is so juicy and full of flavor.

I've never eaten dinner here. But I have been to their happy hour MANY times. It's great hours, great selection and good prices. Everything I've had of their happy hour menu was delicious. The servers and bartenders are always friendly and attentive.

I feel this is one of the better kept secrets in Vegas.  I say that because I have been here numerous times (probably a dozen) and they always have some empty tables.  The good news is, that means you can almost always get right in.

I feel that it is a great value for the money.  It comes out to about $60/adult, but that includes all you can eat steak, sides and salad bar.  I have spent more than that at Austin's or Morton's, but did not get the variety, because here you get a sampling of entres: steak of course, chicken, salmon or lamb.  All of it is delicious.

The salad bar is a little lacking in choices, I feel, but most of what they have is pretty good.

And I must say the service is awesome.  The wait staff is always on top of you seeing if you need more drinks, bread and, naturally, more meat!

I take the kids and they love it as well.  My 7 year old eats for $25 and my 5 year old eats for $7.  Again it is all they can eat (which in the case of the 5 year old isn't much).

Overall it is a great place to take the family.  Certainly you will spend more than a Chile's or Olive Garden, but the food is INFINITELY better than the typical family chain.
Excellent service and delicious food. Place wasn't overly packed. Parking was convenient.

This place is amazing! I love the variety of meats and how tender and juicy they all were. My favorite was the Brazilian sausage. I had the prime selection dinner and was absolutely satisfied with just that. The salad bar here is the best one I've ever seen. Everything was delicious, the waitstaff was beyond attentive. Great atmosphere. Love this place!!!

Tonight we experienced an unbelievable dinner at Via Brasil Steakhouse again!!  We thoroughly enjoyed Garlic Churrasco.  The meat melts in your mouth and it is served with delicious caramelized onions and saut√©ed bananas! Also, we enjoyed mussels in saffron! It is a must to drink the most delicious strawberry caipirinhas; not to mention the exceptional mojitos!  The wait staff is exceptionally professional! Adam, the manager/owner, runs a tight ship and no stone is left unturned to make all patrons feel at home and enjoy a heavenly dinner.  Happy Hour is a must!!! There are also two private dining areas for parties.  When you visit Vegas, make Via Brasil a must stop- you will not be disappointed.

For three of the four in our party (including my ten and twelve year old) this was our first time at a Brazilian Steakhouse. The servers and hostess and staff went out of their way to make sure we felt comfortable and knew what to expect. The salad bar was incredible! I could have just eaten that and been totally happy...except that the meat was amazeballs! First the salad and starters bar- great selection of veggies, bruschetta, dips, awesome cheeses and olives, pastas, and more. They kept the bar clean and stocked! There were a number of made to order sides too - we tried the asparagus, mushrooms, plantains, broccoli, fries, mashed potatoes and everything was very nicely cooked and seasoned. We ordered a bottle of wine to go with dinner - their selection was large, and the prices ran the gamut from inexpensive to crazy! The meat was, as I mentioned, amazeballs. We tried just about everything, and they were awesome about serving well done meat to my daughter and I and medium well and my son and hubby. Our favorites were Tri tip, New York strip and the lamb. Make sure you try the special of the day. Eight big thumbs up from our family!
Fabulous staff and atmosphere with great food and the desert oh my will recommend to everybody plus bring all our friends and family

My husband made a reservation for the family on Friday night for 7:30.  We had a groupon and wanted to use it, so that was the biggest incentive, plus payday meant I had money to spend.  The long week at work also meant I was ready to relax and eat good food.
Walked in and our table was ready.  The service was amazing!  Since it was our first time, we had to learn a little about the process.  Everyone was very attentive to us all.  We got clean plates every so often, and water was refilled before it ran out.
The food was delicious.  My 3 year old could not get enough.  The salad bar had risotto, salad, seafood, mushrooms, rice, and other inviting items.  There were also side dishes you could order.  We got fries for the kids, and asparagus and collard greens for hubby and I.  Then came the meat!  When I turned my card over to green, the servings came nonstop!  There was skirt steak, top sirloin, pork rib, beef rib, prime rib, bacon wrapped turkey, bacon wrapped beef tenderloin, pork tenderloin, chicken legs, frog legs, my  favorite corn, and I don't remember what else.  By the end of dinner, my 3 year old kept asking for more steak!  They brought some out just for him.  For dessert, we had the creme brulee.  It was a huge portion that all of us could share.  It was nice and creamy, not to sweet and was a nice finish to a fantastic dinner.
For all four of us, our bill with the groupon came out to 73 and change.  I tipped 20.  The pricing is great especially since the kids are free.  I definitely think it is worth the money.  If you want to go to Via Brasil, but are on the fence or think that it is a lot to spend, I would say GO GO GO.
I have been to better brazilIan  restaurants! Great drinks and excellent service. They do have a buffet as well included with your meal.

**Please be advised***
This place is an absolute scam not only was the service terrible but they over charged our bill and they are RACIST. Our party of 14 people were charged 200$ per card without our consent when it should have been 126.00. The manager wasn't apologetic at all she kept sending her server out to deal with us. After messing up the bill not once but twice they still over charged my sister. They placed a 70$ deposit which was promised to be returned to her account which never happened and completely overcharged her by $275. After over an hour of waiting for the corrections to be made on our cards the manager finally made her way out and blamed her own server for charging everyone incorrectly. It was down right inconsiderate and poorly ran, you would think they would comp a meal or take something off however a thing.

When calling back a day later to have them correct the charge the host said there were busy and couldn't take our call. They are also RACIST, when calling back a 3rd time the person who picked up referred to our party as the "big black polynesian family" and was so rude.

Still a week later and nothing has been credited back to my sisters account. We will continue with legal actions and report this restaurant to the better business bureau. No one should have to be deal with such ignorant people and be charged for the incorrect bill.

Sweet i've found me another happy hour that is both enjoyable and not wallet busting.

Started out with a Passion Martini (Sky Passion Infused Vodka and Muddled Strawberry)
Very girly looking drink with the reddish pink color and bits of muddled strawberry but it's light and has a pleasant sweetness to it without any bite from the vodka. Well balanced but not very pronounced in the passion fruit flavor. I tend to order drinks slightly on the sweeter side and this caught my attention because i have a soft spot for passion fruit. Had i payed attention and actually read the rest of the menu i would have ordered the Passion Fruit mojito.

We came from another nearby restaurant taking advantage of their happy hour and someone suggested that we hit up Via Brasil's since it's pretty close by so i didnt order very much.

Grabbed a Asparagus Risotto that was decent at best. It tasted more of a rice in a heavy sauce with some asparagus bits instead of an actual risotto.

Additionally while browsing the menu (regular menu not happy hour) the Brazilian style kale soup caught my eye and i ordered one of those. The broth was very bland and the sausages they threw in had no flavor at all. Also the kale was julienne so there was no big chunks of kale instead there was a huge mess of kale slivers. I was in the mood for a soup and this one didnt meet my expectations but then again who orders soup in a Brazilian style steak house?

I plan on coming back here in the near future. Since it was my first time here i didnt know i can order the same cuts of meat by the ounce and pay for it that way instead of doing the entire Brazilian steakhouse dining experience

First time at a Brazilian steak house.Sterling dinner for 2! Delicious! Medium rare steak. Mouth watering Shrimp. Filet mignon wrapped in bacon the best . Salmon with lime and pomegranate sauce perfect combination. Will definitely be returning to dine again! Service was excellent.

Terrible! My wife and I ate here after a crossfit competition. We were starving and in need of some protein. We chose to give this place a try as we've tried several other Brazilian steakhouse throughout the valley. 

The salad bar was horrible. The selection was small and they were removing hot foods as they were checking the temp of the water and the burners/warmers weren't working. I appreciate the fact they removed the food that wasn't being kept warm...it just further reduced the already minimal selection. 

The meats weren't well seasoned, sides of yucca and fried bananas were underwhelming. I ordered black beans and rice but my waitress never brought it out. I didn't even remind her as my wife and I didn't want to risk yet another poor tasting dish at that point. 

The only good tasting food was the saut√©ed shrimp. Save your money and go to Texas de Brazil or anywhere but here.

This is an a-ok spot. The prices are outstanding. The offerings are diverse. But the quality is lackluster.

The space itself is nice. Very open with an understated, modern feel. Not too fancy, not too casual. The service is good. Not outstanding, but good.

I was here for brunch. Again, the prices are fab. Less than $25 for AYCE salad bar, meats, omelettes, benedicts, and waffles. And then an additional $15 for all you can drink bloody marys, mimosas, bellinis, etc. Needless to say, I filled up fast.

The salad bar is on the small side, but I liked that they also had hot offerings, incluidng a lobster bisque soup, steamed clams, and rigatoni alla vodka. The vodka sauce was quite delicious.

For the meats, there were numerous offerings. A couple were really good. Others were just ok. And others were eh, I'll just leave the rest of it sitting here on the my plate. Unlike some of the competitors, Via Brasil has warm pineapple, ham, chicken, turkey, etc. But the red meat is truly what it's all about - and it's what tastes the best IMHO.

If you somehow still manage to have room after all that food, there is also a dessert cart where you can select from an array of desserts, I had the cheesecake. The cheesecake itself was fine, but the berries were a bit too tart for my liking (and I love tart and sour things too). I'm not sure there's really a point to getting dessert here.

In the end, I'm still a bigger fan of a competitor place. But I can definitely see myself coming here again for brunch.

The meats were the best in town, BUT they gave you the tiniest  portions ever. Had to ask 3 or more times for the quality items. They were on point with the Costco dogs and sirlion.  One of the severs said they were out of beef ribs. This was 8:00 on a Monday? That's not an all you can eat in my book. Very disappointed,  will not be back.

Try to give 5 star. Very good food and very good services.
Meat are very good. food the above par. Not much i can say. I just wish the decor of the dinning room could be better.
Great service. Delicious food. What more can you ask for? Definitely better than Texas De Brazil and Yolie's Brazillian Steakhouse.

My husband and friends went here for a Sunday lunch (1:00pm) and by 3:30pm I was in a food coma and on our way home.  I walked into our house and walked straight into the bedroom (get your head out of the gutter!) where I had to take a nap until 8:00pm.  When I  woke up, I wondered "what the hell happened?"  Meat Feast is what happened.

Yes, that is a true story.  Yes, as someone referred to it below as a "food parade" is true.  Did I love it?  Absolutely.

We had a group of 8 people.  I did not know what to expect about going there.  But the waiter explained everything to us. They have a salad bar thing- salad, pasta, etc. so I went over there and got a few things.  

And then the meat came. 

 It started at a slow pace and quickly picked up to where I had like 10 pieces of meat on my plate, but didn't want to pass up the meat guy when he came to the table.  Eventually, I had to turn my thing over so they didn't offer me any more meat.   And it was damn good meat.  I say meat, because I had so many different types, its very hard to remember all of it.

We have some friends that are Asian and from Hawaii and they asked about chicken hearts.  Within 10 minutes, the meat guy came to our table with chicken hearts.  (not something I would ever try again)  But how accommodating!  

Everyone was really nice and willing to answer any questions!

Recommendation: wear stretchy pants- you'll need it.

It's been a year since I have been there... I think it might be time to go back!

Totally had a wonderful experience here. Food was great service was spot on the whole team worked together to make our brunch perfect....
Highly recommend this place....

I can not give this restaurant anything less than 5 stars. The food is phenomenal and the service is top notch. We've been there at least 3 maybe 4 times and the food is always fast, hot, abundant and incredibly delicious. The waitstaff is very friendly. And very attentive. On slower week nights, the staff will almost hover around you. Like the minute your glass is less than half full, here they come to fill it up. On our last visit we ordered the signature Brazilian drink the caipirinha, delicious by the way, and when the manager came around to check on us, she noticed our drinks were not being drunk, and asked if they were made to our satisfaction, the truth is with all the food; the amazing salad bar with its impressive variety & the yummy side dishes you get to choose from & the parade of seemingly endless meats served by friendly gauchos, the drinks got overlooked!! We forgot all about them!!! But major points for noticing that there may have been an issue with them. 

I know this isn't the only churrascaria in town. There are several to choose from. Texas De Brazil in town square, good. Same exact concept but different vibe. Very hustley & bustley. A very different pace than Via Brasil. And certainly not as friendly. And I once used the restroom there...to wash my hands before my meal. And it was not a good experience. Someone had some major issues in one of the stalls and I couldn't get the horror out of my mind all through dinner. There is also Fogo de Chao which I've never tried but can't imagine it to be better than Via Brasil. Via Brasil's location scores points too...not in a busy mall or on the strip. 
Great brunch & happy hour specials as well. If you like meat, this is your place!! And if you don't, you can order just the salad bar portion which has a good variety of hot food too! Last time they had steamed clams on the bar!!! Jackpot!!

Where do I start?? We've been to a few Brazilian steak houses here in town but I have to say this place is the best in town! Took the hubby here for his birthday, decided to go for the sterling menu, which is rodizio style, which is only $50 per person but it includes the salad bar, side dishes and every meat in the place! The salad bar was amazing and it had lobster bisque! Which I'm a big fan of only if it's made correctly and this place makes it correctly! The meat was just non stop. Before we could finish one, the next one came along. Rack of lamb, lamb chops, filet
Mignons, prime rib, chicken, shrimps, the list just goes on and on. But all the food was so delicious, tender and moist! And to top it all off, the customer service was superb! And to end the dinner, the staff came out with a birthday caramel flan with a big sparkler just for my husbands birthday. Thank you everyone so much!

This was our first visit to Via Brasil - we have been to other Brazilian steakhouses. Upon arrival, we noticed how spacious and clean the restaurant is. Our server, M. Gerardo, was so pleasant and helpful. Offered and delivered sauces for meats and additional refills of items we especially enjoyed. We were most impressed by the flavors and temperatures of every meat we tasted! Honestly, the food (both salad bar and meat) was much better than any other Brazilian steakhouse we have visited. They also offer BRUNCH! Would definitely recommend!
I like the ambiance so much and not crowded for a wednesday night. There is no wait. Staff are very approachable especially our Fidel. Lobster Bisque is .

My wife and I went here for Valentine's day and while the atmosphere here was nice and service was good I can't give the location more than three stars.  The choices while numerous I felt were not worth the price.

I can't for the life of me understand their four star rating. We've been there a couple of times so this review is based on the few trips we've had so far. The first time we came for the AYCE, and their selection as well as quality was way below par compared to the other Brazilian steakhouses in town. Very little to choose from at the salad bar, and the taste was bland. The meats didn't taste very fresh and everything was super chewy and salty.

The next couple times we came for their bar menu with groups of 8 to 10 people. The food took over an hour to come out, and this last time it took an hour and a half for everybody to receive their meals.!!! There were only like four other tables with people so we couldn't understand why the kitchen was so slow. On top of that the pao de Cajo bread came out stone cold 2x and when they served them the third time they felt like they had been microwaved. The "plain" rice was insanely salty, The Churrasco steak was so salty and chewy I had to return it. The Angus sliders Were so dry they were not edible. 

This place is a far cry from Texas de Brazil. If you want good Brazilian barbecue, it's worth dealing with the strip traffic and wait (unless u have reservation) to eat there. That place is awesome on all levels.

Everything was great. Service was fantastic, as was the salad bar and the sides. The meats were all amazing, my favorites being the bacon wrapped filet, flank steak, rib eye, and shrimp. Excellent atmosphere for both date nights and family gatherings. 5/5 stars earned.
Best Brazilian statehouse I've been too, great atmosphere And great service. I gotta give it 110% on service, Thanks Ricardo for making it a great experience. Definitely will be back soon.

If you love steak, lamb, chicken, turkey, you will love this place! The waiters and staff are friendly, and the atmosphere is quite nice, less hectic than other Brazilian places out there. You can get your pick of the liter when it comes to side choices, I prefer the asparagus or take a look at their salad bar. The downside is, you must make reservations, or prepare to wait! They did go up in their prices since last year, meaning when I first went there dessert was included and now it is not. Other than that, I am a fan of Via Brasil!
Came here with a group of friends for the weekend brunch. Very delicious and lots of options to satisfy everyone. I'd definitely come back!

Extremely disappointed with this place after our visit last Sunday for my grandmothers 75th birthday. There were 7 of us and we all ordered the Sterling dinner which is $49.99 per person. The Sterling, which is the more expensive choice, offers 21 meats including bacon wrapped filet, porterhouse, lamb, strip steak, etc. All the meat you can want plus unlimited sides and salad bar, sounds good right? WRONG! 

I'll start off with the salad bar. It was very tiny compared to its competitors. There was a small section of lettuce and toppers to make your own salad, some specialty cold cuts and cheeses, a few hot items and some cold salads. Blah. Nothing stood out, but obviously the salad bar is just a filler. Skip this if at all possible. 

The sides. They have a good selection, but again nothing really stood out and these are also fillers. We got the steak fries, which are not the thick fries they are actually skinny so I don't know why they call them steak fries, fried banana, mashed potatoes, yucca fries and saut√©ed mushrooms. All served with your meal, and unlimited.  

The "rodzio" style dinner left something to be desired. As I said we all got the Sterling dinner. Of the 21 meats on the menu, we may have tried 15 and that's because they did not offer the others. We were offered shrimp, garlic bread, and flank steak a ton of times, yet the expensive meats such as the filet were offered sparingly. When they finally brought the filet to the table everyone opted for some. It was wrapped in bacon which was hardly cooked, so it made the filet chewy and overly salty. Most took the bacon off. When they came around again we asked if they could make the filet without bacon, and they said sure and it would be 10 minutes. No problem. I am not joking when I say we did not get the filet for a good 40 minutes even after we talked to a manager who said she would get it out to us asap. She did mention that the filet had been offered to our table 3 times, which is interesting that they keep track of that. I guess to throw it back in your face when you complain? I'm sorry.. Is $50 a person not enough to warrant more than 3 trips to our table with the prime meats? Disgusting. 

Side note the place was not busy at all, we went Sunday night at 5:30 and there were maybe 8-10 tables so I am not sure what the deal was. Most of the meats we did get were good. I enjoyed the top sirloin and the filet without bacon. I can't look past the bad service and the fact we weren't offered all the meats that we paid for. Looking at their menu now, I never saw the lamb shank, pork ribs, tangy chicken, salmon, or Brazilian pork. They sat us at a big round table at the back of the restaurant in the corner, I kinda feel like we were just shoved off to the side and ignored. Oh and another thing is be prepared to eat in the dark. They have the lights down so low, you can't even tell which meat is which and what your eating. Super annoying. I get wanting to have ambiance, but they go a little too far. 

And finally the icing on the cake is that we told them it was grandma's birthday and wanted to get her a piece of cheesecake, her favorite dessert, and they brought caramel flan. What the hell! She doesn't even like flan. It's like they didn't care to accommodate any of our requests at all. We were paying for the dessert, although it should have been comped after spending $350, but they still couldn't get it right. Extremely, extremely disappointing. After expressing our concerns to the manager she did take $10 off everyone's dinner, which is the only why I gave them a star. But that won't save them. Texas DE Brazil from here on out. I'll never step foot in this place again.

Same prices, but has nothing on the food at Texas de Brazil.  Would never opt to come again in comparison to the option to go to Texas de Brazil.  They don't have filet mignon (without bacon at least) and no garlic sirloin.  Garlic mashed potatoes weren't awesome.

Ok, I went here with the family and we were welcomed by the staff. The meats were delicious, and the suckling pig could of been crispier. They had warm rolls, but the side like rice and veggies kept running out. 
We had to get the waiter like 5 times to keep our plates filled. The selection, however, is for the very discerning palate. Not good for kids at all or picky eaters at that since the variety was limited. (Think alot of cheeses and weird pasta dishes...) I wouldn't come here again unless some else paid, and the desserts and drinks were extra. So a family of four (2 adults, 1 child and 1 free/infant), with drinks came to $160+ tip. Yup...should've gone to the Carnival at the Rio.
The food was excellent loved it the bacon wrapped filet was great
Took my granddaughter for her birthday.  The place was marvelous.  The salad bar was fresh and varied. The meat kept coming .  The servers were friendly and informative.  Will come again .

We were impressed.  Service was very attentive and food was excellent.  We went on a Tuesday night when they had 1/2 price bottles of wine...We highly recommend this place.  We frequent Brazilian food and this was top notch!

Via Brasil is by far the best steak house in Las Vegas. We came here for happy hour to the bar. We had a few caiparinas and mojitos. The bar server Victor offered us to try the different selections of meat they had to offer in the dinning room. We were not disappointed. I can't praise our server Ricardo enough for the excellent recommendations. The beef ribs were so tender and juicy, by far the best meat. The ribeye and salmon were extremely good as well. 5 Stars ! Will be back.
Delicious Food, Friendly environment & everyone is very attentive... Will definitely come back.

Hmm. I'm conflicted. I likened this restaurant to Texas de Brazil in my head... We went on a Sunday afternoon and there was one other table occupied. The restaurant is clean and the hostess and waiter, both very nice. We started with the salad bar and the selections were "okay". Nothing spectacular, except the asparagus risotto- that was tasty. My picky toddler loved the lobster bisque (she ate free). The meats started coming and maybe because it wasn't so busy it almost seemed like they were trying to get rid of the meat. As for the taste, some were nice while others were tasteless, too salty or very over/under cooked. Maybe we should've spoken up, but at that point- it didn't really matter. For the equivalent price of other establishments that provide the same service, I expected more. There was nothing really wrong... It was just like visiting Olive Garden as opposed to a truly authentic Italian restaurant.

This place just gets better and better every time we come here. I wish more businesses, especially restaurants conducted business the way these folks do. They go above and beyond every time. I'm a big fan of Brazilian food and this is the best in town. The competition is tough but this is the number one establishment out of all the Brazilian steakhouses.

Via Brazil is hands down one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas!!! Our server and the manager were 5 star quality. The meats were perfect and the appetizers were worth every bite. Help support a locally owned diamond of a restaurant. My wife and I come a few times a year and have never been disappointed.

It's sad but I have to knock off a couple of stars for Via Brasil.  First, they would not take my groupon, claiming that the Sunday before Valentine's Day was a holiday.  If they are going to have liberal interpretations of holidays, they need to put the exact dates on the groupon.  It's not like the groupon lasts forever, like restaurant.com certificates do.  Just figure out the dates for the period that the groupon is valid and put them on there.  Voila, problem solved.  In addition, they had the server give us the bad news.  The manager needs to step up and deal with those things, not leave it to the poor server.  I contacted Groupon and, fortunately, they gave me my money back.  Groupon is so nice about stuff like that.

Second, the service this time was slow and strange.  It took a while for our server to notice that we were out of drinks.  Meanwhile, the same guy kept coming by over and over and over again with lamb chops even though we had refused over and over and over again.  He was seriously acting like a zombie.  A zombie with lamb chops on a very sharp metal stick.
