Third, at the end of this month they are adding an all-you-can-eat pasta option for $22.95.  I think this automatically makes this place less classy.  It also shows me that they are getting a little greedy because the food cost for pasta is so low.  It's going to be like a pricey Olive Garden with people running around with sharp metal sticks with meat on them.  Plus, if the servers can't handle drinks consistently, I'm not sure they can handle AYCE pasta.  Unless the pasta comes on sticks.  :) 

On the positive side, the salmon, which is served from a cart, was excellent.  Nicely cooked with a tasty mango sauce.  The man serving the salmon was really enthusiastic and nice.  He even remembered when he came back a second time that we had already had the salmon and appropriately asked if we'd like some more.  Also, the woman operating the dessert cart was super nice and helpful.

I'm bummed that I had a mediocre experience after so many good ones.  Via Brasil, I think we need some time apart to work things out.  Hopefully time heals all wounds.

Awesome food and customer service. The Lobster Bisque was awesome in the Salad Bar. The salad bar is great and fresh! The meat was flavorful and tender. The waiters were very warm and helpful. We went there for lunch and it was 35 bucks without drinks and desserts. But I think it was completely worth it. They served almost all kinds of steak, leg of lamb, turkey, chicken drumstick. It came with free sides including fried banana (which tasted awesome with steaks and other meat), beans, rice, steamed broccoli, mashed potato and lot of others which i dont even remember. It was a great experience and I can't wait to go back!

This place was much better than Texas de Brazil and not to mention a little cheaper.  The BF said that all the meats were really good and not as tough as TDB's meats.  The salad bar had a little less selection in the vegetable area, but there was beef carpaccio (better than Brio's apparently), mussels, and other seafood selections not offered at TDB.  The passed meats included picanha, rib eye, flank steak, leg of lamb, rack of lamb, bacon wrapped turkey, chicken, baby back pork ribs, beef ribs, salmon, and Brazilian sausage (I couldn't stop laughing when the BF told the guy with the sausage how much he "love[s] Brazilian sausage").

The sides that the AYCE Rodizio dinner comes with are mashed potatoes, steamed vegetables, cheese rolls, cinnamon sugar bananas (yum), and others upon request (just ask your waiter) all included in the set price.  The only thing that wasn't included was dessert.

Before coming I visited their website and signed up for their weekly newsletter and received an e-mail for 20% off  their Rodizio dinner for up to 4 people - awesome, now we can do a double date with our friends.

The service here was really good.  Our water glasses were always filled, and they asked (before we had to ask) if we would like more Coke - a very rare experience.  We were looking for the lamb so we asked the flank steak guy and literally 1 minute after he left, the lamb dude showed up - amazing.  

Also they have a mini-Rodizio offering AYCE 5 meats (picanha, ribeye, lamb, turkey wrapped in bacon, and salmon) for only $18.95 (Available in the bar and patio area only).  Might go back to try this option... too bad they don't offer the Brazilian sausage.  haha
Meats were great. However, their reservation policy was a mess! Had a reservation for 1145 and dint get seated until 1230.
Everything about our dining experience was absolutely superb!  Outstanding service and some of the most delicious steak ever.  The salad bar is incredible too!  I highly recommend it.

Holy cow, every time i go it is remarkable. The meat is cooked perfectly and they make sure they bring you out everything to your specification....almost like you are the only ones there. Its Rodizio style- all you can eat perfectly cooked meat. Start with your salad bar and fine breads before the feast. If you havent experienced it, you need to ....stat.

Went to eat here a few days ago with some friends. Really enjoyed my time here.  The staff was very friendly and always there when you needed them.  

The salad bar did not have as many options at other Brazilian steakhouses I have visited before but they did have new options.  I loved the asparagus risotto the most.
The meats are great and they also offer a side menu that includes, mashed potatoes, fried bananas, onion rings, asparagus, etc. 

I will be coming back here in the future.

First time at this restaurant.   Came here with a large party and service was good.  We all ordered the Rodizio dinner It was a little difficult for the servers with the meat to get around the corners of our table, but overall did a great job.  The salad bar is pretty large with a nice spread of items to choose from.  A wide variety of meats and cuts were available.  Initially, it was hard to enjoy the food due to the interruptions from all the different meats coming out.  It is a bit overwhelming for the first-timers to this type of dining, but I would definitely go back.  The bacon wrapped turkey, the bbq pork, and the tri-tip are among my favorites.  I had the Creme broulee for dessert and it was very good too.
Been here many times and love it.  The service is exceptional.  Salad bar is great and meats are even better.  Everyone is extremely friendly as well.
Haven't been here since 2013...still one of my favorite places to come not only for happy hour, but for dinner also.

Excellent food and endless meat oh wow!!! My fianc√© and I usually go to Texas de Brazil but we decided to try this place since they are a tad bit closer. I'm actually impressed! Place is delicious and the staff are extremely nice! Our drinks are never low and the food is amazing. I also enjoy the fact that their salad bar is gluten free! Amazing! We will definitely come back here again. No more Texas de Brazil for us! Were gonna come here only!

Food is great 
Great atmosphere 
Sometimes if you are sitting at the bar service can be pretty bad with constant new bar tenders being trained
Don't know about the food - but I do know I called 7 times and waited on hold for over 30 minutes. The customer service was atrocious.

Great food, great drinks, and great service. We had a family reunion here and they accommodated us in their banquet area. Try the Sangria, it's delicious. Unlimited meat comes around the table, accompanied by sides, and the cold/hot food bar. The only downside is that they charge a bit much for kids, IMO. The parking is plentiful.
Very good food, great customer service.  Very rare we give big tips these days but this place deserves one so leaving a big tip and positive feedback!!!
Wonderful Sunday Brunch!! All the food was amazing & our server,  Dante, was awesome..He was very polite,  knowledgeable & helpful! We will definitely be back soon because of his service!

The service far surpasses from what'd you'd expect at a True 5 star restaurant. Majority of this reason is from our head waiter Gerald. He was very well spoken and his service and attentiveness was the best I've ever experience in any restaurant that you would expect to pay over $1000 for a table of two. 

The style is what you'd expect from day Texas De Brazil. The staff in general seems more suited to your needs and they always ask for your special requests so that you always get the meat you want.

I will def be back.

Horrible experience!  Starting with the waiter requiring a credit card to be held "hostage" for each party that wanted separate checks even if we planned to pay cash..  There were 8 people in my party for happy hour.   I have been to this restaurant several times for Happy Hour in the 3 years I have lived in Las Vegas.  They have recently advertised their restaurant quite aggressively.  I will not (nor will the other people in my group) be going back again.  After sitting there for almost an hour and repeatedly asking waiter for a drink (even water would have been nice), we finally got our drinks.  I ordered a Corona with lime and was brought a Stella something or other...not what I ordered.  Others ordered wine and were served something  other than what they ordered. The food orders were all mixed up. Some people got their food right away and were finished eating before others even received their food. Then when we tried to pay our tabs and leave, the waiter brought the wrong credit card to the person asking for hers (scary!)  We asked for the manager who took 30 minutes to come to the table.  We were trying to explain our frustration, but she was looking over our heads at the table next to ours because they were complaining to the waiter as well.  She never once tried to make things right.  I asked for my credit card and my check.  She said she had to run my credit card first.  I told her I never I intended to use my credit card for payment, that I was paying cash, and that the waiter was holding my credit card "hostage".  All in all, it was a terrible experience and neither I nor my friends will be back to this restaurant.
Nothing ultra bad about this Brazilian steakhouse...just nothing great when compared to other Brazilian Steakhouses in town.  A strong 2 stars or week 3 stars for me.

I had been here before and always had a good experience but this last time was enough for me to say I'm never going back. I was there for a birthday party and there was a group of us. First off, they started bringing out the meat and even though we all had our card flipped, weren't offering it to all of us. The waitress never took our order for side dishes. She claimed to put them in and they didn't come until asked for them repeatedly. Even then, we got 2 trays of mashed potatoes, one fry, and one tray of plantains. There were 12 of us. Also, they have this grilled mozzarella that is to die for. (The only thing I'll miss there.) Well I asked for it no less than 5 times. Finally, as we finished up, someone walked passed with a try of it and I had to grab the guy so I could have some. THEN, the kicker! I left cash on the table as a tip and wrote cash on my receipt, the waitress literally ran after us in the parking lot saying there was no cash on the table. What?! The entire experience was just bad. Go to Texas de Brazil. Everything is much better there.

I was visiting Las Vegas from Texas and had high hopes for this place. I'm avid Fogo De Chao supporter, so I was hoping this place would compete given the reviews. However, my experience was sub par. The service was abysmal, and it took 30 minutes before we received any meat or appetizers. The meat was pretty good, but for the price could be better. After dinner we ordered dessert, which took another 30 minutes to bring out even though all we ordered was ice cream and pineapples.

In summary, Fogo De Chao highly imitated never duplicated.
Come very very hungry! The food is great here, if it's your first time try everything.
Amazing food! Came with our friends Newton and Jenna...they highly recommended this place and I can see why!!

I love this place, so much better than Texas de Brazil. The service was great and they serve this great tasting salmon table side. I'm not a big fan of fish, especially Salmon but whatever they did, it was awesome and so was the sauce. I especially like how the meats were not overly seasoned so you can actually enjoy the flavor of the meat accompanied with the variety of spices. I've gone to Texas de Brazil three times and each time their meat was overly seasoned. The service was great and I love the atmosphere.

You had better like meat to truly enjoy Via Brasil.  The atmosphere is lovely and the staff is quite attentive (more on this later).  If you are not familar with the concept these brazilian steakhouses are an all you eat motif with a salad bar and then meats on long skewers are brought to the table and you can have as much of them as you desire.

Most of the meats were hot (not all) and flavorful.  There was prime rib, steak, chicken, sausage and some I am probably forgetting.  They also include in the price all of the side dishes you want, served in a family style fashion, meaning enough for the whole table.  The sides were OK but not that special.

I actually found while the salad bar had many choices along with soup that making an old fashion salad was not an option.  But if the salad bar is your thing you are going here for the wrong reason and paying way too much.

We were celebrating a 60 year anniversary for my girlfriend's parent and they made us feel special and catered to the 80 year olds well.

My biggest complaint and one which really lasted with me was that the servers and our waiter while seeming polite were actually rude when it came to interrupting on-going conversations at the table.  None of the servers or the waiters seemed even remotely aware that when they come to the table with questions or food to say "excuse me" or wait until they were noticed and instead they proceeded to talk at us with no regard to what was going on at the table.  In some ways I am betting they see this as being attentive but if the same thing happened any other place it would have been classified as what it was, rude.

In my opinion and this is what Yelp is all about, the staff was poorly trained in this one area.  They were otherwise quite gracious.

One last issue and while it was only $7, we had purchased a restaurant.com certificate for $3 which was to cover the first $25 of the bill.  They informed us they were no longer accepting the certificates and offered us a $15 discount. How you can decide to cancel an offer we already paid for is beyond me and they tried to appease us but ended up cheating us out of a few dollars, just not cool.

For those who love beef and who can afford over $40 for dinner this place is still a great experience and be aware as others have written that unless you want to pay dearly for water be specific and ask for tap water.

Brunch needs to improve or it's going to hurt their reputation. We had dinner here before and it was very good: food, service, atmosphere. Brunch was a very different experience, grilled meat was very good of course but service was way off. Nobody explained the brunch menu and there is no printed menu; waiter forgot drink orders; waiter was very slow to check on table - not enough waiters appears to be the problem. I never did find out if they serve their vegetables for brunch in fact I'm still not sure what defines this as brunch. There was a waffle station, the salad bar with some non-brunch type hot items in the bar and the grilled meat. Really didn't meet up to our expectation. Also 30 minutes late in seating us from our reservation time. Fix the service, create a real brunch menu and add waiters. And fix the problem with not honoring reservations at the reservation time.

Love it. 
Heard this was the BEST Brazilian Steak house in Vegas. I believe so. 
The staff is excellent and very attentive. You will not leave hungry or wait for food. 
You will have a hard time stopping. 
I will be back.

Just left here tonight!

I'm a semi regular here and this is one of my top favourite Brazilian Steak Houses to go to here in Las Vegas.

The customer service they have here is great! Super friendly and always willing to help you when it comes to ordering. My husband and I were debating on changing out drink order and the beer our waiter recommended was amazing! Will definitely order from there again.
There has only been one incident in regards to wait times on a holiday (we had reservations) and they quickly resolved the issue along with treated us with free desert. 
They are always on top with treating their guests like superstars!

And the food! Always amazing! The speed is perfect and always coming back when they knew which meats we preferred over others. The salad bar has a wide selection but it's perfect to start you up before a big meal. 

For some people they might say this dinner is too expensive (I think it's well worth the price for the quality they serve!!) but every so often they offer specials that help you out when on a budget! :]

Service was wonderful! Fidel, Anna, and Ashley were incredibly kind and accommodating. We loved the filet mignon sliders and asparagus risotto. The cocktails were good too- but a little on the sweet side. If you're into sweet cocktails, try the x-rated or passion fruit caipirinha, or the strawberry kiwi sangria. If you want a less sweet cocktail, try the lime caipirinha. My fav cocktail was the fortified sangria (it's spiked with brandy and rum)...mmmm

This is strictly for their brunch buffet on Saturday and Sundays. I often wonder why this place is not jam packed on the weekends. A selection of 8 different meats plus 3 types of made to order eggs benedicts, made to order waffles and omlettes, and a salad bar all for $20-$25. This is so much better than fighting it out in the casino buffets. I always make it a point to eat here when Im in town.

Went in there today with my in laws and we were expecting to have a nice relaxing night out. 

As soon as we were seated, without being given 2 seconds to look over the menu, we were bombarded and uncomfortably rushed to order.
We asked for time to look over the options but the lady ignored our request and forced us to make decisions right then and there. 
She wanted our food order before we even had a chance to pick our wines / drinks. She spoke in a rude and demeaning manner so we decided to walk out before the water even got served. We let her know her customer service was the reason why we were leaving and the amazing thing is.... she was surprised. Like she didn't know she was sounding like a b****. 
My assumption is she was a manager or an owner? Blonde hair and had a Russian accent. No smiles just barking orders.

Im going to start by saying I am not a red meat eater or a chicken! But I do eat seafood and I do think this place is very good still. You can still bring a vegetarian to a place like this be cause their salad bar area is really good they have all kinds of grilled veggies, cous cous salad, spaghetti stuff like that. I do eat seafood though so stick with ordering shrimp a la carte and eating some of the sides. I didn't order the salmon because it's farm raised Atlantic. Farmed seafood is usually unhealthier than wild. The service is good here and they are on top of it when bringing out all the meats all the people I was with got the rodizio. They said everything was good. Oh the sangrias here are amazing I recommend.

Thanksgiving morning, Hubby calls to see if there is an opening for a lunch reservation.  

Lucky for us, they had a lunch spot for us.  

This place is very open and well lit with a bunch of windows bringing in the natural light.

Hubby was super happy that there was a huge television that was playing the football game.. 

The food was great!  We were seated right by the kitchen so we pretty much had first dibs on any meats that came in the dining area.  So yummy!  I piled all the different types of meats on to my plate and just feasted!

They had a salad bar with different types of salads.  They also had a cheese plate on the salad bar and they had a super yummy butternut squash soup.  I tried not to fill myself on salad bar items because I really wanted to enjoy the various meats they were bringing by.. 

The staff was super accommodating.  They were always ready and willing to answer any question we had and to help us in any way.  

The toddler isn't a huge meat eater, but she enjoyed the sides that they provided us at the table.  She loved the bread and rice and broccoli.  

This definitely a place I'd love to visit again when in Vegas.

It was like night and day from coming here twice. The first time it was just my husband and I, the food and service were amazing. We came on a weekday when they first opened for the night. The meats were delicious, the salad bar was completely stocked and our server and his helper were great. He answered all of our questions, as I was also inquiring about the king crab legs for my kids; whom we wanted to bring at a later time. Our sides and sauces came out as ordered and they both would pop in from time to time to check in and see how we were doing and make small talk. 
Fast forward to the second time coming here. What a let down to say the very least! We came on a weekend, had reservations for 8:30 and brought our kids and daughter in law (a party of 6) after totally talking this place up. I was surprised to see that it was a ghost town for being the weekend. No problem tho. I figured we would just get exceptional service because they weren't busy at all...wrong!  First we got bum rushed the minute we sat down with like 3 waiters (or 1 and his 2 helpers?) the vibe we got right off the bat from them was, hurry up an order, eat, and get out. They were not friendly at all. In fact, the main waiter acted like he was in a rush, was super busy or was trying to get off early. We all ordered the sterling with 3 orders of the king crab legs and headed off to the salad bar...Which by the way was half empty, like they didn't bother to restock it. I thought paying these kinds of prices only to have the salad bar be pretty much empty?! Get back to the table and literally 4 meat guys are already standing by our table about to bum rush us like our servers did. None of them were friendly at all either. The meat this time, had no flavor or was super salty. We ordered sides and sauces and did not receive some of them. The only drinks they refilled was our waters, didn't bother to refill our sodas or tea (nor did they even ask if we wanted it refilled). The kicker, was when our 3 orders of "supposed" king crab legs came out. It was a complete joke! It was crab alright...but NOT king crab legs. They were the skinniest legs and smallest portions I've ever seen. When we questioned our waiter about it, he bought the manager over and even he looked embarrassed. Of course he wasn't going to say anything bad. He just stated, that's how they are and left. Knowing we were unhappy our servers attitudes got worse and they started rushing us even more. Like they wanted us to stop eating, pay and leave. By this time, that's exactly what we wanted to do. The food nor service was good at all. One of the servers got cocky and said, is there anything else or are you guys done? (While rolling his eyes at us) I told him, no that's it...but it would've been nice to get the sauces and sides that we asked you for. He straight turned around and left. When he came back, he plopped the check down on our table and put the sauce and side dish right in front of me and said here you go. Just like that, I couldn't believe it! Manager ended up coming back around, took our check and took off 2 of the orders of crab legs, which we thought was nice and reasonable. About to sign the check and cocky waiter is literally standing over me and mean mugging me. Word of advice, as a waiter, never ever stand over the person signing the check while giving them an attitude (especially after screwing with them), because you will more than likely get nothing for a tip! Funny thing is, we were still gonna tip too. Just not our normal 20+% but something. After that stunt...pshht forget it...He got nothing! 
Needless to say, we won't be back here again. Paying these kinds of prices, you expect to be treated decent, the food to be phenomenal, and to receive what you ordered. We got none of that our second time around unfortunately.
Great service and food! We had a groupon and this did not affect our service which I have found at times can! overall great experience!

Good Summerlin location. They have a good happy hour with drinks ranging from $4-7 and it's every day of the week. Compared to other Brazilian steakhouses (like Fogo de Chao), this was very good. Wasn't too busy on a Sunday evening, so the waiters were attentive. The Top Sirloin and Prime Rib are the BEST offerings on their menu. Salad bar was pretty decent. And, since we were celebrating a friend's birthday, they threw in a free small dessert.

3 stars is AOK, right? This place was a-OK.
I suppose my issue is the week before, we went to another Brazilian Restaurant in Summerlin and were blown away by the flavors there...a little (just a little) disappointed.

Here's my take on the place.
1. Really good salad bar. nice assortment. Would have liked to see more fruit on the line as it's a good pallet cleanser when you are switching from one cut of meat to another.
2. Our waiter was awesome. Polite and attentive.
3. We opted to get the Sterling Meal (more cuts of meat) - They tout 21. We didn't count, but it seemed to be the same 12 or so in the hour that we dined. This seems to be an overstatement. (3 stars...a-ok, right? - not a big complaint.)
4. Great wine menu.
5. The meats were bland. They do provide sauces - but a Brazilian steakhouse is supposed to be well seasoned.
6. Service will poorly timed. It's like a gaucho fire-drill at times. Way too fast with them almost lining up to serve each guest.

Again, this place is A-OK. Unfortunately, when you have a restaurant in a town where there are so many choices, you have to be more than just A-OK.

This was our first time at Via Brasil.  It will likely be our last.  I understand that they expected to be very busy for Easter Brunch.  However, our reservation is at 12:30, we were seated at 12:35, and we are still waiting to pay the bill. The food quality was okay, not as good as Texas de Brazil in Town Square.  The salad bar left a lot to be desired. The sticking point has been the service, which has been tediously slow, and inconceivably so.  The restaurant had plenty of empty tables for brunch. We finally gave up and set our credit card on the table.  The manager finally picked it up, our server then told us that was a problem with our bill, and proceeded to take another 15 minutes to try to bring us the check.  We ordered a bottle of wine and to brunch menu items. I don't understand how this creates a problem. Via Brasil, you seriously need to work on improving your service.  This was a disappointment for us.

Fine dining at it's best.  I just got back from an excellent meal from Via Brasil in summerlin.  I found myself comparing this place to Texas de Brazil in Town Square all night long.  And here is my verdict....The salad bar at Texas de Brazil is better, fresher, tastier.  However, the meats at Via Brasil are superior to Texas.  The meats are not as fatty and just taste better.  My favorites were the prime rib, top sirloin and beef ribs.  Both atmospheres are very nice, clean, and beautiful.  Another observation I made was that the staff at Via (the waiters, the guys that cut the meat, the managers, hostess) were much more professional, courteous and all around nicer than the staff at Texas.  I really liked this place.  I went on a groupon so I ended up paying $50 for 2 people.

The service is good, the meat selection was not, they took forever to bring the meats to our table and when they did they offer us the following, prime rib, sausage, chicken, tri tip over and over and over  the same type of food.

Oh I also has a coupon from Yelp for a free dessert and the manager told me that they do not accept that coupon on holidays  but the coupon do not especify.

Oh on top of that the busboy  drop the dirty plates on oir feet..

I just left this afternoon. I find the groupon to be more bait and switch. So you 24.99 for groupon. I than bring someone who pays full price. Am I the only one who thinks dragging in someone to pay full price is dumb. I thought that my companion would pay the same. So I explain to Anna (the manager) she tells me to get out if her restaraunt and dont come back. Its 430 in the afternoon. There was a better way to handle this. It is my birthday dinner. This is bad customer service. Next call to groupon. I will say that I wasnt expecting anything for free. The coupon should state that its only good for one person per table per reservation. No confusion there.  Bait and switch Groupon should choose better when attaching a brand to a business. Anna should learn better manners. Word of mouth is bad advertising when treated poorly.

This is a very good restaurant. The atmosphere is beautiful; very well decorated. The set up with the fountain is amazing. The servers are very friendly and very nice. Extremely helpful if it is your first time at a Brazilian steakhouse. 

Now, the food: everything in the salad bar was delicious. The salads, the mushrooms, the pasta, the soup; excellent. Along with Fogo de chao, this salad bar is quite possibly the best in town. The meat...now, I am not a connoisseur of steak, but I could tell a difference in not only quality of the meat, but also the taste from other Brazilian steakhouses. The overall quality of the meat seemed lower than at other places; I felt it to be quite rough, even though I asked for medium cooked slices. By comparison, fogo, and even Fleming's, was very tender. It was okay at best in terms of quality. In terms of taste, I found the ribeye (sniffle) to be salty! The RIBEYE! I literally had to spit it out, it was that bad. The lamb was salty as well and it irritated me. The New York strip steak and filet mignon were dry...VERY dry. This saddened me even further :(

However, the top sirloin was amazing, I could eat that all day...

All in all, via is a good place to eat... But for the price, I don't think it's worth it; for $50+, fogo is the better choice.

So it's Christmas. I HATE posting bad reviews, it takes a lot for me to post them. But this placed earned this one. 

For the first time ever we decided to eat out as we didn't have any guests in town. We made dinner reservations for 7:15. We arrived at 7:00. The place was so packed people were crammed in every available space like a can of sardines. The hostess (a brunette) told us it would be about 15 minutes after our reservation as people were hanging out and they were clearing tables. Well we stood in the entry way with our 3 year old for over an hour. We watched person after person come in that had a reservation and they were all given the same exact line. There were two hostesses, I happened to hear the brunette hostess tell the blonde one the line to tell everyone. It went along the lines of "we are waiting for people to leave but also clearing our empty tables. We will get you seated as soon as people clear out" When the poor girl got asked literally every minute by a different person (not exaggerating) how long until they'd be seated or how many parties were in front of them, she nervously played with her tablet then delivered the line she was told to give. She clearly was under trained. I felt badly for her. And if her or her manger is reading this, you did great (hostess, NOT manager) and it's your manager that is to blame for putting you in that situation completely unprepared. Whatever you made tonight, wasn't enough. You couldn't have paid me enough to do your job. When I left I could see the tears in your eyes and I should have said more than Merry Christmas to you. 

We waited over an hour for our table to seat myself, my husband and our toddler. A lovely man with his family waited an entire hour longer than us. Well until we walked away. As we were enjoying our food, I looked to the hostess stand and saw this poor man and his son still waiting for a table while an empty table sat directly next  to us. It was so bothersome that I sent my husband to invite them to our table! It's Christmas for goodness sake. He told my husband he'd finally been given a table, they waited for 2.5 hours! Here's my major complaint. If you're going to take reservations, seat them at least somewhat close to their actual time. This was complete lack of planning, experience, or a thirst for greed. Regardless of which (or all three) someone made a MAJOR mistake and I suspect it will cost you a lot of bad reviews and future business. The only reason you didn't get 1 star is your wait staff was amazing. So to you, the owner and/or manger, you get one star for being incompetent. 

To the rest of the staff, 4 stars. It would be 5 if the people next to us hadn't waited literally 10 minutes for a plate so she could begin eating a meal she waited an hour and a half after her reservation to get. But don't worry, to make it up to the sweet ladies, WE bought their dinners. 

I doubt we will be back. Texas De Brazil will get our business from now on. Or any other Brazilian steak house in town. Your food is great, with the exception of the lobster bisque, it for the lack of a better term, sucks. 

Figure out how to take reservations you can handle. In the long run you'll make more money because you'll get return customers and positive reviews.
This place is amazing every time we eat here and we come back every six months or so. We'd come more often but I'd rather not end up on my 600 lbs. Life. You have to eat here at least once.

We were invited for brunch here and like it a lot.  Then we went to try the dinner version and fell in love with the beef ribs.  It's always the Brazilian sausage and beef ribs for me. OMG, I'm in heaven.  If we go back again I'm going straight for the beef ribs.  Nom nom nom.

My new husband and I had our wedding reception here and we were not disappointed! We worked with Anna who is fantastic. She talked us through everything we could possibly need, had amazing ideas and was always available if I had questions. The food is incredible! Every wedding guest said they loved it and told us it was way better than doing a generic buffet style. We were able to use the private and semi private areas. Anna and her hostess set everything up gorgeously. We had a small reception of only 50 and Via Brazil was perfect for us. The price was just right too! We got a lot of bang for our buck! Thank you Anna and the rest of the staff for making our night perfect!

I like to consider myself a Brazilian steakhouse junkie! I've been to every Brazilian steakhouse in town on more than one occasion to test out service and selection at different time of the year. Now I went here on a whim with my brother. I figured I have to give it a go even though I was really craving another fine steak Resteraunt. I must say it's definitely not bad. They salad bar has a nice selection, the meats are nicely prepared and the side dishes are suitable. Really the only thing lacking for me was depth of flavor in the meat selection. 
My rating is strictly based on flavor. Texas de Brazil has tastier meats and bananas as well as some sides that are lacking on this menu. But that's just personal preference! 

I definitely would go back and I would take a friend or family member. It's worth a try.

We have frequented Via Brasil many times for Happy hour. We were there again last night (03/10/19). We had 11 people in the bar area. George took care of us. He did such an amazing job. All orders were delivered perfectly. We did checks per couples with one single. All checks were prepared perfectly and in a timely manner. The food was outstanding, service was awesome. Thank you George!!!

We are regulars at Via Brasil so it is definitely time I write a review for them.

I love the ambiance of Via. It is dim but not dark. It is always very clean with unseated tables set for the next guest, never any dirty dishes sitting around.

The water wall adds a nice touch and the televisions in the bar area are never too loud, if you can hear them at all.

The salad bar is kept clean and stocked with many options to choose from. The Asparagus Risotto is my favorite but I haven't seen it the last few times we're been there.

It doesn't matter where in the restaurant you are sitting, the gentlemen (Gauchos) with the meats will come to you with all of their offerings!

They will carve a delicious portion of meat right off their skewer and directly onto your plate. All of the selections are hot and fresh.

Charles and the flank steak are my favorite, followed very closely by Rodrigo and the prime rib. 

There are so many tasty meats to choose from, the price for lunch or dinner is well worth it!

Be sure to try the signature Pichana (top sirloin), sliced rare to medium rare. So delicious!!

Carol is a delightful hostess and always has a warm smile and a friendly word for us.

Adam in the dining room is so warm and genuine.

We love all of the staff at Via Brasil, no matter how long it is between visits, we are always treated like family.

There is a reason we keep returning. It is not just the food but it is the staff!

Thank you for being so awesome to us and Charles, thank YOU for honoring my special request on Christmas. 

Regardless of how busy you are, you always seem to find time to bring me some melted mozzarella and I adore you for that.

Merry Christmas and a happy, safe, prosperous new year to all of our friends at Via Brasil! See you all again very soon!

Via Brasil is a carnivore's dream. Like other Brazilian steakhouses, you'll get plenty of cuts of meat from cows, chicken, lamb and more. I've driven by countless times but failed to visit until recently. Located at the corner of Charleston and Ft. Apache, the outside looks impressive, but the interior is even more so. It's large, open, and elegantly decorated.

If you want all-you-can-eat meat, there are two options. "Prime" is $39.99 and includes many basic items like garlic steak, BBQ baby back ribs, chicken breasts, drumsticks, flank steak, pork, and sausage. The higher end option is the "Sterling" for $49.99, which includes everything in the Prime option plus NY steak, lamb chops, leg of lamb, filet wrapped in bacon, salmon, and rib eye.

My favorites were the lamb chops, filet in bacon, grilled shrimp, trip-tip, and short ribs. 

For those that only want the salad bar, you can get that for $24.99. The salad bar has an impressive array of hot and cold dishes, although some turned out to be not so great. The beef carpaccio was under seasoned. Curry mussels were spicy and also felt gritty. The lobster bisque was creamy with rich flavors.

For dessert the creme br√ªl√©e was textbook perfect with a thick layer of sugar coating the top and creamy custard underneath.

It is a bit pricey (for two adults and one kid we spent well over $200), but if you're fond of Brazilian steakhouses, this one should be on your list.
Been here a ton of times, wether it be for parties, birthdays, work events etc. I love this place! It's great and recommended for anyone with a need for steak! Hah!

So we came here for my  nephews birthday and we found it on yelp. Not being from Nevada we had no idea it was way off the strip. So glad we found this spot. I've been to other Brazilian joints and it's been good but the staff setting and the salad bar were above the others. 
A great selection of wines are displayed front and center. I don't have a great knowledge of wines but it was from the ceiling to the floor.
We had a fantastic table just in front of the chefs skewering all the fresh cuts. And Fidel being well knowledgeable made many suggestions and took care of our 17 person party. Some of our party was getting missed on meats and within two minutes they had a selection of all the fine meats. Great night. Bathrooms clean everything clean and this is the spot if you want to feel local and exotic. Great job guys!!!!

This was the best dining experience I have had in a very long time. The food and drinks were phenomenal from beginning to end and the service was impeccable. We will definitely eat here again and this will be at the top of the list of places to take our out-of-town family and friends!

We had our wedding party dinner there and we had an amazing time.  The facility was clean and very relaxing and the look of the place was very attractive. The wait staff was very attentive and patient especially with such a large party, hats off to them! The food was delicious and the drinks were spot on and we were there during happy hours so it was even better with half off drinks! Overall we all loved this place and would recommend it over some of the more higher priced places that you are just overpaying for.  We will definitely go back to this place again.

Valentines Day Dinner, Although we were seated on our reservation time, the wait for service was terrible. We were greeted and pretty much left alone after that. So we didn't have any drinks until we flagged the waiter 30 mins after we first sat.  The food was ok. Although we were there for quite some time, it was the same meat choices  (Brazilian sausage, Chicken Hearts, flank steaks) that came around.... Where was the Shrimp, Picanha, ribs, filet migon, NY strip, Prime Rib, Blackened fillet, other traditional Brazilian meats, etc? We accidentally spilled gravy  on the table and even though it was seen by some employees, they did not assist us.  We didn't even get a refill on drink unless we asked, and when we did, it would be at least 15 mins before we got the drinks. We were getting frustrated and so we just called it quits for the meats and ordered our desert, I actually timed it and it took 36 mins to get desert. With that's said, we went ahead and asked for our check as soon as we got our desert in hopes to get the check back sooner than later. We also noticed the table service was horrible, there was at least 3 to 4 tables that were empty for at least 30 mins or so. We started to wonder why they didnt clear the tables sooner as we saw the large crowd at the entrance waiting frustrated. In my opinion, I believe they had plenty of personnel working, I think the problem was with the leads or section managers not managing their folks.

Honest review. The food wasn't to my liking, but i must add the service is great and the manager even took my meal off. She noticed i wasn't eating and asked me why. I did decide to try via Brasil because the yelp reviews were so good. I think i would give it  a  try again.

Absolutely the best happy hour restaurant in Las Vegas. Not also a great place to have some drinks after work but an amazing restaurant to share a family dinner. Super kids friendly from a really good menu to all the amenities a child can need while eating out. We are Hooked for life! Thank you for the amazing service.

If you've never been to a churrascaria or Brazilian steakhouse, your first experience will likely be 5 stars simply from the wow factor of unlimited sumptuous meat being carved table-side and the opulence of a lavish salad bar that could serve as a meal in itself.  Pretty much everything I say onward will likely be inconsequential.  However, if you've been around the block a time or two as I have and want the tale of the tape between two local heavyweights (Texas de Brazil(TDB) vs. Via Brasil(VB)) going at it for twelve rounds, let's get it on!

Round 1 (Ambience) 
This may come down to personal preference since there is definitely an upscale vibe with soothing waterfalls and romantic lighting upon entering VB, but not sure if I liked the feng shui of the salad bar in the middle without any partitioning of the tables into separate little rooms for added intimacy.  TDB definitely has a more upbeat vibe with a casual bar area where you can await guests and separate little rooms although definitely more crowded and noisy since it is more bustling with turnover of guests.   Winner: Push

Round 2 (Cheese bread)
If you took the most perfect cheese puff and turned it into bread form, this is pretty much the pinnacle of that transformation.  TDB has a slightly cheesier flavor, which gives it a slight edge.  Winner: TDB

Round 3 (Salad bar)
For first-timers (or as I like to call them, churrascarookies), you never want to overfill your plate on the salad bar, as tempting as it may be.  However, it's good to wet one's appetite on some items to balance the meat fest to come.  I felt the overall quality was superior in the salad bar at TDB since they offered lobster bisque and focused more on artisanal cheeses and light seafood/veggies options, whereas at VB, there was one too many pasta options like cheese ravioli and other pasta salads, which are like underhanded tactics to fill you up to limit your meat intake.  Winner: TDB

Round 4 (Beverages)
VB took a knockdown in this round since the waiter sat us down and presented us with options for water(still or sparkling?) and upon choosing still, he charged us for two bottles of some premium water at 7 bucks/bottle without clueing us in about the option for tap water since we assumed it was complementary.  They also failed to carry Antarctica Guarana, the most popular soda in Brazil and something I look forward to anytime I venture into a Brazilian restaurant.  TDB would never allow the water fiasco to occur and always carry my non-alcoholic beverage of choice.   Winner: TDB

Round 5 (Opening meats)
Surprisingly, VB opens with a baked salmon served with passion fruit/mango sauce....not what I expected but really good, and the table-side presentation was a nice touch.  Usually at TDB, they start you off with some non-premium beef wrapped in thick bacon or some heavy pork/chicken option.  Winner: VB

Round 6 (Lamb)
Leg of lamb was sufficiently juicy and came with a nice mint jelly, but TDB offers multiple cuts including the lamb chop, which was unavailable at VB.  Winner: TDB

Round 7 (Fowl)
VB definitely had some interesting options including chicken, duck, and chicken hearts (upon request), whereas TDB only has a single dry chicken option which I tend to pass over to allow more room for other meat options.  The chicken and duck were very succulent and tender, and well seasoned here.  Winner: VB

Round 8 (Brazilian sausage)
Like the cheese bread, fairly standard and not being a huge sausage connoisseur, I'm not the best judge on this one.  Winner: Push 

Round 9 (Side dishes)
Taking an intermission from the meats, I think VB offers some additional Brazilian sides like fried/boiled yucca root and sauteed turnip greens which have a more stir-fried crispy preparation compared to the stewed version in soul-food.  Traditional favorites such as fried bananas and mashed potatoes are present at both.  Winner: VB

Round 10 (Beef)
Maybe it was the pace of the meats brought to our table, but I felt that the overall quality of the beef cuts were superior at TDB since there were a few cuts that were overly dry and tough at VB although certain cuts were very tender/flavorful.  WInner: TDB

Round 11 (Service)
Waitstaff definitely more attentive at TDB and the pace of the meat parade was more even, so I didn't feel like I had to overcrowd my plate and lose track of which meat was which.  The TDB meat carvers also wear a uniform that gives them some more professional flare, which I appreciated.  WInner: TDB

Round 12 (Value)
Somewhat tied into service, the server initially took our groupon voucher at the beginning but conveniently left it off in our final bill until we reminded him.  Taking account the variety/quality of meats/salad bar, would have to give slight edge to TDB.    Winner: TDB

By decision,winner of this fight goes to Texas de Brazil,but don't count out Via Brasil in a rematch.  A new fierce challenger has recently arrived into town(Fogo de Chao), so a TKO may be in our midst!
Excellent food excellent service really large selection of meats. Huge salad bar and a few extra hot entrees.  All you can eat for a reasonable price

After reading the reply from the owner to my review I can clearly see why my experience at her restaurant was so bad. Not only does she not know how to write, but she doesn't know how to run a restaurant. She's also incorrect with her statement that I finished the meat dishes. She came by while I tried to eat the flank steak as I'm sure she could see we were having a hard time chewing it. She offered to bring some ribeye that I never ordered as she said it was more tender. It was more tender but half of it was fat so I couldn't eat that. She ended up charging me for the flank steak that I had to spit out, the ribeye that I didn't order, and the short rib which was disgusting.

we've eaten in a lot of restaurants in a lot of states. 
1. the service ~~ imperial 
2. the staff ~~ imperial ~~ smiling from the door to the table. from the table to the door ~ gerardo and louis ~~~ ohmygoodness  first they are both delectable delicious eye candy and their service.....the staff is so sweet, thoughtful and caring.....
3. the drinks ~~ top of the line. tippie top of the line!
management ~ sweet,  loving , fun, exciting 

im telling you texas de brazil ~~ second fiddle .

we will be frequent flyers 

p.s. hubs filled our the comment card ~~ a first in 20 years!

happy anniversary to mr and mrs aivin smith!

I figured since Newton C and I come here so often and the happy hour menu frequently changes, why don't I write another review?

Lately, when we don't want to cook and we feel like eating healthy (veggies and protein), this is a great option.

I order the roasted vegetable salad which has vegetables of all different colors(sweet potatoes, eggplant, red peppers, and spinach) and is very tasty! For protein, I order the turkey wrapped in bacon ( ok so there's some
fat but I'm sure you could order it without the bacon) besides the picanha, it's the best thing in the menu! 
When I don't feel like eating healthy and not spending a lot of money, I order some slider with French fries. My favorites are the angus sliders! Those are amazing!! 

Whether you want to splurge and get the rodizio, save money, or watch your diet, Via Brasil is the place!

I ALSO been to the CHAIN Brazilian steak house that are here in the LV area and IMO VIA BRAZIL kicks the SH*T out of all the others. They carry other items that others dont IE: chicken hearts, RIBEYE that can be pan seared to your liking, and they offer 2 types of dinners. One of the dinners has 14 meats and the other has 21 meats. If you havent tried this place and you're a fan of these types of restaurants it this is a must try... im sure you'll love it!!!

Happy hour is a great time to go here. They have it from 5-close and a lot of options. The short rib was amazing as was the blackened salmon. We also shared and appetizer with our friends that was wonderful (sampler type). The atmosphere was relaxing and the service was just right. Will definitely go there again.

Came here for dinner. The service was awesome! Everyone was really attentive and helpful. You get a card to signal when you want food or not and when you flip it to green, someone comes right away to bring you food. The gourmet salad bar was great, the meat was good, and they have a good dessert selection. I had a big serving of creme brulee. Ill definitely come back! Make sure you go on an empty stomach!

We usually frequent Texas de Brazil or Fogo de Chau (which are 100 times better in every aspect) so we were pretty disappointed. The salad bar left a lot to be desired. The cuts of meat were very small compared to Texas de Brazil. The speed at which the meat was coming around was really slow. At one point we were all sitting there with empty plates waiting for someone to come around. The Filet Mignon was fatty. The side dishes were mediocre. The ambiance did not feel like other steakhouses.  Bottom line is, this place is worth maybe 19.99 NOT 50 bucks!  For 49.99 you are MUCH better off spending it at Texas de Brazil or Fogo de Chau. I will never be back here nor will I ever recommend this place.

As someone in a job that can't attend traditional happy hour this place is terrific!  The service and the food are fantastic! 
Happy Hour runs all evening! The manager is very particular in how her patrons are treated. If she thinks something could be better she fixes it without the customer asking. She's always on the floor observing. 
It's a fun hanging out after work! Can hardly wait to dine here . We have out of town guest coming and this is first place on our list!

Had horrible service during our 2015 company Christmas party of around 50 people. Most of our people left hungry. When we complained to management it was obvious they didn't care and she was just waiting for us to shut up and leave. They did not offer any explanation for the bad service or offer any discount or anything. We booked a room and our people got shoved into a corner we very little room or comfort.
I will never go back!

I try not to hand out 5 stars until I've consistently had a great experience. But this place is on track for the extra star, as based on our experience this weekend, the fella' and I will be back.

When trying to pick out where to eat, I could tell that steak was what was calling to my dinner partner. He picked out this place, and we went on a whim. So Saturday evening, no reservation, we just walk up to the booth and ask for a table. Gal doesn't bat an eye, and offers us a table immediately. She does pause to check and make sure we're okay with a high traffic area next to the buffet, but we aren't picky and it was next to a beautiful towering wine rack.  

Due to the odd location of our table, I think we were overlapped on our server, as we had two different guys coming by to check in and joke with us. They didn't overlap too much though and it just meant we had great service! 

I've never been to a Brazilian Steakhouse, so I can't compare with other places. But generally, the servers were super welcoming and informative, the salad bar average to good and ohmygosh the delicious meat just kept coming. They had certain items that kept swinging by, but the guys would also check in to see if we wanted to try anything specific off the menu. We had purchased the shorter list of meats, but we didn't even make it through the whole taster list. What I did try was delicious.

I didn't knock any stars off for this next bit. I know that I tend to be a perfectionist, so don't expect any place to completely satisfy me. But, just in case, here's my 'eh' list. 

=The salad bar had some delicious items. (Charcuterie board/endive goat cheese) But there was a lot of stuff that I didn't try because I didn't want to fill up on average looking stuff. Not bad looking at all, just higher end average. Of what I did try, the only eh was the Greek Salad roll thing , which was kind of odd. The meat was actually kind of an afterthought and sort of hamburger like in consistency. 

=The Brazilian Sausage: Compared to all of the delicious cuts of meat, it was kind of tough and not worth the room it took up in my stomach. I think if it were part of a breakfast meal or an appetizer in another style restaurant, it would be really good, so this one's just a major personal preference. I can see why it's on the menu, it's just not for me. 

= The chicken was just a hair on the dry side. This is being super nitpicky though, as it had great flavor. Like, I wish that we weren't so full so I could have had a full piece instead of splitting it with my fella'. 

Now that the 'eh' stuff is out of the way, the great list:

=The cuts of meat were tender, flavorful and even though we didn't bother getting any sauces, they stood well on their own. I especially loved the tri-tip, but everything we tried was a well made presentation of the cut. I enjoyed that they were easily able to give me medium rare and my fella' could get the disgustingly rare slices that he loves as we've had many struggles with those requests at lesser restaurants. Also, the bacon wrapped turkey is an unexpected treat, so even though it isn't a red meat, I'd highly recommend trying it. 

= The 'courtesy breads'/fired mozzarella, as well as the grilled mushrooms that we ordered as a side were tasty. I only regret that there is so much food I had a hard time eating more than a few bites of anything and tried so little from the side menu. 
 
=The Rigatoni Ala Vodka from the salad bar was spectacular. I love Vodka sauce and have had an 'eh' experience with a few higher end chain Italian place lately. My first bite was an entirely unexpected delight. I earnestly wished that I was just in an italian restaurant so I could devour a plate of the stuff, but sufficed with the token amount I'd procured to taste. 

= Service was amazing. I never lacked for food, water or attention. I also really loved the decor. Something about the large open space and pseudo-Greco Roman accents just vibed with me. Plus, in our little odd table, I felt like I had the whole place to myself and it was refreshing. 

=The dark Brazilian beer had a rich, full bodied taste. I was a little sceptical of a bottled beer, but I didn't regret choosing it over a glass of wine, as it had a great flavor that complimented the meats. 

=MMM! Passionfruit Mousse. It was the perfect end to the rich meal. Light, flavorful and it melted in my mouth. I was glad I had restrained myself from digging in so I could have a little space for a treat at the end.

My sister been telling me about this place since its closer to their house.  So my fiance and I finally gave it a try.  We'be had better Brazilian steakhouse, but the service here is great.  Great ambiabce, nice live music, food quality wise, its okay.
Overall, I'll give it a try again.

Came here for a wedding reception but the food was awesome. Definitely a nice ambiance for the wedding. As far as the food went, the salad bar alone was already awesome. The lobster brusque, the seafood salad, and the chille oil was probably what got me hooked. The clams and the everything else was also worth trying. I didn't want to eat too much of it because I was ready for the meats. 
It's hard to resist food when it's fresh and on a skewer in front of your face.l I tried the bacon wrapped turkey, the prime rib, sirloin steak, pork, the chicken and all of them were tender, juicy, and full of flavor. Definitely worth a trip.

We checked it out last Friday. We went to see the place we wanted to feel the atmosphere and try out the food before we pay in for an all you can eat. I ordered a Pomegranate Sangria which was fantastic and a Mushroom risotto with chicken to die for however my husband tried the caprese salad and the filet mignon sliders they were both disappointing - the portion was tiny and only came with 2 tiny sliders and some fries...The bartender Roberta was really nice and she help me to choose the best for my happy hour :) Thank you!

Excellent, over the top service. Hubby absolutely loved the concept and enjoyed everything that was offered. The top sirloin and stuffed cheese bread were his favorites. I prefer the gourmet salad/appetizer bar. The lobster bisque, mussels with broth and steamed clams were all really good. I also liked the flavor/seasoning of the fresh steamed broccoli and steamed/grilled asparagus. I can see myself craving their Caipirinha cocktail. He'll be craving the creme br√ªl√©e for sure.

I had a friend come over and he walked in the door to exclaim "I am SO HUNGRY, I could eat a cow!" Suddenly I knew exactly where we were going! Via Brasil.
I had really wanted to try this place, especially since I can literally walk here from my house!

We walked in, with out reservation. Although the dining room was pretty full they seated us right away. Right off the bat, the service was awesome! Start to finish, I have to say this may be some of the best service I have had in Las Vegas! We felt SO taken care of every minute!

The style of restaurant is a Brazilian steak house, where they carve endless delicious meat at your table. Much like the other 2 chain restaurants in the city, except this one is locally owned and run...If that kind of thing matters to you. Personally, any time I can support a local business I am all over it!  The dinner menu consists of two choices. Regular menu which is AYCE for $34.95 and the Deluxe Menu that is AYCE $49.95. The difference is the deluxe menu has premium cuts of meat, and seafood. We decided to go with the deluxe menu, and I am not sure I really knew which was which to be honest, everything was really good! I guess maybe if we had done the regular premium meat would have whisked on by? 

It was all really great! Mountains of meat, a few beverages and somehow managed to save room to split a dessert! The check total was $180 for the both, including tip and everything. Not a cheap night out, but for the right night, or a special occasion it was fantastic!

I was a little nervous going in here after reading some of the more recent reviews. However I was VERY pleasantly surprised with this visit.  We went for our anniversary and I have to say the staff at Via Brasil made it much more special. We were greeted by a very nice girl working as a hostess. When we got to our table we were quickly attended to. We ordered our food and got up to go to the salad bar. Everything was fresh and hot. We had already unfolded our napkins and when we arrived back at the table the napkins were refolded and looked like they hadn't been tocuhed. Our drinks were also refilled. When we finished eating from the salad bar the meats began arriving.  Every thing we had was hot, fresh, juicy and absolutely amazing. I have not one complaint about this place. The waiters were SUPER friendly and very attentive.  We will absolutely be back
This place is the best place ever for any ocassion, Anna and Adam (owners) are awesome! And Carolina is the best server EVER ! Me and my family love this place !

Via Brasil steakhouse is the best churrascaria. They have two opition They have two choices on the menu, prime with 14 types of meat and starling with 21 types of meat, the greatest variety of meat I have ever seen in my life at a steak house. I loved the steaks and especially the Ribeye that they finish baking in front of you on the table and the shrimp that comes in a hot tray with the divine seasoning that they use to make everything better, the salad bar  has a lot of variety it is also very cool . Our waiter Victor was the best, very polite and always caring and asking if we wanted any meat in particular. I'll be back for sure. Incredible experience. Thanks via Brasil
Took some friends visiting from California and it couldn't of been any better. The food and service was unbelievable. Very Very clean and Great atmosphere.
Dinner has killer salmon with passion fruit sauce and seasoned grilled corn. So damn good.

Like a recent Yelper's review of Via Brasil, I dont give 5 star reviews often but Im thrilled when Im able to.  In my book, to earn 5 stars means a restaurant has mastered its niche.  That is, a hamburger stand could certainly earn 5 stars like a fine french dining experience.  Its all a mater of context.  That being said, Via Brasil is definitely a 5 star Palace of Food.  

I have eaten at plenty of Brazilian Churascarrias over the years and I can say Via Brasil takes the cake over all them.  I recently went on a weeknight with my nephew to celebrate a new job and we were immediately taken back by the amazing synthesis of upscale and casual in the same environment.  The restaurant is beautiful or being in a Summerlin strip mall.  They have their salad bar in the center of the restaurant and a small, but comfortable bar off to the side.  The restaurant is ringed by windows and while there isnt much a view, it does get beautiful colors and light during the sunset.  The staff immediately sat us, described how the restaurant worked and the fun began.

The first thing we were greeted with was this soft, warm cheese bread that was fantastic.  We then approached the salad bar and soon found out that salad is but a small component of the overall spread.  This "salad" bar had warm dishes as well like Ravioli, scalloped potatoes, stroganoff and a sort of seafood Ciappiono, all of which were delicious.  As for its cold selections, there were pasta salads, fresh mussels, beef carpaccio, caprese and a host of other amazing & fresh foods.  I had to be careful, otherwise I was going to get full just on the salad bar so I limited my intake although I could have easily just partook in the salad bar all evening.  In fact, I think its an option for around 20 bucks for those not inclined to enjoy the rodizio selections.  

After the fabulous salad bar, we began the meat parade.  Using a small disc thats green on one side and red on the other, we flipped it green and a constant delivery of protein was soon ambling its way over to our table on skewers where the waiters slice it off table side.  For a couple items, like the suckling pig and the salmon, they actually to table side carving off a cart.  The meats were amazing with special recognition going to the bacon wrapped turkey, salmon, garlic sirloin, parmesan pork loin and flank steak.  

As if the meats werent enough to chew on at this time, more waiters flooded our table with a selection of side dishes like mashed potatoes, fried plantains (bananas) and broccoli.  They have more sides like beans, rice and fried Yucca should you want them as well.  I cant recommend the fried Yucca enough as it was a perfect compliment to the meat.  Think of it as a less starchy, slightly sweeter steak french fry.   The total amount of meats that made it to our table was 16 and once you get through the whole roster they invite you to request any of them to come back out for more.  No mas for this guy...if I didnt have gout before, Im sure my body was one more bite away from developing it!

While there is a desert menu, I couldnt even think about it.  All I wanted to do was get home and throw on some elastic pants.  While I may have been in pain, it was a good pain and worth the effort.  The staff at VIa Brasil is top notch and took time to explain every dish for us and the preparation.  I found the prices to be reasonable for the Brazilian Churascarrian dining experience and especially for the quality.  Its essentially 40 bucks a person for the full shabangabang.  I cant wait to get back and explore their wine menu next time (nephew is under 21 so we decided to go the soda route) and I hear they have live music on the weekends!  It may take 2 months to digest all the food and once it is, you can definitely bet  I'll be back.

As a bonus:  its so refreshing to have a restaurant of this quality in the neighborhood without having to deal with a casino/resort!

I have heard about Via Brasil for some time now, but just got an opportunity to eat there.

The atmosphere is wonderful, high ceilings, open space, waterfalling behind the bar...very cool. 

The staff was amazingly attentive, paying attention to what we ordered, and suggesting dishes that would compliment.  Gerry, our waiter even made a point to special order me some lamb chops....WOW!

I cannot exactly tell which meat was my favorite...My wife said the Tri Tip was the best, but the chimichurri sauce made them all beyond words delicious.

Forget the other Brazillian Steakhouses and go here.

First time diners here.  Food is amazing.  I've lived in Vegas for five years and they have the best prime rib I've ever eaten in 30 years.  Super fast on checking up on you and free refills on soft drinks.  I will be back again after I take a food nap.

Another case of "food porn".  Wow, spent my anniversary dinner there and what a great memorable experience.  The flank steak is the best but you can do wrong with top sirloin, prime rib, pork ribs, turkey wrapped bacon and more.  Chicken stroganoff was also A+.

The servers from the host right down to the dessert tray girl were all very attentive, helpful and made it an overall 5 Star experience.

I'll be back when friends come to town!!

So, my fellow yelpers - 

Both my hubby and I have a tradition - since we both have b-days in September, we usually will just go out to a nice dinner to celebrate "our" days.

Hubby suggested this place, after doing some research, and also hearing the word from co-workers. So in being a yelper, I of course came to yelp to check the overall rating. Then I happened to see the word 'buffet' in the description, and instantly had this nail going down the chalkboard kind of sensation. Stomach kind of lost its appetite a little, and I held my breath about what this meant - but being a good trooper - said nothing and just went along for the ride, figuring I'd at least give it a shot before saying anything.

Soooo, we pull into the plaza where this little gem is hidden, and I was taken back by the very fancy appearance of the building. And from the exterior looking in, I could see a little waterfall feature, so right away my mind was thinking - this is gonna be interesting!

Right upon entering the hostess was very pleasant and very happy to chat it up with my little one in a full blown conversation about her markers! (mind you my little one was the one having to show it off to begin with, but i give kudos to the hostess for entertaining my little one's need for discussing her markers)

Our hostess went and placed us right next to the waterfall, as my daughter kept talking about the waterfall behind the bar too, so we were very happy all around for seating.

Then came the onslaught of attention - really - i mean talk about being pampered little pooches - you name it, there it was! (I have been to some top rated restaurants (names will remain anonymous - not into bashing anyone here), and the service rendered tonight seems to just put some of those other restaurants to shame!!!!) A gal could get used to this kind of pampering for EVERYTHING! Back to the subject - the service. Let's put it this way - short of having a personal massage at the table to throw me into utter 9th heaven, I was well on my way heading there!

For those who have never dined here: you are assigned a table 'captain', whose sole job is to make sure your service is being met for all needs. He will explain to you how things work for the food. You get two cardboard chips, one side says "no meat", the other "more meat". You flip the chip according to wether you want meat or not. If you don't want it - there is the 'salad bar' you can visit, to get your delight of heaven: sauteed mushrooms, grilled portabellos, shrimp ceviche, lobster bisque, varieties of risotto, salad, fine cheeses, bruschetta, beef carpaccio, and a few other items.

Seriously though, service is impeccable. You drain your water cup, it is refilled before you know it (and sometimes without you even realizing it). Drop a napkin, a new one magically appears before you. If you even have a slightest bit of a question on your face, suddenly there is your 'captain' ready to assist you. These guys (and gals) are good! You finish your appetizer, they are ready to help clear your table to bring on your entree. 

If you wish to feast on the meat side - well then just flip your chip to "more meat"! Then comes the never ending (unless you flip your chip) selection of meats! Prime Rib, Turkey, Sausage, Chicken, Lamb, Tri Tip, Sirloin. Here's a great part - you are given at your table setting a pair of tongs (originally thought it was for picking your own bread out of the basket, but nope was wrong), to help grasp the meat they are slicing for you off the oversized kabob sticks! (sorry best way to describe them). The meat is all roasted on large skewers in open flame, which is then brought from table to table, and you are served table side. All I can say is YUUUUUMMY!!!!

Oh and let's NOT forget the sides you can order as well!:

Grilled Asparagus (hate to admit, but these guys were a little on the scrawny side, no where's close to what you would see in the grocery stores) - smeared in  olive oil mixed with garlic. Hmmm. yummy!
Fried Bananas - cinnamon, sugar, and something else all nicely fried up! I recommend this towards your dessert end.
Yucca Fries (pretty tasty! Never had it before, but I liked it!)
There was more for sure, but can't remember them all at this point. My brain is clouded with all the good eats I had!

And juuuust when you think you can't stuff anything else into your bulging tummies - the DESSERT cart winds its way to you upon request! By this point my belly is bulging, my eyes are bulging, my brain is on heavenly overload, and yes I'm getting dessert by golly (special celebrations only come once a year!)!

I dove for the chocolate cake. My daughter picked out the blueberry cheesecake. Neither of us regretted our choices! (ok hubby had no input cuz we felt 2 deserts was best, and our little one was already pining for her blueberries (thanks to Dora the Explorer).) Trust me, YUMMMMMM. Yelp is telling me I'm out of space (NEED MORE SPACE DARNIT!!!) P.S. Kids under 5 are FREE! :)

The service is outstanding and the food is phenomenal!
I  went to the Saturday brunch and I loved everything!  You must go to the Saturday brunch!
I will definitely be back and will also attend the Brazilian festival there for sure.

This is one of my favorite places for happy hour.  Lots of great priced drinks and apps to choose from.  I usually get mojitos or sangria.  They have an outdoor patio which is nice when the weather is nice.  The staff is very attentive.

Brought the misses there for her birthday. The place had a romantic setting. The food was great service was quick and friendly. Just do much food!! Was only able to get to the salad bar once. And they just kept coming with more and more. You gotta remember to flip that chip in order for them to slow down the pace or you are gonna be stuffed the first 10 min
Great food, great service, and great atmosphere. The picania was my favorite, and the deserts were amazing as well.

I had the pleasure of coming to Via Brasil Steakhouse once before for a Yelp Elite Event earlier this year. This visit was strictly for their happy hour! I made reservations originally through opentable.com because I know how packed this place can get. Upon arriving my friend and I decided that we instead wanted happy hour. I couldn't do an all you can eat meat thing that late at night... The tabletops are seat your self kind of thing and our waitress was super nice! I loved how honest she was with certain items on the menu that we would get ready to order. Proceed with caution on a few of these things because it's not made the normal way you may think because they Brasil way has a twist. For example the crab cake that they offered is prepared in a way that isn't necessarily the cake form most people are use to. The Caipirinha is Brazil's national cocktail which reminds most people of the mojito! I'll tell you what, It's no drink for the lightweights! This drink offers a nice punch so be prepared if you want to indulge in a few because they WILL sneak up on you!  Happy hour has a wide variety of finer foods and also some entrees. The drinks though are limited to just the Caipirinha's.. Our food choices consisted of a few sliders (Angus & Filets) the Brazilian fried chicken and the blackened salmon dish that came with saut√©ed spinach. Everything was delicious except the Brazilian fried chicken.. Overall everything was great and I have no found a new spot to add to my list for happy hour deals during the week!

At Via Brazil I like to describe my experience as tasty and classy!

At this extremely sophisticated Brazilian steakhouse you will find a wide variety of exotic cuts of meats, salads, drinks and desserts. At Via Brazil, you can be sure that you will be treated like a king, please keep in mind that my review is very accurate as I been polishing it throughout the years that I  have been going there. In addition, I would never be writing a review like this if I didn't truly believe that this restaurant is able to provide the experience that I'm describing here. This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, as you can see that I've been going there a lot.

Now, for you all that are questioning why is that Via Brazil have so many 5 star reviews, yet there are some random people out there that will rate it one star, please read with attention the following paragraph :)

As I have stated initially, Via Brazil is a classy, sophisticated, yet affordable Brazilian steakhouse. However, some people will try to take advantage of its "all you can eat" system, which allows you to pay a fee "per person" in order to take advantage of its rodizio. In Portuguese, we say "mas que coisa de pobre em?" Meaning that some people will try to take advantage of the system, by buying only one rodizio, while saying that his friends will "only be having drinks." Really? You come to a classy steakhouse with your girlfriend and friends and subject yourself to such situation, trying to share expansive meats with everyone in your table while paying for only one person? 

I think my message is clear here, this place is amazing, their foods and service are 5 stars, but sometimes business like this will get people trying to take advantage of their system. But they are a minority, as most people that go there are classy and educated people like you and me :)

Via Brazil is the best steakhouse in Las Vegas, period. They have the best happy hour in town, awarded many times for different magazines. In addition, I write because I feel like this is the right thing to do. Don't you think that if those people writing bad reviews really cared about creating a social media rating system that is truly accurate, they would at least be truthful in their statements? This is how we build an awesome Yelp community, by rating good place and helping bad places improve by writing reviews, taking pictures and being helpful! 

I write this because I love food, and Via Brazil is my favorite restaurant in the entire world. Luckily I work hard so that I can afford to pay for it and feed my wife, friends and family at Via Brazil when I wish too.

Finally, my tip for you who are new at Via Brazil follows:

- Start by eating some "SALGADINHOS" followed by a traditional "CAIPIRINHA"

- Second, eat some "PICANHA" and "FRAUDINHA"

- If you like sea food, they got you covered, their salad bar has the best "LOBSTER BISQUE" and steamed seafood. 

- If rodizio is just too much food for you, try their happy hour deals and I can guarantee to you that you won't be disappointed.

I hope you all enjoyed reading this review and please remember that if you are looking for a great night with great people and great food, then your night starts at Via Brazil Stakehouse! Remember to make reservations on special holidays like Valentine's Day because they do get really busy! Tell them you are going there because you read my review and maybe you get a free Caipirinha! I'm joking... but it's worth it a try ;)

Made a reservation for 12pm and we're still waiting!!!, it is now 12:47. They keep say 10-15 more minutes, finally got seated at 1pm, this place it not worth the wait, should've went to Texas de Brazil, I never have any issues with them!

Based on the Mother's Day Bruch we had a great time! Food was good & the kids walked away with a coloring book which they thought was the coolest thing! Oh, my wife received a rose as well! I would be excited to try the regular dinner menu!

We held a meetup at this location awhile back.  Upon reading some of the reviews (especially the review of David R), I decided not to be quiet any longer.  A person (that none of our group knew) ordered food and drink.  After finishing her food, she left without paying her bill.  None of us knew her.  One by one, our group members individually paid for our food/drinks.  One member stayed behind to finish watching a game.  He had given the waiter $20 and was expecting change only to be surrounded by a group of people demanding money for that person that skipped out without paying.  NONE OF US KNEW THAT PERSON.  He explained that he did not know the person.  The employees of the restaurant were literally holding him there encircling him - and threatening to have him arrested.
