Finally he paid (out of fear) for a meal and drinks of a person he didn't even know and has never met.  The management did not return my phone call.  Not only did he lose money for this unknown person, the waiter didn't give his change back from the $20 (should have been around $8).  The restaurant should hold credit cards if they are fearful of people not paying.  They should not make someone pay for and UNKNOWN person's food.  I would never go to this restaurant again.

Good meat selection. Two different rodizio options. Once they knew we prefer our steak rare and medium rare they made a point to bring out cuts that were not so well done. Lots of sides to choose from. The  with orange slices rocked.

I have to say, I love this restaurant. I have eaten here numerous times over the years, and I keep coming back - the management is hands on and efficient, the servers and other staff are attentive and friendly, and the quality of the food is excellent. I always enjoy the selection of various foods at the salad bar, and it is far more than just salad - from lobster bisque to prosciutto, the selection is always great. And the variety of cuts of meat, as well as the side dishes, is the best! The meat servers are always attentive about coming to your table with the meat skewers and ready to give you as many cuts of meat as you like. The staff at the bar is fun and friendly, and the management always stops by your table to ensure you are satisfied and have been taken care of. I would recommend Via Brasil to anyone interested in casual dining, a formal night for a date, or a family affair or event. Regardless of your reason for visiting you will leave well taken care of and happy!

Let me just state that when you dine in at a restaurant you eat, enjoy, finish the meal possible dessert or after dinner treat and leave. But when you're "CAMPING" a table having an endless talk either take it to the bar or somewhere outside the dining area.
    Hence our experience X-mas dinner. I've visited Via Brasil plenty of times busy and slow to see the wonderful intelligent hostesses that worked that night do their magic (holiday and non-holiday);NOTE: these host specifically DO NOT GET POOLED TIPS manager Anna shared with me in the past, which still amazes me the loyalty these lady's have to the position. When overhearing them inform every guest "we're waiting for tables to clear up..." was NO JOKE. I traveled the dining rooms and viewed many tables Couched in their seats with No plates, No spec of food or drink and a checkbook pushed aside of their table acting as if there's no one else that's going to use their table after.
   When finally sat to our table with no rush from the hostess despite the commotion , we were greeted by our Server seconds later.  For the hardworking loyal staff of Via Brasil on delivery great service and accommodating our picky needs. And for the strong hostesses, sad I am to witness their spirits crushed by ungodly rude uncourteous people who refuse to understand/see the hardships of working in the rest. Hospitality field especially on holidays! Where's your Christmas spirit or human kindness?
 For the management/owners who rather than bending employees, stepped in to assist their team. ThAts where they were rather than wasting their time hearing your complaints of a problem that they are hands on solving. Shake it off and keep up the great work Via Brasil.

To those reading these rough reviews from people who expect their but to be kissed. Spare your judgement on regular days and stop by yourself. Experience REAL hospitality and customer service the way it should. Holidays are never easy. VBS isnt the only one with low reviews on a holiday. Unlike Texas and Fogo or any restaurant who see guests as $$$$ Via Brasil go above and beyond seeing you as friends/family.

I wasn't realy impressed. Their better tasting ones in my opinion was the leg of lamb and the chicken.  Sirloin, rib-eye, flank were okay. Texas de Brasil might be more saltier with their meats compared to this place or you can say this place had less flavioring on their meats. Their salad bar was small, and didn't have much varieties like Texas de Brasil. This place has nice decor and pretty upscale. Overall conclusions: Texas de Brasil is better.

The price is pretty expensive at over $50 per person after tip, but let me tell you it is worth it.  The first time I came here I had price shock, but the subsequent times I have visited, I tell myself that it is well worth it.

If I could describe this place in two words it would be: 
MEAT EXPLOSION!

Yes, the meat here is excellent.  My favorites here are:
-Flank Steak
-Skirt Steak
-Bacon Wrapped Tenderloin
-Beef Ribs
-Prime Rib

There are lots more but those are my top favorite ones.

Do not be afraid to tell them what you like when you sit down.  The service is exceptional and they cater to your needs immediately and professionally.  I let them know right off the bat that I am there for the Flank and Skirt Steak.

The Salad bar is good, I love their roasted peppers, rice/black beans and ravioli. The standard side dishes for the "rodizio" are: Brocolli, GARLIC KNOTS (YUM), Fried Bananas, Mashed Potatoes and good "sauces" to put on the plethora of meat you will be consuming in MASS QUANTITIES.

I love it here. It is pricey, yes. But it is worth it. Every Penny.

My husband is a bit of a Brazilian Steakhouse freak as he lived in Brazil for some years. We have tried all of the major steakhouses multiple times including Texas and Fogo. We were a bit skeptical about trying Via after reading some of the Yelp reviews but it is definitely the BEST of all the ones we have been to. True it helps that my husband knows which meats are the best and which are more just filler meats but the sides and meat were both better than any of the other places. The salad bar was just okay but I never get too excited about that anyway as it is more of a distraction than anything from the real show, THE MEAT. Had such an enjoyable, delicious, authentic meal tonight and both agree that this will be our go to in Vegas. YUM.
Very good food. The happy hour specials are great also.  Very impressive service.

Celebrated our anniversary there on Saturday  Everything was excellent.  Didn't try the salad bar, because we wanted to try as many of the meats and sides as possible.  Only complaint I would have is we wanted more of the shrimp and bacon wrapped filets but they were not brought around as much as the other meats.  Servers were very attentive!!  Will be back !!

I came here many years ago and used to love it. My family and I came here recently and the meat was TOO salty. We thought it was a one time thing and decided to go again, and again the meat was too salty and two of us got sick. 
Whatever you guys did, change it back!!!

Came to this establishment to introduce my children to Brazilian steakhouses and assess if this would be a good fit for our family reunion. Service was great and the food was steady and delicious. The server was so friendly always offering refills for drinks when they were at 25% or less. 

Where they lose 3 stars with me is the nondisclosure that refills were not included. Never have I been to a steakhouse that does not inform you that certain basic drinks do not come with refills. I spent enough for another person to come join us for dinner!. The proce was not the issue, the fact this eatablishment charges for refills shows me they are more jnterested in padding thier pockets and just being greedy. At least at Fogo de Chao, they will ask and inform you of the drink you have will be an additional charge. This was my children's first and last trip to this establishment. Fogo de Chao will be my place to go from now on and the place for our 45 person reunion, as well as any future groups gatherings. Its the little things that make a difference.

Well, it's not spectacular, but it isn't bad either.  I will say that the staff is very gracious and attentive.  Their salmon with mango passion fruit puree sauce is amazing. However, the salad bar leaves a lot to be desired.  They also don't have very many choices of beef cuts.  Being that it's steakhouse, I was expecting more than what was offered. So basically, the menu is quite limited in my opinion.  I honestly don't see myself going back on my own dime - it's too pricey of a place to casually waltz in just to satisfy a craving.

Overall, I remain team Texas de Brazil.

Im in the food industry and this is my first and only bad review of any place I have ever dined at.
Horrible service.... forgot drinks, forgot sauces, dirty plates never cleared, drinks never refilled, meat over cooked, long time without food coming around, charged kids adult's prices, lied about prices, etc., etc....
Ate here for free because someone gave me a gift card. Even it being free hated it so much.
Service was so bad I couldn't enjoy the food, which was at best average. 
Can't recommend! Very negative experience.
This place always blows me away. Everything is delicious every time! I'm never disappointed

If you are going to splurge, this is the place to do it. Prices are very reasonable. The food is incredible and customer service is at an all-time high - very attentive service!

The decor is also beautiful. Very nice for a special event.

We did the  all you can eat on Valentine's Day. Spent 160$ on the bill and my lady and I  both ended up with food poisoning. The food wasn't even that great. Better off going to Texas DE Brasil. Never had issues there.

I love Brazilian food and they bring it to you first class. Elegant atmosphere, plenty of seating, and a truly friendly staff made my experience memorable. It is pricey, but I dare you to find a Brazilian place that isn't. Trust me, you get what you pay for and then some. And the dessert cart....YUM!

I had a good experience at Via Brasil.  I heard good things about this place so I called on Saturday to ask questions about the menu, pricing etc.  The girl was very friendly and convinced me to swing down.  The friendly hostess greeted me when I arrived. She remembered talking to me on the phone.  She promptly sat me and said that someone will be with me in a minute. A few seconds later I was greeted by another staff member who explained how things worked. She didn't leave me the little red/green card however.  Finally after getting a replacement card, I turned it green. Within seconds, food started getting delivered to my table.  Unfortunately, there was a few times, my table was passed by even though the card was flipped to green.  The rest of the staff was attentive to my needs by refilling drinks, getting replacement silverware, etc.

I was not impressed with the salad bar. The meat on the other hand was delicious!  

 It's unclear as to what the lunch pricing is. I was told $25. Then I was told $19.99. Then was told the price is going back to $25.  There should be some consistent pricing.  I was also charged $4.50 for a Coke. That's higher than what other places charge-even though you are offered free refills.  

I would like to try this place for dinner. There are more meats added to the dinner menu and I would like to try them out.

I rate this place 3 1/2 stars.

Via Brazil is nothing but spectacular service! Meat is always great, salad bar is amazing, and I love going for Sunday brunch! Love coming here, especially since you can use the Flok app and get the brunch for $20 a person! Can't beat that! And dinner with seafood was amazing as well! Can't wait to be back again!

I had my wedding here 9/26/15 and simply could not have been more satisfied with the entire experience. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone. Anna Gomes, the Event Manager, is truly a dream to work with. Weddings are hard anyway, and it was even more complicated that I was planning from Chicago. But Anna was always very prompt and patient in responding to my barrage of emails. 

When I was heading to Vegas for my bachelorette party a few months before my wedding, she made time to personally meet with me and give me a tour of the restaurant. I took a huge leap of faith and booked this place without seeing it. From the pictures on Yelp and Facebook, I was pretty sure I knew what I was getting myself into, but there was always a nagging fear in the back of my mind that I had fallen for good advertising. Especially because the price was so cheap, I was worried that the restaurant would be cheap looking. Well, when I finally saw the venue, I was BLOWN AWAY by how beautiful it was. The pictures absolutely do no do it justice. The place is very elegant inside. I especially love the giant waterfall! 

The day of, everything was set up exactly how I had requested it, down to the color of the lights. Anything I asked for was immediately put into place. For example, I asked the guestbook table to be moved three different times (small bridezilla moment, I guess) and it was done immediately and without complaint each time. During the meal, my father mentioned to Anna that my sisters hadn't gotten the chance to try to filet mignon yet, so Anna personally went to the kitchen to find the servers with the filet mignon and led them to my sisters' table. Amazing! 

The food was incredible. My husband spent a couple years in Brazil and is very particular about Brazilian barbecue, and he was blown away by the quality of the meat and flavor. We all were! It was such a great dinner. The servers were constantly making their rounds, everyone ate until they were very satisfied. Dessert was delicious too! 

This is the perfect atmosphere for a wedding, people still can't stop telling me what a fun wedding it was! And the price was absolutely unbeatable. You only pay for food, there is no additional cost for reserving the rooms. Based on that, you would think they would try to hurry you along or squeeze you into a smaller space so there would be more room for restaurant guests, but that was absolutely not the case. The number of guests I had could have fit into the large party room, but Anna was worried it would be a tight fit, so she also gave us the adjoining space, for no additional cost! I truly felt like her main goal was to make sure I had a wonderful time. Take it from a bride on a budget, there is no better deal for a wedding. My husband said we can go back to celebrate our anniversary in Vegas and we'll definitely have our celebration anniversary dinner here. I can't wait!

Went here last night for a birthday and had a wonderful time.  Our server Vinny and all of the meat carvers were so nice. We had a great conversation with one who is from Brazil and everyone I encountered was very friendly.  The atmosphere and people working there seemed very authentic.  The salad bar included pasta, chicken marsala, rice, cheeses and bruschetta.  The meats were served hot and juicy.  At one point I forgot to turn over my card and the meat kept coming and coming.  I've never had so many types of beef cuts in my life.  The salmon and shrimp were cooked perfectly and very delicious.  I can't wait to go back for brunch.  My only complaint would be the chair, it looked like there was some cushion but was not comfortable and my butt checks started to hurt after awhile.  Could've been just the one I was sitting in. I would've preferred a booth but If they had booths they were in the rear of the place and not being offered.

Via Brasil is simply an experience you have to try in Las Vegas. It's owned by a husband and wife team who are very sweet. There are tons of meat and salad bar options, which is great for picky eaters and those with dietary restrictions. However, if you are going to come here, you definitely have to love MEAT!

My favorite dishes were the white clams (available at the salad bar), the top sirloin (melt in your mouth delicious!), sauteed bananas (almost like a fruit creme brulee) and shrimp. I tried so many different types of meats--chicken, different cuts of beef, lamb...it was carnivore heaven.

The cocktails were a highlight of my meal as well...the caipirinhas are strong but delicious! I want to try their house infused cocktails next time.

Service was good - food quality was terrible. This is not the first time I have been here but probably the last. Cold Bruschetta, soggy fried zucchini, prime rib was like bacon .... cheese cake had no flavor (kind of strange) and Cr√®me br√ªl√©e was actually quite good. It was a special night as my friend proposed to his girlfriend so it was really sad. We had a company party here last year and loved it ... I don't know if they had an off night or quality has slipped a lot? The restaurant ran out of bread.... as inexpensive as bread is this should never happen.... making servers apologize for no foresight in the kitchen or management is unfair.

Dante was extremely professional and had a great sense of humor..Food was off the hook... Tri Tips were phenomenal ... Great part
 Of town

Absolutely phenomenal. First time eating here but I've heard so much about it. After eating tonight, I booked two more reservations with this place for this month. It's that good.
The staff is incredible and take care of your food cravings. 
ASK FOR THE TOP SIRLOIN. It's amazing and tastes even better when you add the fried mozzarella on top. 
All of the meats taste good and the buffet station is great and all, but don't get stuffed there cause the meat is all you can eat.
After eating so much, they bring a few desserts for you to choose from.
The creme br√ªl√©e is to die for, seriously.
I promise if you go here, you'll never want to eat at another fancy steakhouse again because for the price, you'll get a single filet somewhere else.
Remember to take it slow.

For reference I've been to Fogo de Chao (Vegas and San Diego) and Rei del Gado (San Diego).

I enjoy this place for their food and service.  I love the wide open setting of dinning and huge, huge TV in the center.  The hosts were very welcoming and accommodating by asking us if we wanted more plates or what meats we were wanting.  Hey, and with sooo much meat in my system they know to keep my water filled so I don't dehydrate from all the salt intake.

As for the meats, I was lucky enough to sit near the kitchen and had first cuts right off the skewers!  I kept going back for garlic steak, prime rib and the house special.  Can't really go wrong with the other meats.  I was also slightly surprised that the flan for dessert was of very high quality.  Not too sweet and not that crappy bready texture some flans end up being.

An all around great dining experience from service to food to decor.

The meat selection is amazing!  The table side rib eye was so tender! The shrimp was soooo good.  The bacon wrapped filet was tender and very flavorful!  The red sangria was also good. Our only complaint is the coffee.  It tasted like instant.  Extremely strong and as soon as It started to cool down it was sooooo bitter.  I understand most people are not ordering coffee so why not have one of those single cup machines.  The only other thing was they had fried rice to go with black beans.  A nice white rice would have been so much better.  Our server was Vinny and he was amazing.  He was very attentive and took his time with us. We have been to another Brazilian steakhouse on the strip and Via Brazil kicked their butt with the food and service.  We will most definitely be back!

My hubby has a birthday coming up and he wants Texas de Brazil for his special dinner. Since we had been to TDB before, and not tried Via Brasil even though it is in our area, I figured we could give it a shot. I did have an A-OK experience, but I am glad it wasn't his actual birthday dinner or I would have been disappointed we didn't go to TDB. 

The "Rodizio" dinner is priced at $45.99 per person. A 50 plus item salad bar is included, and you get to try 18 different meats that meat carvers bring to your table on skewers. You can choose if you want what they have and how much. If pink meat isn't your thing, you can request any of the meat be cooked to to your liking. They give each person there own round paper disc that you turn to green when you are ready for more meat and then you turn it to red until you are ready for more or are simply done eating. I was impressed by the fact that the side dishes were included with the meal. They had like 16 to choose from and you can pick as many as you like. That is a nice touch! They ask that you tell them your sides when you first get there so they can start preparing them. 

So I am not a vegetarian at all, but I don't eat a whole lot of meat. Tonight was my night to shine as the carnivore I am not. I absolutely succeeded! I first went to the salad bar. I wasn't impressed. There were a lot a seafood options which is great, but not for someone like me who doesn't eat seafood. I didn't feel there was a lot of options for a salad however the veggies they did offer were fresh and delicious. I put some "Caprese Salad" on my plate and that was actually very good. As we finished up our salad, the sides we ordered arrived. The "White Rice" paired nicely with the "Sauteed Mushrooms" and the "Fried Banana" was good. Then the meats started coming! I have to admit that the "Top Sirloin" known as "Pichana" that they claim is the star of the meal was not good at all. The meat was tough and flavorless. The "NY Strip", and "Prime Rib" were the same, tough meat and flavorless. Then came the "Bacon Wrapped Turkey" and THAT is delicious. I'm a huge fan of bacon and the bacon really added a nice flavor to the turkey. Then came the "Garlic Filet and "Bacon Wrapped Filet and these two are the star of the meal to me. The filet was so tender and flavorful. I like my meat cooked well done so the server took note of that and made sure to bring me pieces with no pink. I liked my meal, but can't see coming back and paying full price again. Maybe if it were a deal they had going on or something. The meat at first was not good, and the salad bar was not great. I know this isn't TDB, but I do have to compare it because they both have the "churrascaria" thing going on. And the salad bar at TDB is worth just eating that alone. The sides were decent, but I only enjoyed a few types of the meat so I'd rather spend the extra to have TDB. 

There is a Happy Hour here at Via Brasil Monday - Sunday from 5-8 pm in the patio/bar. Every Sunday they have a "Sunday Brunch" from 10 am - 2 pm and have different specials for the brunch so you might want to call and ask if there is a theme for that day. They have several options for events and banquets too.

This was my first time at a churriscaria, and I will be back. The service was very good, and although it is a little pricey, I feel we got our money's worth.

The salad bar is fairly small, but all of the items on offer were fresh and tasty. Unlimited sides were a nice touch, although they were out of yucca fries by 6pm, so we didn't get any :-(.

We paid for the upgrade so that we could sample all of the meat. I think we only counted 7 or 8 different meats, and the shrimp and ribs only came out once, so not sure if it is worth the upcharge or not.

My only complaint is that they had a wedding reception going on when we were there, and the music was extremely loud. Loud enough that it fought with the dining room music, and sort of put a damper on our ability to have conversation. 

Despite the minor inconvenience, we will be back.

Our initial trip to this highly rated (Zagat) Churrascaria did not begin well when the greeter did not seat us immediately or even after 10 minutes despite the fact that we had a reservation.  Three parties who arrived after us were seated ahead of us. Explanation given was that they wanted to clear a nice table for us....hmmm.  A comped desert from the manager soothed our feelings however. 

These style of Brazilian steakhouses which have sprung up around the country in recent years charge about $40 -$50 for an endless serving of 20 or 30 different types of grilled beef, lamb, chicken and fish. You basically strap on your feed bag and let 'er rip.  Quality of the meat in these establishments is hit or miss and quantity comes before quality here.  Lots of sides are included.  The meal is actually pretty good if you contain yourself and select the different cuts of meat wisely. At Via Brazil, we liked the filet mignon wrapped in bacon, the NY strip, the chicken drumsticks, the beef ribs, the flank steak, and grilled asparagus.  Suggest you avoid the garlic steak and tri tip -- tough and chewy during our visit. Some of the meats were over seasoned -- too salty -- and the cooks need to have slightly gentler hands on their salt shakers. 

A salad bar is included and I would say it was average at best and inferior to what we have experienced at Fogo de Chao and Texas de Brazil, two competitor chains. The selection of cold and hot salads was not as varied and numerous as we have seen elsewhere. The selections they did have were tasty and fresh however. 

Our party of three ordered the Sterling meal and the Prime meal plus an ala carte salad and fish entree.  The Sterling meal costs an extra 10 dollars and there are premium meat selections (lamb chops, shrimp, NY strip) that come with it. In my opinion, worth it. 

A pretty good meal and pretty good table service and I recommend Via Brazil without reservation.  Decent value for a good meal, not perfect but a nice restaurant nonetheless.

Bring your appetite!

I got a coupon from Groupon so I took my son for two of their all you can eat dinners. I'm sure they have more dining options but I can't speak to them. The decor is classy but not stuffy. Overall I'd say its comfortable with a touch of elegance.

We were seated, given a quick once over on the way to dine (the stop/go button), the salad bar, the free sides, etc. From there we grabbed plates and dove into the salad bar. 

This isn't the usual buffet salad bar, not by a long shot. The quality of everything there stood out. I highly recommend loading up a separate plate with their grilled portobello mushrooms. These go so well with the meats to come that you'll want to have a plate there as a side.

Back at the table, the meat on a skweres started to arrive. They had salmon, beef ribs, top sirloin, skirt steak, lamb and I'm sure I'm missing one other. Different parts of each skewer were cooked to different temperatures so if you preferred medium rare and someone else at the table likes medium well, they can accomodate this without a problem. 

All of the meats were excellend but for me the best by far is the skirt steak. Be sure to save room feel free to request it, they go out of their way to be accomodating.

The only minor criticism is that my son felt the meats were a bit on the salty side. I didn't notice this but he's always been more sensitive than I to salt. 

Overall, highly recommended. At $45 it may be a bit pricy but if your a dedicated carnivor with a good appetite, you'll be glad you went.

I love their huge selections on happy hour menu about 30+ items. Their prices are decent. Some of them includes Beef Carpaccio for $4.50; Mediterranean Chicken $5.50; Beef Satays for $5.50 and Cured Meat & Cheese,ie Chef's selection of cured meats & cheeses for $7.50.

I had the Salgadinhos, (Assorted Brazilian Appetizers) Breaded minced chicken, Shrimp empanada, Brazilian meatballs & fried cheese. I also had the Saffron Mussels- Mussels, roasted peppers, caramelized onion in a saffron broth. $5.00. The server was attentive and the food & drinks were good. One of the server photo-bombed us 3times, it was so funny.

The service is top notch and that alone will make me want to come back and eat here again. The food quality is delicious! All the meat selections were so delicious. If you love meat and all you can eat then this the perfect place for you.

Tried brunch, good service red meat was excellent. Purchased all you can drink bloody Mary's but they came out slow. The salad buffet was clean and very presentable , also had an omelet and waffle bar. Manager came around to see how we were doing and asked about my drink and shortly after it arrived . If your hungry and can eat a lot of meat at one time I would recommend this brunch for $25.99.

We have been to this restaurant a number of times and been very satisfied. Tonight we talked friends into going there for "Happy Hour"and were very disappointed. The Filet Sliders were stone cold. We informed the bartender and manager of the situation and they did nothing. It was embarrassing for us as we talked our friends into going there. That will be our last trip......Too bad, we have enjoyed this place in the past...

This place is awesome!!! I've been here twice, once with a bachelor party and another time as a group of two couples.  The first time we went all out with the boys and it was amazing, we even had a vegetarian with us and he loved it. The meat was perfect the waiters were attentive and very friendly and best of all the drinks were made perfectly. There side dishes are superb and you should definitely order them. The fried bananas are damn good. 

The second time with the couples I noticed the same staff was still employed. A very good sing in my opinion. The food again was spectacular and we enjoyed our meal with some excellent wine. We have a Brazilian BBQ in Palo Alto, Pampas, but it's more expensive and not nearly as good as Via Brasil. This place is reason enough to go to Vegas.

Oh and it's not overpriced at all. Not for the food and service you receive.

Vegans run for the door!  This is definitely for the meat lover.  If that is you and you like variety, stay and enjoy. Everything tasted good and you can have as much as you like, but meh for the price.  I prefer to have one good plate,  If I were to eat here again, I would stick to the soup and salad bar for $23.  Since there are so many waiters, I felt like I had to tip large because they do a great job, and that's a lot of people to split the $.
The food was okay, definitely not worth 50 dollars a person. The staff was great. But it was like buffet food served in a different way. Probably won't return due to the costly bill.

My company hosted a dinner here last night and we were totally impressed and grateful to Anna! We had to organize the dinner in a little over a week for about 150 people and Anna did a fantastic job helping us out! The food was delicious the restaurant was awesome the customer service was right on... everything went perfect... Thank you Anna for everything you did from setting up the tables to making sure everyone was eating what they wanted... I really appreciate you and your staff!

Had a great time here.  Food and customer service was outstanding. I have only one suggestion: add some draft beer from the tap.....this was ten months ago...
Here I am again for the third time since...very dissatisfied with the lack of preparation on a busy holiday like Mother's Day...it's not like the holiday was just going to creep up on you...I plan ahead in anticipation of it being busy...made the reservation assuming that this would expedite my wait time...reservation made for 1230 it's now close to 1pm and still waiting....took my rating down to 3 stars...not into hearing excuses... just fix your process in anticipation of being busier than normal..

This place is a little off the beaten path, in other words it isn't right off the strip. I would definitely recommend ditching the touristy areas and trying this place. All of the different proteins that they served us were very good. This place has a salad bar that tops almost every salad bar I've had. The Chocolate Mousse was very good, and so was my Cappuccino. So, if you're in Vegas, try this place and you won't regret it.

this is one place that was soooooo good. the flavor of the different meats outstanding along with the service. i couldnt believe with all the tables the carvers were going to they remembered how we liked our meat cooked. the head waiter in our area was also fabulous great personality and always on top of every need...

Pretty good off-strip buffet.  We went here on our way to the red rock mountains (not casino).  In sum, it wasn't very crowded for lunch, very attentive service and the meats were very juicy and NOT overly bloody which I was happy about.  The salad bar was stocked with everything from basic caprese salad to a fancy steamed seafood pot.  I liked the cheese rolls and fried plantains as sides.  Plus for broccoli!  LOL. I like my veggies.

I am not a connoisseur of meats, but I think I had sirloin, turkey wrapped with bacon, sausage and skirt steak.   I didn't like the garlic beef which wasn't as tender as the test.   It was all tasty and the service was top-notch.  Everyone from the main host guy to the beverage servers were very polite and attentive.   It is a bit pricey if you order drinks and dessert, but my husband is a bbq fanatic and I let him have his day.  Overall, it was a good off-strip find, but make sure you are hungry so you can make the most of the price.
arguably the best Brazilian in LV, fogo de chao ain't got nothing on these guys. my favorite place in las vegas

This place is phenominal !! Be forewarned it is not cheap. The Rodizio buffet is like 44 bucks BUT it is an experience unlike any other. First and foremost the place is casual...saw people in t shirts and flip flops on a Friday nite. :) The "salad/appetizer" bar is a meal in itself and the place to start off. Be careful NOT to overeat at the salad bar because it is easy to do with the 25-30 items !! When you are ready to begin the main course, you simply turn over a coaster to "green" and the servers with skewers of 15 plus meats come by and you can say yes or no. When you want to be left alone, turn your coaster to "red" and they won't bug you. Look at staying around 2 hours and pace yourself !! Excellent choice for special occasions..

I went here on my trip to Vegas.  Me and my group of friends were really craving Brazilian BBQ -- similar to Fogo de Chao (all-you-can-eat Brazilian BBQ).

Here's my honest opinion:

The salad bar: 4.5 stars
The sides (bread/plantains/mashed potatoes): 4 stars
The beef/meat: 3.5 stars

I was left a bit disappointed with the meat.  Most of the meats too tough for my liking. 

Add that with the slow service -- I was left waiting for more options with a green card flipped over.  As a result of the waiting, me and my friends ended up eating the sides (and bread) and filled ourselves up.  

I was used to a Brazilian BBQ  like Fogo de Chao, where you get plenty of people serving you meat almost immediately when you flip your card over to green.  

Therefore, I was left a bit unimpressed.
For the price, too many interruptions during the meal. But hey, that's their claim to fame, right?  And the food's not that good.

Thank you so much for a most excellent meal. I am on a salt free diet and usually I have very limited options on menu items. I spoke to Anna on the phone prior to dinner and she set me up with everything salt free. The waiters confirmed the situation and brought me special prepared items. I'm not used to getting such wonderful service. Everything was delicious!

We found out they do happy hour on Saturday night so off we went our usual group of 12. 

To say we were surprised would be an understatement. First off service was awesome George our waiter was on top of everything split the tickets for us and was constantly keeping up with us. 

Happy hour prices are fantastic, just amazing deals and two pages of items on the happy hour. 

The food was excellent no one had any complaints or issues and I have to say we will be back on a regular basis. Excellent food and service and incredible prices. Saturday happy hour was from 5p-8p no one does that in Summerlin. 

With so many new places opening up and many with big names this local neighborhood place which has been there for years outshines them all. Highly recommended for happy hour for sure and I'm willing to bet the dinner is just as good. 

Also the manager came over to say hi and that was a nice touch. We are losing the good service in Summerlin and this was very refreshing.
Second time here with friends.  Everything was excellent!  Although delicious, go light on the salad to make room for all of the perfectly cooked meats!

Great meats.  Better seasoned and cooked then most other Brazilian Steak Houses that I've been too.   Not over crowded so the waiters and the servers have time to be more attentive to the table.   They served lamb chops which from my experience most other places try to skimp on.  Definitely recommend this place.

Overall just a very nice experience.  The service is very good and the wait staff is extremely attentive and polite.  There weren't any meats I didn't like though some were better than others.  The salad bar was okay.  The sides were not that good.  Nice, extensive wine list.

WOWWWWW This place is GREATTTTT!!! 
Service goes beyond and beyond to the best!!! THANKS GUYS!!! 
Everything you try is DELICIOUS!!! I wanted to stay longer to have more food because I knew I would be regretting it the next morning if I didn't, but I seriously ate so much that I thought I was 8months pregnant in less then 2 hours . SO BOMB!!! 

Advice for the LADIES: don't wear high heels here! The floors are not made for ladies to be walking around cute grabbing there food!! I almost ate SHIT because of my heels!

Just had my mom's 80th birthday celebration here last night....amazing event!! Anna and her staff made it a night to remember and everyone was raving. Anna goes out of her way to truly make it so special down to the last detail... From the beautifully decorated long table that sat about 45 guests, to the two 100" screens looping a slideshow complete with music pumped into the private room with lights and a disco ball so we could dance and work off all those yummy calories. We even opted to hire a photographer for a few hours on Anna's reccomenation...can't wait to see the pics! Any little glitches we encountered, Anna was there to correct it. Overall a 5 star classy venue and I couldn't have hoped for a better birthday party for my mom. Thank you Via Brazil steakhouse!!

Worst service ever! I had to ask for bread, water, refills. I had to ask to pay my bill 3 times, and I called the restaurant to pay the bill over the phone. No manager other than the chef was there so forget about complaining. It literally took longer to pay the bill than it did to eat it! 

Please go to Texas de Brazil or fogo de chau much better service

I was always a huge fan of Via Brazil. Today it was extremely disappointing. Worst service, worst experience. Maybe it was due to 2 events they were having. My advice is have ur events and do not open your restaurant for the public because you cant handle it. From the moment we sat to the moment we left. The meat came every 15-20 minutes (only had picanha once...extremely upsetting for a Brazilian like me), we ordered sides that arrived when we were already done, and the waiter responsible for our table was completely lost. Thank God they had a salad buffet with an amazing crab salad otherwise i would have left starving. Today is was not worth my money!

We had a great Mother's Day brunch at Via Brasil Steakhouse today. What a GREAT assortment of meats, salads, omelettes & waffles. We tried a Bellini as well and it was delicious. Ask for Fidel, and you can't go wrong with the most excellent service. We've been there about five times and have never been disappointed. It's truly worth the price, especially if you use the "Loyal Blocks" app and get the $5 discount. We would certainly recommend it. It's a very special place to celebrate any occasion!!

This place was really fun! The wait staff was so polite and accommodating. My favorite was the bacon wrapped filet. I was also in love with the saut√©ed banana and vanilla ice cream. We will definitely be back!!

I live in the neighborhood so this location is convenient. Their happy hour is off the hook! Great drink prices, but more important to me are the happy hour food specials.

Every few weeks I attend a business networking function there. I always make sure I get there early to get a seat at the bar and get my dinner on.

On a side note, when Brazil has a major soccer match, we watch it from this venue.
Food is cooked perfect, service is fast and courtious, very clean and classy, great dining experience

My boyfriend and I come here all the time. We've celebrated holidays, birthdays, anniversaries, and special events here on multiple occasions over the last 3 years. Every time we've come in, the service has been great and the food is incredible. Tonight we decided to celebrate Valentine's day here, BIG MISTAKE. We made our reservation 3 weeks ago, for tonight at 7:45pm. We arrived and weren't seated until close to 8:20-8:30pm. After finally being seated, it felt like our table was invisible, a server never came over until a manger passed by and we had to ask for someone to serve us. I wish I could say the lack of attention ended there but for the continuation of the night, it seemed like we had a sign over our heads that said "Avoid this table". Every time we needed a clean plate, a refill, or any form of service we had to grab an employee to grab our "server" (who seemed to be a manager or something) to help us out. Our "server" was awful and acted like we didn't exist, which is funny because I think she was a manger of some sort. She kept calling us table 69 so for anyone that cares, she was serving us at table 69 at around 8:30pm. The meat was really really good like usual but it was very upsetting to be completely ignored the entire night on this special holiday. We finally got fed up and asked for the  check, which surprise, she forgot to bring so we had to grab her and ask again. The whole experience was very disappointing as my boyfriend has spent a lot of money at this restaurant over the years and has recommended this place to so many people. Highly, highly disappointing and honestly considering not coming back because of the disgraceful service we received tonight and the lack of care that was put into our Valentine's Day dinner.

Excellent service, great salads, great meat, 
will definitely visit again. Vinny was a wonderful waiter, Anna a perfect hostess!

Omg I love this place.My favorite meats were Shrimp Salmon Ribye and Beef Ribs.I asked the manager Anna to watch the game on 150 inch screen and she did it for me.That was so nice of her .The waiter was great also .He knew what to do before I even asked for .What a service and food.This is my favorite Brazilian Steakhouse in Las Vegas.No more Fogo.or.Texas. They lost my business tonight

pros...great place to actually celebrate thanksgiving in Las Vegas.  this was where me and 14 of my closest friends and family decided to spend thanksgiving dinner at.  and it was just great.  the place was not crowded, at least the time we were there.  and it is a pretty typical brazilian style meat house.  they advertise like 40 different cuts of meat to be had, but i only counted like 20 or something. great service and fun waiters that come around.  also a dessert cart as well.

if you have never been to one, then it is just a great way to try out this style of dining.  these are all you can eat affairs, and it would be best if you are not in a hurry.  as the time it will take you to actually digest your food will be days.  so once you sit this place has individual little cards, which allow the waiters to come around with different swords of meat.  so say the meat sword, yeah i know it sounds funny, but that's what it is.  so it comes around and the guy will ask you if you want that particular cut of meat, and if yes he places it onto your plate.  if not, no harm or foul.  then you eat, and then you wait for the next type of food on the sword.  and this happens over and over and over and over again.  

but in the case of my table, you are greatly pressured to eat whatever is being offered.  and along with that, there is the other matter of the caiperenas, which is like the brazilian equivalent of a mojito, with just a different type of alcohol.  and boy we are a rowdy bunch as we will try to bully you into eating a lot of food.  needless to say 3.5 hours later and a massive bill later, we were out of there.  and it was a great thanksgiving, beats anything that can happen at home.  just cause that would be a lot of meat to cook.  but i must say my favorite dish of the night was not a meat dish, but actually the grilled corn.  it was sweet and delicious like no other corn i have tasted.  

cons...not easy to find this place and it is a bit far from the strip.  but once you find it you will have a great time.  prices are high, but then it was an all you can eat and thanksgiving as well.  so come prepared by not eating all day and the day before as well, just to get your moneys worth.  dessert was a bit of a let down, but i guess by the time we were done, there wasn't much room left in the stomach for it.  and be wary of our table, as we tend to get loud and rowdy.  and make sure that my wife is not inebriated, as she has a vicious potty mouth that is loud and obnoxious as well.

Good food but not as good as I was hoping. Very good service, the wait staff was excellent, hence the 3 stars! $40 per person but no filet, $60 gets you the filet. Very poor selection of rare and medium rare steaks in the unlimited cut at your table steak service. Do not take children, the child menu is $25 and $35 for the 2 menu choices!

Absolutely delectable. We partook of the "Sterling" dinner which included NY Strip, lamb, bacon wrapped filet mignon, top sirloin, and others I can't remember at this time due to the blissful meat coma I am slowly slipping into.

I highly recommend this place.

Super slow service, waiters seemed like we were bothering them whenever we did anything. Told us they'd honor our coupon when we arrived, at the end of the meal told us the coupon was no good. I can get more meat, less salty, at another steakhouse.

My family and I decided to visit Via for my birthday last night. From the moment we entered to the time we left it was amazing. The staff was attentive to our needs and ever anticipated them! There wasn't a single thing item I didn't enjoy! The only problem I could ever see happening here is a over eating. One of the managers told us about their brunch which I will be back to try! Seriously if you enjoy being pampered and catered to while dining this is the restaurant for you. Make sure you try the lamb my husband is still raving about it!!

Made Mother's Day Brunch reservation.
Worst mistake! 
Not only did they overbook & fell way behind, long over an hour in seating, but the Lead Hostess played favoritism in seating some customers that had reservations 15mins later than us until the hard working (clearing tables) Manager approached her & asked why "John wasn't seated yet, you have to seat him now".
He should have switched places with her and made her clear & wipe tables!

Finally got seated over an hour an half late & then noticed there were numerous empty tables? 
What????

The advertisement made it seem like there would be a good selection of breakfast items at salad bar, omelet  station Etc.
No one was manning Omelete station.
Only one pan & burner sat there unlit until sometime later. No waffles till later, no pancakes. No pastries to speak of.
No sausage, only scrambled eggs & bacon.

Before making my reservations I was told of these various stations & that the Omelete station would prepare eggs to your liking, like over easy Etc.
Big disappointment!

The meat items were good as expected but that was the lunch part.

Near the end of our meal our waiter brought small side dish of plantains & mashed potatoes for 4 of us.
We were told the increased price of $37 would include a good selection of Desserts? 

Really Sad selection.
The increased priced also Did Not include any drinks!

If you want a real brunch and expect breakfast items, I would not go to Via Brazil.

If you don't care to eat a lot of meat but want a decent balance of breakfast & lunch items this is not the place to go for Brunch.
Not even for the regular price of $20.

I still tipped 20% & now, not sure why other than to help the innocent workers.
 
I would never go to another brunch here again, anytime, nor dinner on a holiday unless I see a big change in brunch menu & service along with less overbooking reservations.
Super Bowl Sunday at Via Brasil was amazing.  Great food, staff, and owners and we had a blast!

Love the happy hour here!  Great drinks and the food was amazing. The lobster bisque was delicious and the tri tip was so good. Much better atmosphere and food than texas de Brazil. I would recomend this happy hour to anyone. Very fun!

Great food. Amazing service from Ricardo and Victor. Love the leg of lamb and chicken hearts. Best salad bar of any other churrascaria we have gone to. We will definitely be returning with family and Friends.

This was our first visit here and we absolutely loved the place. The staff was very nice and friendly the food was divine. The layout of the restaurant was beautiful. The best part of it all was the price! We ordered both dinners one was all the meats while the other had a few extras such a shrimp salmon and lamb just to name a few. It was a very reasonable price and would consider holding an event here. This place is worth every penny!

Great everyday happy hour

Food is not great, I was really excited for the lobster bisque on the salad bar but it had no flavor, needed seasoning. The beef carpaccio was good and the goat cheese jalape√±os were nice. They had some nice cheeses but the salad bar was generally underwhelming. 
We ordered the Sterling option which had 21 different meats and I don't even think we tried 15 of them. The leg of lamb had mint in it which was gross, lamb chops were dry, the other meats we did try were just ok, not overwhelmingly delicious to anything. 

Our server Gerardo was more focused on socializing and finishing up his closing duties. We waited what seemed like forever for different meats, we kept getting the same selections over and over, our sides took forever and when we ordered sauces for our meats they took a while and one of them came out in a styrofoam container.. really??? They couldn't find one clean ramekin to bring us our sauce in? That's ridiculous..and our server kept going over to another table and just chatting, i believe he knew then because the manager was over there for quite some time , and other food runners kept having to ask him what we needed.. I don't understand why he couldn't just get us what we needed.. 


Cappuccino was great, coffee was great,
Very strong, according to my friend. Desserts were the best part of the meal although I thought the flan tasted weird..
Attentive service, superb Rodizio!  A step above the chains! You will not leave disappointed, and hungry! A nice place for special occasions too!!

This place is our favorite "go to" place when it comes to deeeelicious Brazilian style steakhouse meats. By far we've noticed compared to other places in Vegas that here the meat is better and the items offered on the side and at the salad bar are a lot better than other places. Each time we've been the service has been great and the servers are there to overfill you with all the meats they have to offer. We will definitely be returning sometime soon in the very near future I'm sure. Besides its away from all the hustle and bustle on or near the strip, very very nice atmosphere, no doubt.
In Las Vegas there are two Brazilian steakhouses but hands-down for ambience service and wonderful food via day Brazil is the best

Save your money not worth the trip barely anything on the salad bar . half the  meat was either salty or no salt at all They don't even give ice with their water serve you some hot ass water they had some clams on the buffet they were extremely salty The only thing that was good was the service . Lobster bisque soup was really watery I don't taste no lobster

Food was okay but our server was not. Server made a HUGE mistake on our bill raising the total by a lot by counting the wrong amount of people then STILL felt he deserved the tip from the incorrect bill that reflected the incorrect amount of people. We literally had to go to the POS system with him to make sure it was correct for the 3rd time. To make matters worse, we paid cash and card initially and instead of voiding the whole check he decided to keep the extra cash as the tip instead of returning the WHOLE amount to us. 
So unprofessional and disappointing. We came here for a birthday and that is not what we expected for a higher class restaurant. We won't be spending money here again.

It's been 4-5 years since I have been to Via Brasil and had no plans on coming back but my friend kept ranting and raving about how good it is,  so one day I was to lazy to go all the way to TDB so decides to give it one more shot.  I was disappointed again and paying nearly $50.00 was just not worth it. A few days later went to TDB and it was great as usual for the same price. The quality of the food and the ambiance is night and day. 

I have to say that I will definitely not be going to Via Brasil again!!!

Went in for the first time and we were blown away by how delicious and amazing everything was! The decor was so elegant , it felt like we were being very spiked by the servers, the drinks were the best we have ever had. Made us want to go there every weekend! Certainly reccomend for everyone to go any experience it for yiurslevrs, all we had to say was "WOW" the whole time!!! :)

Came here tonight for valentines day with our 2 daughters age 5 & 1 and I was really excited as was my boyfriend/Their father . It was just okay from the reviews I expected more . The staff super friendly and accommodating. The sangria I ordered was pretty good as well.  The meat was either salty or not enough seasoning.  Salad bar not to many things ehh. For $50 per person I mean we tried about 4-5 different meats from the 21 different kinds they had and it was enough to form our personal opinions.  Always wanted to try one though so hey a 1st for everything.  Maybe it'll be your own cup of tea not ours though.

Ok so full disclosure I've been here 3 times and I've loved it every time. This time was brunch. The salad bar had things for salad but also choices like apple pancakes, eggs, bacon, clams, asparagus soup, etc. The bacon was very crisp and the asparagus soup had a nice thick texture to it.

The staff is so polite and accommodating. The maitre d' was a man this time and I'm used to a woman but he still did a fine job. Sadly I have to admit this wasn't my finest moment as a yelper. The meat kept coming and I couldn't keep track of whats what but this applies to most of the meat... It was all juicy, it had a nice crust on it, and it melts in your mouth. Now I love all my beef medium rare to medium. It was a lot of prime cuts of meat. Would recommend 100% cause I'm always in meat heaven here.

Not happy with making a reservation for this place. 4 days prior to Mother's Day I made a reservation on their website, I received a confirmation email saying that they have received my reservation and I even put a note for them to call me so I can confirm the reservation. Well I didn't get a call so I called them today and to my surprise I was told that they could not find my name in the system. On top of that they are all booked up for brunch so this is very disappointing since now I have to scramble the last minute to find another restaurant to celebrate a special day. I'm a loyal customer and have dined here many times before and but this is an epic failure. Dining/restaurant experience goes beyond food, it's a whole experience to include making sure reservations are properly handled. Needless to say the person I spoke over the phone didn't offer any other solution. A good friend of mine is huge Las Vegas food blogger and I will be submitting a review for his consideration to publish an article online.

Like most Brazilian steakhouses, Via Brasil features an elegant dining room with excellent service. I usually skimp over the salad bar, but the appetizers were really good. The spread had the perfect mix of charcuterie, salad, and vegetables. I enjoyed the crab ceviche, beef carpaccio, and the various assorted grilled items. But, in all seriousness, I was here for the meat, not the salad bar. 

Via Brasil jumps to the top of my list for one of the best Brazilian steakhouses for their meats. I loved that the skin of the chicken drumsticks were perfectly crispy. All of the beef (top sirloin, tri-tip) was perfectly medium-rare. One of my biggest gripes about Brazilian barbecue is how salty all their roasts are, but I found all the meats to be well-seasoned without being over-seasoned, especially the crusts. The flavors were amazing. Also, baked cheese? Love it! The cheese paired wonderfully with the meats. 

What didn't I like? The rotation of meats didn't come frequently enough and at one point we were at a standstill. There were no ribs, lamb, or fish offered that evening. The other disappointment was the cheesecake for dessert. They actually ran out and I got one of the last slices, but it was far from what they labeled "NY cheesecake." It was heavy and generic. I should've gone for the Brazilian doughnuts with ice cream. 

I'll end with a positive note. The tableside basket of cheese-baked bread balls were simply amazing. Single-most addictive item on the menu.

Absolutely marvelous!  The service, salad bar and the meats were top self!  And the deserts are out of this world!  We loved our whole dining experience and would certainly come back again!  However next time we're bringing our family and friends!!

Bottomless Sunday Brunch done right!  This spot is among the best of the competitors around town.  It's my personal favorite anyhow.  Service is impeccable and the food is just as delicious as dinner.  

$25 gets you a choice of 6-8 rodizio meats including the picanha, the salad/soup bar, omelettes, waffles, and benedicts.  For $18 you can take advantage of their bottomless drinks that include bloody marys, champagne, mimosas, strawberry bellinis, and spritzers.  Relax, you can mix it up with your drink choices on the bottomless ticket.

***Deal Alert*** Download the LoyalBlocks app on your phone, which yields a $5 reusable discount for brunch.

Took my son and dad here for their birthday in November, but just getting around to writing the review.  OMG the food is sooooo good, this was the first time I had been there.  I will definately be going back.

I have eaten at both Fago de Chao and Texas de Brazil and I think Via Brazil is definitely the best.  All of meats were not as heavy on the salt as the other two places.  Better quality and flavor.  Had a great Christmas Day dinner here.  Service was excellent.  The only slight negative is that the salad bars at the two other places were larger and had a better variety of stuff.  That is the only reason I did not give it five stars.  The items that were on the salad bar at Via Brazil were all very tasty.  I like that the tables at Via Brazil were more spread out and did not seem as crowded and noisy as its competitors.

My golfing buddy's birthday party.  We wanted to have a special evening at a special restaurant.  A good friend recommended this restaurant.

The manager Adam set up everything for us. He did a great job as did everyone there!  The food was fantastic.  From salad bar with caprese, clams and lobster bisques to bacon wrapped turkey, assorted beef and lambchop it couldn't have been better. 

All of us agreed we will be returning.

Oh my!!!!! I can not recommend this place enough !!!!! It was so cute and fancy on the inside , definitely didn't expect it from the outside appearance !! The service was TOP NOTCH coming from a person with over 10 years industry experience !! Loved the salad and appetizer bar and The meats wow , they were not kidding with their description !!! They were mouthwatering and cooked to perfection !! It was such a great experience !!!! And the price was amazing for everything you get !!!!!

Via  Brazil was a 3 star restaurant in my previous review 3 days ago.  That's nothing to be ashamed about.... it just means the restaurant was nothing great, but not terrible TO ME.  Yelp is a site for posting your opinions.  But some guy named Dustin J. had to send me a private message saying:

"We are very sorry that Our Happy Hour is too expensive for you. 
Please visit McDonalds, Taco Bell and other fast foods if this is too expensive for you"

It took me a minute to figure out what restaurant he was referring to, but when I found 20 photos for Via Brasil, I figured it out  Congratulations, guys, I will never return to your restaurant and will make sure nobody I ever talk to does either.  Worst marketing ever.

Very nice and pleasant atmosphere. All the employees very helpful and friendly.. Great happy hour with family. The food was prepared fresh and arrive hot at the table. Please come by and enjoy this wonderful place.

This a first time we've dined with Via Brasil.  We had a reservation and despite being late,  they accommodated us very quickly.  Immediately the floor manager,  Fidel, greeted us and welcomed us like family.  He explained the menu and showed us the many choices on the salad bar.  His fellow service people were just as attentive.   We've experience Brazilian restaurants like this in the past and the meats were on par if not better than other establishments.  The service we received from Fidel was far superior than previous experiences at other places. Every member served with a smile and gladly accommodated any special requests.  It's this kind of 5-star service that is the reason we will be back. Thanks Fidel!

This place was great.  A little pricey, but the atmosphere was well worth it.  They even have a waterfall wall inside and an entire wall of wines. The place was beautiful.  The food was so yummy.  The salad bar wasn't your typical lettus and dressing either.  They had pasta, roasted veggies and other different dishes.  The meat was a little plain, but the chutney they provided to put on it made up for it completely.  My husband and I tried the rack of lamb, beef wrapped in bacon, turkey breast wrapped in bacon, prime rib, chicken drumsticks, and the beef ribs.  The only thing we didn't like was the lamb, but then again neither of us really lamb to begin with.  My husband also tried the salmon and he loved it.  The service was also great.  Our server took his time to explain how everything worked and checked in frequently.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I will be back for sure!

The boyfriend and I ate here for Easter, since I had given up red meat and was dying for a fix. Of course, we had to go rodizio-style, and I wanted to at least experience the dinner offerings.  So, we ended up getting a 2:15pm reservation for this place.  DEFINITELY worth the wait, since we got to choose from the full 16 types of meat (instead of 6).  Yes, the price was $36/person, but it was worth every penny.

Even though they gave us some broccoli, fried bananas, mashed potatoes, and cheese bread, I barely ate any of thee carbs, since I had to save room for the MEAT.

I did make sure to save room for the salad bar, since it included salmon with a passion fruit sauce, salad, peppers, portobello mushrooms, marinated mushrooms, caprese salad, meats/cheeses, beef carpaccio, chicken salad, seafood salad, etc.  I ate just a few small selections from the salad bar, since I was all about the meat.

OMG.  I was in heaven.  I tried anything and everything that was steak.  The Picahna (Top Sirloin) and Garlic Picahna were to die for.  So juicy and delicious.  They even had a different type of garlic steak, which was also good.  I also tried the Prime Rib, Lamb, and Flank Steak, but I mostly filled up on the Picahna and Garlic Picahna.  I'll admit, though, that the Flank Steak and Prime Rib were delicious, but my only objective was to eat Picahna. 

They also had garlic bread that was almost immediately snatched up after the server came out from the kitchen.  It tasted like it was garlic sourdough bread.  Whatever it was, delicious.

I didn't really want to bother eating the Pineapple and Ham, Ribs, Pork, Chicken, or Sausage, so I really can't comment on those.  By the time that the Salmon was brought out, I was just too stuffed.  Next time.  

I also saved some room for dessert, since I saw a couple of ladies pushing around a dessert cart (even though it was a little extra, it was worth it).  It was all over for me once I saw that they had tiramisu (among other things)...I just felt like they were taunting me with their dessert selection, since it seemed that they were pushing the cart around in front of me while I was enjoying my meat.  I did, however, have the tiramisu, and it was worth the wait/saved space.

The wait staff was great, although we did quite a bit of waiting before they refilled my water and before they brought out the check.  They did come by quite a few times to ask if we wanted more wine, though.  

I'll admit that when they came around, the staff was quite attentive.

We also received a $20 gift card to be used toward dinner.  

I would've probably given them 5 stars, except for the few gripes that I had about the service.

I can't wait to come back.

Wow!  What a great meal! The waiter comes to your table with a bread basket with several doughnut hole shaped buns.  They are Brazilian cheese buns dusted with parmesan cheese.  There were excellent!

I started with the salad bar and took items sparingly.  I tried the cold, sliced portabello muchrooms, one tomato caprese, asparagus risotto, two small artichoke heart halves, and two large shrimps and a piece of fish from their hot seafood mixture.  This was the extent of my salad bar foray as I didn't want to fill up on salad.  It would be a great dinner in itself.

I turned the coaster to the green side meaning bring on the meat.  Before they started that, a waiter brought three dishes to the table - one with 3 fried plantains, another with mashed potatoes, and a third with green beans with garlic.  These were my vegetables to go with my meat.  A lot of food to accompany a lot of food.

I didn't try all the meats as I was filling up before they had a chance to bring everything to my table.  I liked the small sausage, the first meat I tasted and it was excellent.  Beautiful seasoning.  Then I had two thin slices of rare prime rib which was excellent also.  I had both the chicken breast wrapped in bacon and the tenderloin wrapped in bacon.  Both were very good.  The seasonings were perfect.  I am a salt user extraordinaire, but I salted nothing except the mashed potatoes and green beans.  I had the garlic picanha (top sirloin) and it was superb!!  I also had one slice of beef rib which is sliced from a rack of rib (large--not baby back) and served on a separate small plate. 

Since there were only two tables occupied in the restaurant, there weren't several guys walking around distributing meat like rodizio restaurants.  Two guys were tasked with the serving.  I didn't get the pork loin and I forgot Tony's mentioning of chicken hearts--damn, damn, damn.  Well, something to look forward to next time.

After all this, I did hold back so I could try some dessert.  I had a slice of peanut butter, chocolate chip cheesecake.  Oh yeah--great!

Service was impecable.  My iced tea was refilled often, staff was always around to answer questions or see if you needed something.  I was greeted at the door by a delightful young lady and she also bid me a kind, smiling farewell!

The place is very nicely done.  I love the wine rack that goes almost to the ceiling.  I could see the super ladder inside to extend and reach the highest shelves.

This is a great deal with a Groupon.  The Groupon was $21.  The regular price for the rodizio is $42.95.  I'm not sure I'd be back for the full price, but the Groupon certainly makes it a great deal.  Come on Groupon--let's get anohter Via Brasil.  And you know, I'll probably go back and pay the full price if one of my friends from out of town who loves rodizio comes to Las Vegas.  We'll go together!
This place is great nice people and good quality of service the food is 2 die for i cant wait to go again great place

Food was delicious, all of the meats were cooked perfectly and the sides were delicious. Service was fantastic and the drinks were amazing. If you download An app you get a free dessert. We'll definitely be back!

My favorite restaurant in the entire city; I was born in Las Vegas.
Best happy hour I know of, and an excellent dining experience!

What a great Brazillian Steakhouse right in Summerlin. LOVE the Sunday Brunch! The brunch is a great value ($19.99 for adults if you join the e-club) and the Brunch has: Breakfast food, Salad Bar.....and of course the MEATS! They also have grilled pineapple which is awesome. If you do the Brunch.....ask for a "Filet Mignon Benedict" and be prepared to have a little slice of Heaven. This place is very similar to Texas de Brazil, but I think its more affordable and the atmosphere is more laid back. Dinner is a little more.....around $40 per adult, but the food is always GREAT and I have been here many, many times.....never a bad experience.

I went here for dinner and the food is good.  My wife and I also had a bottle of Malbec that was tasty with all of the food. 

A pleasant experience all around.

I enjoyed the lamb with mint jelly and the steak.  It is really easy to eat here on a low carb diet and is very tasty.

The fact that I have experienced another AYCE type brazilian steakhouse the weekend before at Pampas in the Bay Area, unfortunately made me realize that this place was not all that great.  The quality of meat was just OK, and the taste was not too flavorful as I would have imagined it to be. 

The service though was good.  They were courteous, and quick to serve the meat.  But, it took an hour and a half before any salmon came out.  The skirt steak was too thick, and I like it better a little crispy on the outside.  The ribs were good, but the top sirloin was kind of flavor-less.  The bacon wrapped turkey and bacon wrapped tenderloin was good of course because anything wrapped in bacon is good. LOL.

I had to use the typical A1 steak house with a little bit of tabasco to add some flavor and spice.  The salad bar was just OK too.  I enjoyed the portobello mushrooms, and seafood.  But other than that, the salad bar was just OK.  

Overall experiences was just OK.  Fancy place, romantic atmosphere, great two person band, but the food did not impress me much.  

The cappacino and tiramisu helped to replace the flavorless-ness of the food.  

Unfortunately, I cannot really recommend this place.  Sorry.

I like it better than Texas de Brazil because it's less crowded, the food is just as good, the place is beautiful, and the service was 10x better! The guys serving up the meat actually ask if there is any specific meat you want to try and brings it out as soon as it's ready, straight to your table! Ask for the chicken hearts - it was great! Since it's less crowded, the meat comes around a lot quicker (I went for dinner on a Friday). Lobster Bisque from the salad bar was delicious with actual bits of lobster. My cup of ice tea and water never went empty. Lots of hot food options included if too much meat makes you sick. The only con was the spinach was too buttery.

I took my friend here for his birthday and as I rather enjoyed Texas de Brazil a little bit more, this place holds its own.  

Came here on a Tuesday evening and met with my buddy.  I was dressed down because I eat better when I feel more relaxed.  I made it a point to eat everything on the menu and I told our host/server that.  Certain items on the menu have to be requested.  The salmon and passion fruit sauce was so good.  I enjoyed every piece of yummy protein and they still have the best salad bar evaarrrr.  I really enjoyed the prime rib also w/a side of horseradish.  The cheeseball bread cleared my taste buds/pallets each time.  

After that, we saved room for dessert and they brought the cart around.  I got a passion fruit mousse and my friend got creme brulee.  After paying for the meal and leaving a $30 tip we stayed and caught up a lil bit longer.  I saw the salmon cart go around and had to get another piece.  =]

Good stuff good stuff, haven't been here in over a year and I believe the price may have jumped.  The restaurant was clean and spacious but somehow feels it could still improve.  I don't know how but I'm still waiting for it.  De-Lish!

I've been to a few Brazilian steakhouses now this place has the best meat in Vegas.  The salmon was cooked very well and it was a nice surprise to see it on the menu.  They also had some chicken hearts that were great.  The lamb was juicy tender and cooked to medium rare just how I like it thinking about that that is how all the meat is perfect in my mind much more flavorful than texas de brazil.  The only drawback about via Brasilia is the salad bar it is pretty small and just not as much stuff as I expected.  Service was great except for an overbearing host.

Holy crap, I hit 100 reviews on my last review and didn't even notice??  And I did my 100th reveiw on some sub-par establishment?  Shame on me!  To make up for it, my 101st review is on someplace stellar!

Via Brasil is on point!  Really a very good place to have a protein-filled dinner!  Calories?  Who cares!  With over 14 types of meat to choose from and a stocked salad bar with over 30 hot and cold items to choose from, you're gonna wanna get a taste of everything Via Brasil has to offer!

We started our meal with their warm Brazilian cheese buns which were gooey and tasty.  Our server also showed us that with each meal besides the all-you-can-eat salad bar and the meat, we also had unlimited choices of any of their side dishes that came from the kitchen.  I can't remember the entire sides menu but we ordered:

-Sweet potato fries
-Collard greens
-Fried bananas 

We placed our sides order in before we were escorted to the salad bar.  This was another treat.  It seems Via Brasil is on par with Texas de Brazil on salad bar selections, and there was many high quality items to choose from:

-Caesar salad 
-Grilled peppers
-Marinated portobello mushrooms
-Hearts of Palm
-Caprese salad (pretty good, creamy)
-Seafood salad
-Fine cheeses

Along with the salad bar are six hot dishes that are offered, on this day we tried:

-Mushroom risotto
-Fish in lemon butter sauce
-Rice & beans

All the salad bar items we sampled were fresh and pretty good.  I love a good salad with marinated fresh grilled veggies, brings on a sense of balance before you attack the meat like a t-rex!  Via Brasil's beans were super good, I loved the smoky flavor with the addition of the hamhock in the mix.  I had two bowls!  The only thing I missed from Via Brasil's salad bar versus Texas de Brazil's (and I should be ashamed in saying this) is that at Texas they have California Roll sushi on the line.  'Faux-shi'...for shame!  I dunno, I guess I just like having the option of eating it if I want to!

Shortly after we got our salads our side dishes arrived.  I enjoyed the tart of the collard greens, and both the sweet potato fries and fried bananas were good.  We finally flipped our little marker to green and off we were to the meat races!  We sampled just about everything on Via Brasil's menu that night:

-Garlic picanha
-Sausage
-Flank steak
-Tenderloin wrapped in Bacon
-Beef Ribs
-Prime Rib
-Leg of Lamb
-Salmon
-Chicken drumsticks
-Chicken hearts

Just about everything was excellent!  I noticed that Via Brasil uses a bit less salt than the folks at Texas which made the flavor of their meats a bit more appealing to my palette.  I loved the garlic picanha and their flank steak, juicy and tender.  The prime rib was great, just be sure to ask for a thicker cut!  The beef ribs were very good with their house BBQ sauce, I was eating part of a slab like Fred Flintstone!  The leg of lamb was not 'lamby' at all.  I had a small issue with the salmon, it was on the dry side.  But the surprise of the night was the chicken hearts, man were those good!  Reminds you of a Japanese izakaya because of that grilled flavor.  We almost ate an entire stake of these ourselves!  I am no stranger to exotic food!  Give it a shot and try it...you just might like it!

And don't forget to ask your server to bring their chimichurri sauce for your table!  It's a must for your meat!  The mix of olive oil, garlic, lemon, parsley and other herbs gives your meat that punch of flavor which will ignite your taste buds.  Super good!  

Via Brasil also does offer various dessert choices but after the meat attack we went through we were too full to order anything, I'm thinking maybe next time?  And yes, there will probably be a next time.

Service was very good here, our server was attentive, kept our glasses full, and answered any questions we had about the salad bar or the types of meat they served.  And don't forget to join Via Brasil's e-club!  You receive news on special events and promotions, as well as possible BOGO coupons on your birthday or anniversary!  Always a plus in my book to save that dough!

I missed the old Makino that used to be in this space, but Via Brasil has done a great job taking over.  We left happy with joyous memories, and our bellies full of food.  Food that alas, will force me to work twice as hard in the gym to burn these meaty calories off.  Uh...I work out!!

Happy hour! 

We were looking for a nice patio happy hour that would be A-OK for our little guy too and we found one.

Many many many choices. Big happy hour menu. We had calamari, lobster bisque, asparagus lemon risotto, Brazilian cheese rolls, and a sampler of fried goodies including meatballs and shrimp empanadas. We also sampled red sangria, passion fruit mojito, caiphirina and wine. And topped it all off with chocolate mousse. 

$54 for 4 cocktails and loads of food with leftovers to take home. Everything was delish. The fried items were slightly indistinguishable from one another but tasty nonetheless. Calamari was cooked perfectly with two yummy dipping sauces. Bisque was salty, rich and dreamy. The cheese rolls are especially delightful soaked in the aforementioned bisque. Chocolate mousse was rich and creamy. 

We had a lovely cushioned sofa and table on the patio. The service was great. Very friendly and over attentive. 

We will definitely be back, and soon!
The best! The food snd service was amazing!! Thursday night football made it even better!!! $19.99 for AYE !! We will be back!!!

Very saddened by the fact that we had reservations for New Year's Eve and no one told us it was going to be double (yes double $80) for rodizio dinner till we were sat down at our table after we had time to order a drink from the bar. We made our reservations a week in advance and even at that time were we not informed of the price change. When we asked to speak to the manager, she walked toward our table then walked the opposite direction. Needless to say, completely unimpressed with the lack of communication on price change, as well as what was done to try and help the situation.

All I can say is WOW. The food, the service, the ambiance/displays, and choices/variety are just amazing!
