I came for their Saturday/Sunday Brunch and I cannot wait to come back and join them for dinner!!! My waitress, Caroline, was outstanding, very welcoming and attentive! All the meat servers just outstanding in remembering how I chose my meats! The flavors incredible, the options endless. VERY reasonably priced for the amazingness you receive. They really do concentrate on quality, not just quantity! Some buffets don't really keep their buffet "fresh", this one was, their attention to detail and the food, the best I've seen for this type of eatery! The manager was even working right along side his employees!! Their fresh squeezed juices are incredible and for an additional charge they offer a bottomless Mimosa, Bellini, Raspberry Champagne, and I believe Bloody Mary, that they allow you to switch to a different one each time you order! (I couldn't try it this time as I was by myself). The only "critque"/suggestion I would have would be for their fresh squeezed juices, they are $3.99 a piece, no free refills, with this being said I believe management should look into offering an option of a carafe (if everyone is drinking same juice) for a few dollars less than the total amount of glasses served from it. (Let's say a carafe serves 3 glasses, they could charge $10 instead of $12) in addition I feel they should do a bottomless juice option where you could switch between the different juices maybe offer that up at $12. Just a suggestion. Once again, overall 5 stars would give more.......VERY VERY PLEASED, WILL BE BACK!!

I will never eat here again!

Dear Adam Gomes, General Manager, Via Brasil Steakhouse,  Las Vegas, Nevada  8917

I have been a customer at your restaurant for many years and my wife and I, frequent your establishment at least four times a year for dinner in addition, at least that many times and enjoy your Happy Hour.
I thought I should reach out and contact you before I post my commentary on my experience at your restaurant on New Year's Eve.
I was contacted by your representative a few days before New Year's Eve and I was instructed that payment was required in advance in order to secure our 9:30 PM reservation. I was also told that a higher than normal price will be charged.  I was fine with that and agreed to pay in advance. I was told that you were serving dinner, at a lower price to other patrons that were served earlier that evening and for those that wished to attend for NYE, would be served in a party atmosphere with music, desert bar and a champagne toast.
Per the request of your representative, I arrived at your restaurant just after 9:30 PM.  I want told I had to wait for a table.  I was not pleased I had to wait to be seated even though I pre-paid for a reservation at your request. You did not accommodate me upon my arrival as expected. I was not seated until around 10:10 PM!  Your service and planning worked to collect payment in advance but you did not provide the service you demanded advance payment for!
You usual sumptuous salad buffet was lacking in some of your normal variety and, even more disappointing, was the fact that many of the dishes remained empty.
The music that was played by your DJ entertainer was not matched with the demographics and age of your clientele that was in attendance.  It was an obvious and blatant error and was further evidenced by that lack of your customers on the dance floor.  How anyone as a professional can be so far off, is beyond belief.  This should have been recognized and immediately corrected.  Nobody seemed to be in charge and more importantly, nobody seemed to care.
At this point in time, I feel like I need to find another restaurant to take my steady stream of business to.
As a courtesy, I wanted to voice my experience to you in advance of posting this on any social sites.
Hopefully you will learn from this horrible failure that evening and make changes in the future.

I wrote to Adam Gomes and his obnoxious wife, Anna, on two separate occasions in order to elicit some response.  They never responded and that only indicates that they do not care about customer relations!  I will NEVER eat here again!
I suggest you do the same!  They don't care about their customers!  There are too many other great restaurants nearby.

Via Brasil Steakhouse

I've been to almost all the Brazilian steakhouses in Las Vegas.  Via Brasil is one of my favorites. I don't eat at authentic Churrascarias too often.  That's because I never seem to get my money's worth. But if I could, I would eat at a place like this on the daily.  If you haven't been to a Churrascaria before, then you're missing out on an all-you-can-eat meat treat.  Carnivores are welcome.  

There's three options when dining here; the Sterling Dinner (21 meat options), Prime Dinner (14 meat options), or Rodizo Brunch.  The salad bar also includes soups, cheese, bread, and pastas.  The salad bar is part of the meal, but don't recommend spending your calories here.  Save yourself for the meat.  Servers will be by every couple of minutes with different types of meat as long as you have the puck with the green side up.  I tend to have a strategy when I dine at places like this. I will usually get a very small sample of each meat.  Once I find my favorite, it's on like Donkey Kong.  I will go after my favorites and at Via Brasil, those favorites include the garlic steak, tri-tip, tangy chicken, turkey, and sausage.  The restaurant will also prepare the meat the way you like it.  I didn't have any complaints with the meats that I had. Everything that I had was good.  As for the service, it's close to "as good as it gets".  Overall, I recommend Via Brasil.  Feastmode On!!

A very nice n classy place, a true 5 star really!! 
we made a reservation right before arriving and they prepared the table ahead with a high chair for our baby. 
The staff is so attentive n friendly, and they always want to make sure we are having the best experience.
The salad bar is always fresh with great variety and the lobster bisque is amazing.
Last but not least, the meats are to die for!! My favorites are the prime rib and the tri tip, and my husband likes the beef rib.

If you are visitor to Vegas, without the car, this is not a good place to go. It's too far, Your meal is cost as much as the same your cab. it's really hard to get a cab to pickup after you want to return.  When we were there at that time, the waiter will go around us with the meat selection we really waiting for. We end up only taste about 7-8 kinds.  I had almost everything at other brasil steakhouse.

We tried this place for the first time on NYE with our two kids (5, 9m) seating was fast for our reservation, no one was left waiting at 5:30pm. Place wasn't overly crowded which was nice. Our oldest was given a fuzzy coloring board which was really cool. Our baby was given a light up bracelet which he really enjoyed. 

Their buttons are small- colored red and dark blue. They should really change those colors. We were passed over many times (we were sat in a corner). The salad bar was skim pickin when I went up but they did have muscles and clams which I enjoyed. 

The food was just "eh" as I didn't find myself wanting or needing more of well anything. Out of the norm for a Brazilian steak house! The meat didn't really stand out for me and that was disappointing for the price. They do have seafood additions but we only had shrimp pass us accompanied with the steak and the clams/muscles I mentioned previously.  Having refills on my sofa was nice compared to previous places. Their bread is delicious and stays warm.

I don't think my family would be back though based on the main course not wowing us. It's just a waste of hard earned money in our opinion.

This is by far my favorite local restaurant in the area. Less expensive than Texas de Brazil in Town Square - south of The Strip. 

Friendly servers. They really take care of regulars there. 

Bummed they got rid of their Happy Hour Special a while back but still a great value.

Amazing from beginning to end. 
Sat quickly. 
Never been to a Brazilian Steakhouse so was a little over whelmed at first but our waiter quickly noticed this and explained all the details clearly. 
Food was amazing. Can't beat the quantity and quality for the price. Service was EXCELLENT. especially enjoyed the opportunity to try things I might not usually try incase I don't like them but since its all exclusive why not try something out of your norm??!! Try the fried bananas!!!

We're blessed as an anniversary dinner as a gift, let me tell you service, taste, options and ambiance were spectacular. So look forward to bring our family and friends. But most of all look forward to trying the Sunday Brunch

One of the best happy hour I ever been!  drinks and food half price the  beef ribs and the picahna are my favorite. drinks were so fresh and delicious our waitress jessica was amazing makes us feel special and always checking on us. We definitely coming back we wanna try the dinner menu restaurant looks so amazing

I recently went here on a date (so I apologize for no pictures) and as a first timer to a Brazilian steakhouse I was super excited.  The service was amazing!!  Our waitress was just on it, our drinks were never empty, the menu was explained to us and I was ready to go.  There are a few different meals options which correlate to the types of meat you're offered, and we decided to go with the top option that had everything on it.  The price was $49.99 per person, but that included a list of about 15 different meet options, and the salad bar.  The salad bar was so impressive that I would be perfectly content with eating just off of that, ya know if we weren't at a steakhouse!  It had cream cheese jalape√±os, various meat platters, etc.  I would definitely go again!!

We came here with a group of 50 people for a wedding rehearsal dinner.

For around $56 a person, we got the All You Can Eat salad/seafood bar, all you can eat meats brought to you (tri tip, sirloin, filet, bacon wrapped turkey, chicken, pork) side dishes (mashed potatoes, saut√©ed mushrooms, garlic bread, corn on the cob) and dessert.

The food was amazing and the service was outstanding. The servers come around consistently with different meats on a stick and accouterments and my plate was never empty. Who likes meat on a stick? This girl.

The only complaint I have is that they garnish everything at the salad bar with green onions. Every single dish, including the lobster bisque, is sprinkled with nasty green onions. Not everyone cares for the taste of raw onions, so maybe just put them on the side for people who want them? Garnishing dishes with green onions is lazy and unimaginative. Just sayin'.

If I could do no stars, I would because we didn't even get a chance to eat here tonight. 

It's Valentine's day...I get that but if you take a reservation and call it a reservation, you should be in a position of managing your restaurant in such a way that your customers' tables are ready and available for them at the reserved time.  Especially if that time is a 9 pm reservation because according to Open Table at the time the "reservation" was made, it was the earliest time available for a party of 2. AND especially since Via Brasil called me to confirm the reservation yesterday afternoon. 

Upon arriving (15 min early, I might add) we discovered several other seemingly disgruntled couples standing outside of the restaurant. We walked in to check in for our 9 pm "reservation" and were told that "unfortunately" they were running behind and were only just seating people with 8 pm reservations meaning that our 9 pm reservation would actually be sat closer to 10 pm. 

So, the reservation wasn't really a reservation...it was call ahead seating booked through Open Table? For Valentine's dinner?  Riiiight. 

So, thank you Via Brasil...you actually did us a huge favor. Rather than waiting until nearly 10 pm to eat in your obnoxiously loud and crowded restaurant, we went across the street to Honey Salt and were sat right away.  We had an amazing meal for probably half the cost of what we would have paid at your restaurant. Funny thing about Honey Salt...they recognized the couples eat out at a nice restaurant for Valentine's Day and actually brought in extra tables to accommodate more patrons...GENIUS! Bonus points...they handed out roses to the ladies. Honey Salt is our new fave joint near our house. Separate 5 star review coming shortly for them...

This place is so much better than Fogo De Choa.  The meats were tasty and not dry.  They even had garlic shrimp.  I usually don't eat chicken but it was so juicy here I had a few pieces.  I will definitely be back.

I'm already drooling! It was so good! So tasty and a ton of perfectly cooked and flavored food! Honestly, the servers kept scaring me because I would be in the middle of a conversation and BAM! A sharp rod filled with skewered mouth watering meat is in my face! A sliver of lamb here, a piece of rib eye there and an hour later, I probably consumed an ungodly amount of Brazilian BBQ  that I feared I would never look at meat the same way again! 

Didn't have room for desert though. But that's never a bad thing!

I want to go back.

Was excited to try this place but it wasn't anything to die for. We just went for a drink and then onto the next bar, but still. The atmosphere was just eh. Not all that great. The drinks were expensive and not all that great. We ordered Sangrias that were not pre-made so that was a bust. I would come back to try their food, but would it would my first choice to come here? No.
Better than Pampas in Planet Hollywood hotel.  Almost as good as Fogo de Cha.  Service is definitely top notch.  Good local eats.

Okay, so I originally went here to eat their buffet, because it was a last minute craving for some piccanha meat. lol and behold, they have a happy hour menu, and I had to carpe diem on that situation.

The Brazilian wings- 2 Stars. I wasn't too fond of the flavor. 

Crabcake- 2 Stars. It was not the traditional flavors so I was thrown off. 

Beef slider- 5 Stars. I mean, I'm gonna go back and just order three of these and stuff my face because it was THAT AMAZING. 

Piccanha steak- 3 Stars. It was good, but not as great as when you get it at the buffet.

Service was horrendously slow and inefficient, as the bartender was doing everything and working the section by herself. 

I'd give a solid 3.5 Stars for now. That burger is what topped my experience.
awesome. good food, great price, fancy fine dinung ambience but not the peice. excellent quality if meats served

We dined here on the 24th of July. 
This place is amazing, classy and very good food wise. My husband is half Brazilian and so we had a great experience there. Our waiter a very nice young man and kept checking on us. The serving was great, I had the feeling because 90% of our group was Brazilian we had the sort of "special service". But even when our cards displayed 'no meat' they still came around. The waiters were nice, and me not having been to a Brazilian Steakhouse before, when I asked what the meat was, they explained. We had a lot of talk with the waiter, because part of our group also came from Holland, and he talked with us and it was all a good time. 
I had two glasses of Chardonnay and it was a very good white wine, very soft and fruity. 
The meat was amazing, I recommend you try the chicken hearts when you dine there, they are pure heaven. They have a lot of good stuff there, my advice is just try it out! At the salad bar I had gotten some cheese, and what I thought was meat, but it turned out the be cheese as well. It looked a bit red/purple-ish. It tasted like cheese but had a sweet taste to it as well, it was great.
This restaurant was simply amazing and a very good fun evening for our party of six!

Spent $190 for my wife & I. Didn't feel bad about it because the food & selection is very good. 
I was not prepared for their method of serving the food but it was a good relief from the norm.

Food was amazing! We waited at the bar for a few glasses of wine and our bartender Brandon provided excellent service. All the meats were so delicious and tasty! But, service at our table was okay. Our server Ricardo didn't really follow through with us in the beginning. We waited quiet a while for our sauces and sides as we already had our meats. The hostess stand also lacked communication. My friend brought me a cake as a surprise but that note wasn't relayed to our server. My friend had to ask about it in front of me which totally ruined the surprise!  I'll still be coming back, but I sure hope that next time our server will check up on us for the sides and sauces!
Great food. Excellent customer service. Could not get through all the meats. Will get the rest of the meats on next visit.

So damn good! Better than any buffet we ever had! It's about 15 min drive from Vegas but trust me, it's worth the drive!

Pretty much everything here is good. My favs were the turkey wrapped in bacon and the filet wrapped in bacon. There's 16 different things that they bring around. I got to try 14 out of the 16. Didn't get a chance to taste the chicken breast and the salmon. But trust me, our stomachs weren't missing the last 2 items. It was pretty much at max capacity about 15 minutes BEFORE we stopped eating!

You also have access to a salad bar that includes items with shrimp and lobster bisque. The lobster bisque was a bit watery to my liking, but I can't complain since it's free! At the beginning of your meal, you also get bread cheese balls (YUM!) and brocolli and mashed potatoes. I would recommend eating only 1 cheeseball and skipping the veggies. You will thank me for it later when your stomach is maxed out and you've only tried 10 of the 16 meats :)

Did I mention that they have IMPECABBLE service? Everyone from the sommelier, the water boy, the waiters, and the roving meat holders were incredibly attentive and accomodating. And it's not like we were high rollers either. We were your regular run of the mill folks. But they treated us just like we were VIPs.

We will be making a visit out here on every single Vegas trip!!!

I loved dining at Via Brazil!!! The cocktails are amazing, Brazilian crush is my favorite drink of choice. The service is top notch.  The restaurant is very clean, and spotless!! The food is mouth watering, with a unique variety of all meats, seafood, and salad bar. I took my parents for their first time to Via Brazil steak house, and they were smiling from ear to ear. They had a blast, while enjoying all the variety of food. A great experience, that you must experience for yourself! Located in Summerlin, a nice get a away from Strip. Also for a girls night out, Thursdays are Happy Hour all day!  Woo Hoo!!! Can't wait to go back  their and have another fun, unique dining experience!!

A great place for Happy Hour!  Its crowded enough that there isnt really any bar stool available or tables but not busy enough that there were people standing around.  Happy Hour is daily from 5pm-8pm in the bar and patio area.  

FOOD: 
Caipirinha's (Kiwi and Strawberry) $5 each - their kiwi flavored sugar can liquor is so good!  The Caipirinha is Brazil's famous drink and I love it!! Its sweet and super strong.  I really liked the two separate flavors and it didn't hide the kick that you get lol My only problem I had with the Strawberry was that I would have loved if they strained the strawberry bits out.  Its kind of hard to drink when every two seconds I have to clear the straw.  

Chicken Tenders $5 - The chicken tenders are tender and moist ^_^ they make good tenders lol And they come with a side of Yucca Fries which I love.  I am a great lover of french fries and every time I have Yucca fries, I wonder how come other restaurants cant make them too!

Brazilian Fish and Chips $4.50 - The fish was extremely moist and flakes really easily which is a good thing.  My only issue with this is that it has a fishy taste to it which makes me wonder how fresh it is. 

Brushetta $3.50 - You get four piece of brushetta topped with feta, tomato, and top with lemon dressing.  Its pretty good and the size of each brushetta is pretty large when most restaurant serve you something pretty small.  The only thing that could make this really good was that they need to toast the bread.  I love bread, I love bread that i just eat straight up with their crunch exterior and super soft chew interior... their brushetta was that but its not very stable when you're trying to lift it up to take a big bite when the lemon dressing is soaking through.  

Sausage & Yucca $5 - Yucca fries are the bomb! When we place this order, i thought were were going to get these chubby little sausages (no idea why i thought that lol) but what we got instead small little sausage slices (about size of nickels) that were sauteed crispy.  The flavor was good but was surprise that the form they came in.  Whats really good is if you take the slice sausages from this place and put them on the brushetta lol


SERVICE:
The staff are very attentive ^_^ Since there wasnt any cocktail tables or bar stool open, they had set up two of their patio table behind the bar (small corner hidden behind the waterfall bar).  I think because we sat in this corner, we got better service lol cause the waitresses had to always remember to stop by. 

Anna, one of the owners and event planner, walks the restaurant and the bar area and checks on the guests as well.  She is actually the reason why my fiance and I booked our wedding dinner at their restaurant.  

The table next to us (the only other patio one in our little corner lol) had 3 guests that got their food quite quick but was missing their Caesars Chicken Salad (which looked pretty good and the size was large which I must remember to try next time).  The waitress apologized for the delay as there was a mix up in the kitchen and brought the salad ASAP.  Anna came by and offered them complimentary dessert for their delay on their one order.  I thought that was pretty nice since the guests didnt really seem to mind and that Anna was so quick to hear about it. 

WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK FOR HAPPY HOUR AND CANT WAIT FOR OUR WEDDING DINNER TO BE HELD THERE!!
Service at the bar is ok. Food special at HH are pretty good. Try the filet sliders. Stella bottles for $3 is nice.

First, I like this place better than Texas de Brazil.  

Via Brasil has amazing service and warm hospitality.  I have always felt that the energy is very frenzied at Texas de Brazil--they are always very crowded and interested in turning over tables. 

Via Brasil never stopped trying to feed us and constantly made sure our experience was positive.  They pay attention to fine details.  For example, they periodically bring you a clean plate to start over with when you have meat scraps littering your plate.  

The meat quality is excellent and the servers always tell you that if you aren't ready for a meat they have, they will be sure to bring it back around later.  Additionally, one person at my table wanted one last piece of filet at the end, and they fired up a fresh skewer of them, just for him.

We went without a reservation, which was refreshing.

GO to this place!  You won't regret it!

Thank you Via Brasil! There were 8 of us yesterday who went to Brunch to celebrate a belated birthday. Both the food and service were phenomenal and at a price of $25.99 (we had a special promo from their email club making it only $19.99) it is well worth it. There is a salad bar that has a bunch of salad items, fruit, cheese, charcuterie, pancakes, bacon, the list goes on; in addition to the salad bar there is an omelet station, waffle station and a crepe station. Then of course there are all the meats that they come around with carving table side and everything is all you can eat. BONUS you can also add on unlimited mimosas, bellinis and blood marys for $18.99 (I think a la carte the drinks are around $8).

Our party was somewhat staggered, with some joining later than others and I believe we were there for almost 4 hours with everything said and done. At no time were we rushed or hurried along; they were very attentive with great customer service throughout. It was a great experience and celebration and can't recommend this place enough. We will definitely be back again for brunch and will be trying dinner sometime soon.

I just moved to vegas 6 months ago. So finding the ideal place for Brazilian food was a must. Whenever I don't have time to cook, I love coming here. The happy hour menu has up to 30 meal options and it's inexpensive. The servers are super kind. Out of al the restaurants in Vegas the food here is the AUTHENTIC. 
The manager makes sure you are enjoying your food. Which is always a plus in my book. Only complaint I have is I wish they played more Latin music (Brazilian music). Then it would feel like I was back home... Also check out the bartender Brandon. He always takes good care of my friends and I...

I've been here twice, once for dinner and once for lunch. The lunch is exactly the same as the dinner. It's still a buffet which is a little heavy and a lot of food for lunch. The salad bar has a variety of cheese, fish, seafood, salad and it's pretty filling already. The meats are kinda bland, I think my favorite was the chicken and skirt steaks. The best thing about this restaurant both times was the flan for dessert. It's thick and creamy and just delicious. but its not included with the buffet price.

We came here tonight and ordered the dinner sterling menu and to be completely honest it's not worth the money. My husband and I are meat lovers and agreed that we much rather spend this money on a single rib eye steak at any other steakhouse. The salad bar was ok but not better than other brazilian restaurants. And I'm not gonna lie, the wine was BAD. The place is nice and we really wanna give it another try but next time we will definitely come at brunch.
Pass on this place, go to Texas de Brazil - 1000x's better.
It was definitely good, but the service was kinda slow. But it was Valentines day so it was understandable.

My wife and I were in town to celebrate our 20th anniversary. I made reservations on line and they confirmed within the hour by phone. Felipe was very attentive to us and explained how our dining experience was to unfold.
The food was amazing, our favorite was the garlic steak! We had a quiet table as I had requested, we had champagne to toast with. We were well taken care of by the staff, they have great customer service.
We will definitely be going back the next time we are in town!

We had our rehearsal dinner here and it was the perfect choice.  Anna did an amazing job coordinating with me and, as I live in Canada, it took a bit of time to get everything organized, but she was always patient and enthusiastic about our dinner.  We had about 30 people and we decided to go with the semi-private room.  The food was awesome and our waiter was on it and had a great attitude having to deal with so many people. In our group we also had a lot of people who had never been to this type of restaurant so it was a fun experience.  Having a buffet style dinner works really well for large groups but unfortunately many buffets are sub-par.  I read other positive reviews of Via Brasil and I must agree the food is awesome and you get value for the price.  Our party was staying at the JW Marriott down the road and Anna was able to organize a shuttle for us as well. Overall a great experience and once back in Las Vegas we will make sure to go again.

If you are craving a potato, carrot and onion soup go ahead and order the Lobster Bisque because that's exactly what it will taste like.  Really.  That was very disappointing.

Also, I order the steak Sliders at Happy Hour and they were very good.

My dining companion ordered the Calamari and although it looked good it was a very small serving and she said it was very salty.

The waterfall features in the restaurant were very cool to look at.

As we were about to leave I circled around the cold buffet in the center of the restaurant which was underwhelming to say the least.  In my opinion, Texas de Brazil has a far superior buffet and overall dining experience.

For me, I will not be returning.

I must admit, the first time I ate at Via Brasil I probably would have given 4-stars, but after my second visit I gotta go with 3 instead.

Let me begin first by saying I don't think VB is a bad place to eat. In fact, I think it's a very nice restaurant with very nice wait staff (including bussers, hostess, waiters, everyone!). On both of my visits I was pleased as punch with the service and the arrival of the meats/cheese bread/condiments/beverages. 

However, on my second visit some of the magic wore off from the first visit. I went here for a birthday dinner with my fiance. On a Saturday night I made a reservation, expecting the place to be busy, but it definitely was not. Kind of a plus for us, except for the fact they sat us out in the middle of the floor. I was kinda disappointed with the seating and hoping we could have been seated in a more secluded part of the restaurant, but it was okay...

As for food. The meats were okay, minus the salmon, which was delicious. I tend to skip the sausages and chicken-type meats when I come to a Brazilian steakhouse. I must say though, I think all of the meats were overly-salty. Cooked well? Yes. But just salty. I went through three glasses of water.

The salad bar I think is okay, but not as good as Texas de Brazil.

Overall I'm saying it's an okay place. It is cheaper than Texas de Brazil. It is more intimate than Texas de Brazil. I enjoy the ambiance here. I wouldn't NOT reccomend Via Brasil, but it will probably be awhile before I go back.

I'm not going to lie the food is good. They come around a lot and give you plenty of choices. The salad bar isn't as great as Texas De Brazil. I was charged 8 bucks for some water. Make sure you just ask for regular water or they will charge you for the bottle. 

When I was trying to leave it took forever. My server was so clueless at times. I asked for the check and it took 15 mins just for him to bring it to me. Also, it took 10 mins just to get my water. I will say because it was on Valentine day, but who knows why it was so slow. Trust me go to Texas De Brazil it's a tad bit better.

The meats served here are excellent. Service is pretty good too. I would have given them 5 stars except the salad bar is somewhat skimpy compared to other Brazilian churassco places I've been to and they also ran out of lamb which they promised to bring to us.  Plus, my friend had to pay extra to order the lamb on the menu.

Disclaimer:  we were here for a seminar, so we didn't pay for the meal.  But we still got pretty much the full, regular treatment.

The restaurant is really beautiful, and there is a long, but very narrow, outdoor patio.  Of course it was too cold to be eating outside, but I wonder how this would work with the Brazilian rodizio concept.  I imagine it would be more trouble than its worth.

We really liked the salad bar, with its huge assortment of items, most of them pretty tasty, and I tried very hard not to pig out.  But with such a vast assortment, even a minuscule tasting of everything adds up to a substantial portion.

The meats, though, left a lot to be desired.  The first one served to us was the turkey (or was it chicken?) wrapped in bacon.  It was so salty that I couldn't eat it, and it wasn't just the bacon;  I took that off, but the salt permeated all through the meat.  The rest of the meats were mostly tough, oversalted, and lacking any flavor, except for the beef ribs, which were really good.

Service was difficult; it was hard to get a waiter's attention, but this could be attributed to the group set-up.  I wouldn't downgrade the restaurant because of this, since it may not be totally valid.

This wasn't the first Brazilian rodizio restaurant we've been to, so we have others to compare it to.  It's fine for the money, and we'll likely come back.  But first we'll try some of the competition in town, which seems to be growing weekly!

Don't be fooled...the Strip is not the only place that has scrumptious food! I've eaten at a place similar to this on the Strip called Pampas Brazilian Grill in Planet Hollywood but Via Brasil is so much better! They have more buffet options here like: Seafood Salad, Mushroom Ravioli, Asparagus Risotto, Tabbouleh just to name a few. They also bring warm side dishes to your table like fried Plantains, fried Yucca root ..(tastes just like a french fry..it tastes like it's good for you too), broccoli, and mashed potatoes. They also bring out their warm rolls that taste like soft warm Cheez It's ..those are addicting! You must keep control of yourself or you will be too full to taste their wide array of meat that they bring to your table. Some of my favorite meats were the sirloin, prime rib and I don't usually say this but the lamb was very tasty! The Pineapple Sangria that I had with the meal just enhanced all the flavors in the food. This was so worth it!

Very disappointed in my visit today. I have been here before and received great service, I can't say the same for today.

With it being Mothers Day they increased the price with no added services. The waffle bar was not open you had to order from your server and the waffles weren't completely cooked. The bacon was burned and the busser was more attentive than our server; so I tipped her. 

For $100 I deserved better. Extremely disappointed

I had my rehearsal dinner here; they accommodated about 50 of us. The service was just amazing and their food, as always, was delectable. It's a classy place for all of your guests to pick and choose what they want without having to go to a casino buffet or have a full menu. Two thumbs up.

Excellent service, great food, beautiful restaurant. The waitstaff were incredibly friendly and professional. I felt like a queen. All the meat were soo good, I could not find anything to complain.  The fried bananas were so yummy and the flan dessert was to die for.  Definitely worth every penny!

I honestly cannot say enough about this place. My Cousin had a wedding reception here last night in the private banquet room in the back of the restaurant. It was quaint, only about 30 people but we were all well tooken care of. Anna was amazing and helpful from the very beginning and was extremely accomodating towards our every need. Anna let us bring in decorations from the night before the event and said they would set up for us the day of the wedding as long as we explained how we wanted everything set up, so we didnt have to stress over it because it is "your special day" as she said. They also have hookups for audio/video from a laptop for music etc plus decorative lighting for the walls. All the waiters and bussers were on top of their game that night especially Felipe. He constantly asked if we missed any of the meats or needed more sides. We had a two hour open bar and he definitely made sure we had enough to drink. Even though I had a drink already he let me know the open bar was about to end and if I wanted another Long Island, im in Vegas so how could I say no to free liqour? The bartender also made sure the drinks were nice and stiff. I will recommend this place to anyone in Vegas and will be back in the near future! Hats off to the staff, your service will not be forgotten.

I'll be the first to admit the quantities of food here are wasted on me. Not a buffet gal as I just don't eat "mass quantities". 

That said this was good.  Salad and app bar was inspired, lots of choices for everyone.  The meat: the last one I had was the best. Beef short ribs. The prime rib was good, the brisket had a bit of a charcoal taste to it. I didn't try the sausage or the pork. The sweet chicken was fantastic. The desserts: chocolate mousse was crazy light, not too sweet and airy.

Went here last night for the first time.  The hostesses were super friendly, our waiter, Vinicius, was great and very attentive, and the food....EXCELLENT.  All of the servers were great.  We ordered the Sterling meal.  The bacon wrapped filet was phenomenal.  Off of the salad bar, we had the lobster bisque, rice and beans, spicy chicken cups, seafood salad.  I've been to Texas de Brazil and Fogo de Chao several times in the past and I think Via Brasil was much better.  I will definitely be back soon.

Great food with a friendly atmosphere. Wait staff was extremely friendly and attentive, and the meats flowed like the Salmons of Capatstrana. It is a little on the pricy side,  but as a once in a while special occasion place, it hits the mark. The variety and depth of the menu allow you to try so many things that I really felt like we got our monies worth. So, Via Brasil,  we to see you at the next anniversary or birthday to celebrate in style.

**HAPPY HOUR REVIEW** 
This place is seriously amazing! A friend and I came here for their happy hour in the bar area on a weekday around 6pm. The space was a limited bit limited, but we were still able to grab a table. They also have a nice outdoor patio for HH for when the weather is cooperating.

First of all the service here is phenomenal. The servers are super attentive and friendly. They made constant checks to see if their was anything we needed.

The food is also amazing too! We shared the Caesar salad, beef carpaccio and one of the steak dishes. Each was very flavorful and just the right portion size. You also can't beat the HH pricing. The total for all that food as well as three drinks was about $40 with tip. You can't go wrong there.

I will most certainly be coming back here again and again. Love it!

Everything about this place is amazing! Went tonight for my Hubby's bday. Everyone is so friendly and the food, OMG, SO GOOD!  I ate entirely too much, so much I don't think I'll need to eat tomorrow. Anyways, they sang to my hubby  and brought him flan with a candle. This place is SO WORTH  the money.  We will be back!!

I guess I am used to Texas de Brazil, where you pay a price and everything is included. Via Brasil has two different menu options and does not include dessert in either. It was odd to pay more to make sure that you could have every type of meat that came by.
We had 6:30 reservations and arrived almost a half an hour early to sit in the bar for a bit before the rest of the party showed up. It was impossible to put a drink order in at the bar. In the 30 minutes we were there, the bartender apologized several times and finally just told us that we would probably be at our table before she would be able to get us a drink. Again, it was just odd. 
The salad bar had a lot of different options and was pretty fresh. I had to laugh at the "clams"....when you open the serving dish labeled clams you are greeted with a pile of clam shells and not a clam in sight. The server was friendly and the meat was well prepared. 
In all, everything was ok....but I am not super excited to go back.

I've gone to this place a number of times now, and wow. Just wow. Unless you're a vegetarian, this place is amazing.

If you've never gone to a Brazilian steakhouse before, it's quite an experience. It's all you can eat and you are given a card that's green on one side and red on the other. If you want them to bring more, then green side up. If you're full or just want to take a break, red side up. Of the 18 different meats on the menu, almost all are carried around on what can best be described as mini swords. If the waiter sees your card is green side up, he/she will stop, slice you off as much as you want, and then make way for the next waiter. A few of the bigger items, like beef ribs and salmon, are brought around on a cart, but the same principles apply. The service style is called "rodizio."

I've found that the skirt steak, top sirloin, and leg of lamb are the best, but it's entirely subjective. Most of the steaks have a similar seasoning, which has a slight salty taste, but everything is very good. 

The best way to approach this massive intake is to focus on the meats first, then finish off with the salad bar, because let's be real here...you aren't going to get your money's worth if you do it the other way around. The salad bar is well stocked with dishes ranging from meat and seafood entrees to various veggies to appetizer-ish items. They usually have calamari salad and hearts of palm, so I'm always satisfied. 

The drinks at this place are top notch too. There is a respectable wine selection and an assortment of Brazilian drinks, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. The two worth mentioning are the guarana and caipirinha. The first is a soda that tastes like Red Bull, and the second is the national drink of Brazil. I was expecting the second to be more of a, well...drink, but it turns out it's just straight liquor with a splash of lime juice and sugar. It's got a really good flavor, however, it'll definitely wake you up if you're aren't expecting something so strong. 

The dessert cart merits a look before you decide to call it a night. I'm sort of a tiramisu pig, and theirs is worth trying. I won't say it's the best I've ever had, but I also have impossibly high standards in this field. Theirs is, without a doubt, more than good enough to warrant ordering again. They have creme brulee, cakes, mousses, and a few others too. Come to think of it, their desserts are pretty much what you would expect at an Italian restaurant. 

I would rate this place as one of my favorite restaurants in all of Las Vegas, but I can't really go there too often since it's a little cost-prohibitive. Dinner for two with drinks and dessert will run you about $120 after tax and tip. That said, they do offer some specials that will appeal to more budget-conscious diners. Mon-Thurs from 5-7, they have a limited (meaning only 5 meats without the salad bar) all you can eat special for $18.95 per person, served in the bar area and patio only. They offer the same special on Sat and Sun from noon to 5:00 as well, so you don't really have an excuse not to try this place.  

Make sure Via Brasil is on your radar for your next special occasion. You won't be disappointed.
I was at the restaurant on Christmas. I had an amazing dining experience. The food was delicious. I would definitely return.

Amazing, simply amazing!  Worth the price and the drive.  The salad bar is filled with great selections, and the meat is prepared to perfection, no matter how well done you desire it.  Service was very attentive, and came to the table frequently.  A great place to go for a quality meal to celebrate, or take a date, or even just have a nice personal dinner.  

So tonight I was looking at Brazilian Steakhouses on Yelp, and another reviewer mentioned this place.  I live on the other side of the valley, so I was a little hesitant to make the 30 minute drive when I have a couple of places on my side of town.  Well as soon as I took my first bites, I knew it was worth the drive.

The salad bar had a few different dishes in addition to the standard Brazilian Steakhouse fare.  That being said, after a quick trip around it, I didn't grab much, after all, I'm here for the meats.  

As soon as I sat down from the salad bar trip, I was greeted by the gauchos who brought me several kinds of steak, pork shoulder, and turkey wrapped in bacon.  While I like my meat more on the well done side, there were cuts for every preference.  Once I made it known to the gauchos that I liked the meat more well done, every time they approached my table they offered me the well done portions.  

My server was constantly present refilling my beverage and asking if he could get me side dishes,  Unlike the other places I've visited, here you have to request your sides, but they're included in the price.  They have several options and of course they're all unlimited.  

As it said on their menu there are a couple of things you have to ask for, if you would like to have them, including chicken hearts.  From the first trip I took to a Brazilian Steakhouse, I learned to like the chicken hearts, so I made sure to request them.  When they came, they were plentiful and flavorful.  

The only suggestion I have is for them to leave a menu or list of the meats so you know which ones are upcoming, and when to not fill up.  

The atmosphere was great, the gauchos and servers were very attentive, and most importantly the food was flavorful and delicious.  Well worth the cost, and the drive from anywhere in the Vegas Valley.  

With the prices and the drive it is unlikely this is a weekly destination, but I'll definitely be back for special occasions.  It's also a great place to come when you just feel like celebrating a Wednesday night off (or whatever night you feel.)

I tried this place Christmas night with some friends. The service was very good. From walking in and being immediately greeted, prompt drink orders, etc. 

I was impressed that the manager continued to circle and make sure that we got to try everything we wanted. She made sure to send servers over if there was anything we wanted to try. 

We hit the salad bar first. I wasn't really impressed. I probably would not just do the salad bar, personally I don't think you can compare their salad bar to Texas De Brazil. Not nearly as many options and the food felt kind of picked over and lackluster. 

The meat was great. Well seasoned and delicious. I loved the cooked mozzarella! For dessert we shared three kinds. An incorrect dessert was sent, but the server did take it back and bring out the correct one. The creme brulee was just ok, the crust wasn't fired enough. The panacotta was delicious! The donuts were ok.

Overall, we had a nice time. I would definitely try back, but would probably skip the salad bar and dessert.

I LOVE THIS STEAKHOUSE. 
Our service was exceptional, the food was mouth watering. The sides were also perfect! We were treated like royalty. 

Salad bar has excellent varieties, cold and hot. The selection of meats and fish came out in perfect speed with a myriad of options circulating. (Beef, chicken, lamb, pork, steak, salmon, and shrimp are the few things we had). 

The photo attached was the free dessert they gave us in celebration. It came with a sparkler candle. Definitely pushed our experience over the moon. 

There is also a point system with each purchase. First timers who sign up for emails receive $25 off your check when 2 adults purchase the full "Rodizio Sterling Dinners". 

Im a terrible person and forgot our fabulous waiters name but, he was spectacular!!! 

We will definitely be going back for dinner, maybe even brunch and happy hour! 

Pricing: 
* $50.99 pp  full Rodizio Sterling Dinner (21 meats) 
* $42.99 pp lighter Rodizio Prime menu (14 meats) 

Brunch: 
* $24.99 Gourmet Appetizer/Salad Bar, Made-To-Order Omelet & Waffle Station and 8 Succulent Meats served tableside.

Happy Hour: 
* 5PM daily with Over 30 menu items 50% off and cocktails starting as low as $5.50.

Horrible start to our New Years Eve 2014. Took nearly 50 minutes to get seated after our reservation time. We finally had to point out a table that had been sitting empty for over 20 mins to the host team. One of the main hostesses just rolled her eyes at the other hostess for not seeing it. We were finally seated at 11:10pm. We watched as one other lonely couple also waited as long as us because the hostess gave away their reservation. We witnessed "cousins of a waiter" (a party of over 15 people) getting sat without a reservation long before us. We gazed at three empty tables in the bar- which would've suited us fine- but nobody was smart enough to come up with an easy solution. All we really wanted to do was sit down and eat and enjoy time with our friends that were visiting. Where was management in all of this? I started to feel sorry for the staff, all of whom seemed entirely overwhelmed and tossed to the wolves.
A staff member told us that the Manager was too busy waiting on tables and leaving other waiters high and dry with very few tables on this incredibly busy evening. A manager never checked in with us at all the entire night, even after we expressed our dissatisfaction to our server- Girardo. He did the best he could and was pleasant enough. 
The food was okay but the $80 fixed price NYE meal was a big joke, and I would not recommend it to others. The sides were pathetic. The top sirloin was very good. The whole experience was rushed, which was unfortunate as we were trying to spend a nice evening out with out-of-town guests. We had to rush and get everything we wanted from the salad bar before they took it all away right before midnight and changed to desserts. One of my friend's is a vegetarian, so she was counting on another trip up but before we knew it it had been whisked away.
Very hard to justify a $360 bill for four people after the bad start to our dining experience. Over half the restaurant brought their children and they were all running wild all night long. I understand that some families want to be together on NYE, but would you let them go crazy like that on a normal visit to Via Brasil? The music was entirely too loud, we couldn't hear each other at the table. All in all, we couldn't wait to get out of this place and never come back. Definitely leaving Via Brasil in 2013. We won't be back- EVER.

I was recently having a conversation with some people about this place. For some reason, we were also talking about Groupons. I said that if a Groupon ever came up for Via Brasil, I'm jumping on it. Lo and behold, a Groupon appears days later. It was a sign.

I'm pretty sure Via Brasil takes up the space that was formerly (and quite briefly) a Makino's. It's a nice, large, and elegantly decorated restaurant. As soon as you step inside, you know you're in for a culinary treat.

After you're seated, they explain the red/green system - green of course meaning that you're ready for meat! My card stayed green for most of the night. To put it succinctly, Via Brasil serves up some of the most amazing cuts of meat I've ever eaten. Sure there were some items that weren't quite up to par, but most of it was absolutely awesome. To be honest, it's all quite a blur. They just kept coming and coming and coming. And I just kept saying yes yes yes!

Surprisingly, I didn't enjoy the bacon-wrapped tenderloin that much. It was the weirdest and most unexpected thing. I actually thought the bacon got in the way of the flavor! On the other end of the spectrum, the last cut I received was some sort of garlic-infused meat. Looking at their web site, I think it is the "Noble Cut of Picanha in Garlic." Wow. I was full by that point, but that didn't stop me from getting a second cut. It was the perfect ending.

If I ever go back, I think I know what strategy I would employ. I noticed that the cuts of meat I enjoyed most were light and very much on the rare side. The cuts I didn't enjoy as much tended to be dense, which caused them to be not as tender and way more filling.

Oh I should mention the salad bar. You might think one would ignore it. The reality is, you need something on your plate to balance out that meat. It's really much more than just a salad bar and the choices are mostly delicious, but definitely use that only as a complement to the meat. You are here for the meat!

One thing I didn't realize is that dessert is not included. I couldn't resist getting some of their Tiramisu. It was pretty good, but not sure it was worth the extra $8. I know it's a silly thing to mention since the Rodizio meal is $43, but it's good to know.

OK this is long enough. Way too long. FOUR STARS!

The restaurant has a very nice atmosphere. They have happy hour from 5-8 pm, you can actually try different Brazilian appetizer as their menu is pretty decent. You can also have all you can eat salad bar or all you can ate meats. their food is pretty tasty. I still prefer Texas de Brazil but If you don't want to drive far this place is a good option.

Staff definitely gets credit for being awesome. Place is pretty, but so is everything out here. I did have a turkey sandwich that was out of this world. Maybe I was hungry, but it was slammin'! I'll try it again. Glad they are fixing their rep from years ago.

Holy meat!   I discovered this place during an off-strip trip to Las Vegas.  This place is very much in the vein of Fogo de Chao in Los Angeles and other major cities.   Our visit occurred during Carnaval season and as a result we had a great time with all the dancers they brought in and all the beads and decorations at the tables.  It was a very festive atmosphere the night we ate dinner here.   

The biggest piece of advice I can give about this place to newbies is "don't eat for a day prior to going."  Cuz, you are going to want to gorge yourself on all the yummy meats.   Everywhere you turn there is a waiter carving up some kind of yummy morsal of meat.  If you haven't been to one of these meat fests, the general idea is that you sit and waiters bring meat to your table and carve off what you would like to try.   They keep coming until you tell them to stop. When you are seated each person is given a set of green and red cards.  You put the green card out when you are ready to eat and you put the red card out when your pants can take no more. 

With chicken, beef, pork and more, you simply can't go hungry.  If you need some veggies they have the greens covered in a large salad bar which you can visit to your hearts content.   The food was really enjoyable and I would go again.    If you make it out of this place hungry then surely hell has frozen over.  Good eats, good times!

I'm sure everyone wants to compare this place to Texas de Brazil so here it is....

If you like you're meat rare, VIA
If you're really into the awesome salad bar, Texas
If you love lambchops, Texas, VIA does NOT have lambchops...be forewarned 
If you don't want to wait at least 15-30 min every-time you go, VIA

Its a tough choice but if i HAD to chose one, I'd have to go with Texas, a few more selections at the salad bar and Lamb chops trumps all for me

One of the best service experience! The staff was all hands on deck, working seamlessly. The manager was very attentive and really on top of every service aspect. It's a huge restaurant so to see such attention to details really made me a fan. The food was terrific, a meat lovers paradise. I enjoyed the atmosphere, however was a little too warm. I will certainly return and save room for some dessert and maybe try one of their many wines.
Amazing food and service. Will definitely come back. Visiting out of town and glad we found this place.

They think they are so clever.  Party of 8 on a weekend night in a restaurant filled to 1/3 of capacity.  Very slow and forgetful server;  busser continually prompted to remove dishes and replenish water.  Everyone selected the $50 menu.  Salad bar not what it used to be.  Luke warm and bland lobster bisque, cheese selection limited, Brazilian rice and beans also only luke warm.  Mussels, clams and chicken were hot and very good.

Servers are trained to offer chicken and pork products REPEATEDLY  before bringing top sirloin, flank steak and tough tri-tip.  Small shrimp were also offered.  Side dishes were served three times before WE had to ask for other items which are included on the Sterling menu.  

Clever:  fill 'em up with the cheap stuff so they are too full to consume the expensive meats.  Not so clever at all.

Which featured menu items were never voluntarily offered and did we have to ask for?   lamb chops, prime rib, ribeye steak, salmon.  One serving of each meat received, never a morsel of the salmon.

The value just isn't there; no ambiance/music; manager and assistant managers walked around slowly in circles, never once stopping at our table to test our satisfaction.  

Be advised:  choose Texas de Brazil over via Brazil.

We stopped in on a Saturday night to sit outside and enjoy the perfect weather and to our surprise there was plenty of room. Ordering from the Happy Hour menu (5pm-8pm) we shared the Wedge Salad, Filet Mignon Sliders and side of fries. Everything was great -- the perfect amount of food (not too much!) and we were in an out quickly. Great job!

I hate to do this because the food was delicious. First off, our server was not very good. He seemed to be upset that he was at work. We never got our sides we ordered. They seemed to focus on sending the cheap meats around more that the expensive cuts like filet, lamb, or the fish. We mostly got shot rib, chicken, or flank steak. But I do like flank. Our waiter charged us for a 2 year old, then told us he thought he was 5. Wow, kid barely talks and sits in a high chair, and our server thinks he's ready for kindergarten. He also charged us for 5 people when there were only 4. So charge for a toddler that was suppose to be free and charge for another person that wasn't there. The food we did get was good, but I probably won't be back, because even after we called the restaurant to tell them about the server (and we told them the food was fantastic) they gave us a quick, insincere apology and denied a compensation to return to make up for the bad experience.

Amazing service and dinner.

I liked almost everything they brought out. The salad bar was good. I liked how they did family style sides and brought it to the table. I had a hard time flipping my card over to red because they continued to have a lot of stuff. They even took care of me by getting me something specific that I liked and went back and made more.

Great churasscaria in Vegas!

Caroline is the best! First time here. Came here for brunch and we might have over stayed our welcome but the staff never stopped being amazing. Ordered the bottomless drinks and was not disappointed. Great wine spritizers and mimosas. Our server Caroline was on top of filling our drinks and making sure we were happy the entire time, plus a wonderful accent. Will be back.

Via Brasil is a Brazilian churrascaria that is pretty far off the strip.  Unless money is no object, I wouldn't recommend travelling by taxi. Odds are your taxi ride will cost more than the meal itself.  If you are sick of the buffets and looking for a meat coma, this is the place.

Walking in, we felt we came under-dressed as the place had an upscale feel to it.  A nice place to go when you are all dressed-up  But Monday night seemed pretty slow and the few people there were all casually dressed.

Salad bar had some interesting items such as carpaccio.  The quality of all the skewer meats we tried was excellent.  Every piece we tried was flavorful and amazingly tender.  While there are 18 choices offered on the menu, we maybe saw maybe 12 of those 18 rotating through (but again, that may have been due to it being a weeknight).

18 styles of meat offered on the menu:
pork ribs
pork loin
ribeye
salmon
sausage
chicken drumsticks
lamb chops
turkey with bacon
skirt steak
suckling pig
picanha (top sirloin)
chicken breast
flank steak
beef ribs
garlic picanha
tenderloin in bacon
leg of lamb
prime rib

Desserts were top-notch as well.  I had the creme brulee which was a fairly large order and was probably one of the best I've ever tasted.  My friend had the coconut flan and that was an excellent choice as well.  Save room for dessert if you can.

Service was excellent (on the weeknight).  Skewers came by quickly and waiters came by frequently to refill drinks and ask if we needed anything.

Highly recommended.

I decided not to make firm plans for my boyfriends Bday dinner because I wasnt sure if he would be back in town. We had no problem getting a last minute table here on a Sat night. The staff was all very nice and helped to make the evening a success. 

The Salad Bar: 2 stars... Not super fresh. I normally love lobster bisque but this tasted condensed. 
The bread: Very good! 
Meat selection. I certainly didnt see 18 choices... The ribs were AMAZING!! I was happy I could have rare and it was all cooked perfectly. 
Sides: Cooked to order. Asparagus was a little undercooked. 
Dessert: Awesome! You must try the Truffles. 
Wine: Decent selection
Surroundings: Def not a "romantic" vibe... I wouldnt take a date here. 
Service: 10000 stars :)

What it is missing... Something to make it "special". Sauces for the meats would be nice as well. I had to have A-1 for the first time since I moved to Vegas because they have no house sauces. Overall, I probably wouldn't go back unless I had a coupon or I was invited there. It was good but it didnt blow me away.

This is to Anna (banquet manager) and her team, for making our wedding dinner a memorable one. She's very professional and handled our request nicely. 

The only hiccups is the music not working and no lobster bisque that day which was husband's favorite. But overall it was great! (Sorry this was a year overdue)

First time here and we're impressed!  Came here on an impulse for Sunday Brunch.  Soooo good!  So glad we did.  I actually enjoyed it more than Texas de Brazil and Fogo de Chao.  The brunch items were really good and paired well with the meats they served.  Definitely try the turkey wrapped bacon.. better than the last ther places.  The cheese bread came fresh out the oven.  We will definitely be back.  My kids will love this place for sure.
Great atmosphere.  Good food.  Fun.  They have dancers and performers that periodically came out.  It was pretty cool,

There were so many types of meat to choose from as the servers walked around that I lost track of which ones I liked. The food was quick to fill me up. There were a couple of steak choices that I really loved. The staff is really friendly and patient too.

A nice place for a date or anniversary. I wouldn't come here as much because of the price, but it's well worth it when I do.

Made reservations and waited over a hour, Buffett was a joke and the dessert because they change over to dinner we received no desserts . Host give out the wrong pricing and manager could not careless he was a ass towards all of the people who got the wrong price . No worries will not be returning

Recently, my family of 4 (my wife, two kids-9 & 6, myself) celebrated my wife's birthday at Via Brasil.  She had been there once before, but this was the first visit for the rest of us.  I had trepidations from reading so many comments about how "formal" it was, and how it was not good for children.  Both of those comments could not be farther from what we experienced!

When I made reservations online, I clearly indicated that we would have two young children, maybe just to see if the restaurant would give some indication of their reaction...but within 10 minutes, I got a phone call to confirm the request and welcoming our children to dine with us.  At that time, I also mentioned that it was my wife's birthday, and they graciously said they would "do something" as a surprise.  Yes, I know this is becoming perhaps an all-too-familiar 'perk' for restaurants as well as many diners (to have to hear Happy Birthday chanted several times during their meal!).

The decor is upscale and suggests the kind of place with some snoot appeal, where people may come to be seen, but let's face it, this is a suburban restaurant, and what restaurant would risk alienating the down-to-earth folks with an overly haughty attitude these days?  Via Brasil gets it just right in that the 'hardware' is upscale and formal, but the staff and service is engaging and friendly, without any pretentiousness whatsoever.

When we arrived, I immediately noticed many parties with children...although I couldn't help but note that they all seemed to be seated in the front section of the restaurant, and that maybe the staff was consciously trying to keep the back part of the large open dining area somewhat kid-free and quiet.  It didn't matter to us - the entire dining room is beautiful, and the food is the same regardless of what GPS cell your table is in!

As for the food, I rated it 4 stars and not 5 just because there were some items that were not quite as superlative as others.  Everything happened as others have mentioned:  you sit for a short while, order drinks, and build up a little more anticipation, but then it's a bee-line to the buffet, which had more variety than the average casino/hotel buffet.  Salads, soups, and various hot dishes (stroganoff, a curry dish, a risotto, seafood paella, etc.), along with appetizers that were presented well and tasted great (carpaccio, asparagus,  etc.).  NOTE:  The captain had come over shortly after we were seated to let me know that our 9-year old would be given a very reduced price for the entire meal (around $15, I think), and she would be able to eat anything she wanted (all meats, etc.), and that our 6-year old would not be charged at all.  While I don't know if that's their standard policy, I felt that was more than fair, and certainly goes a long way to encourage "family dining" at this restaurant from time to time.  The waitstaff was great in handling our children, too, always stopping at each one of them to see if they, too, wanted to try whatever cut of meat they were offering on each round.

Even as we were coming back with full plates of appetizers, freshly grilled meats were being 'walked' around the tables, and the noshing (if one can 'nosh' on meats!) started right away.  Before we knew what hit us, we had cuts and slices of so many different types of meats...and most of it was excellent.  All of the beef offerings (rib eye, picanha, flank steak, garlic picanha, and the prime rib; we passed on the ribs because they were too huge and wouldn't fit on our plates at the time) were fantastic.  My wife enjoyed the lamb chops immensely, though I wish we had stuck around for the leg of lamb to make its rounds.  The other offerings - turkey, pork, and salmon - were a little hit-or-miss, probably because I prefer my meats less 'garnished', and these were typically crusted or sprinkled with parmesan or wrapped in bacon.  Actually, I enjoyed the salmon, though many may find its smoked flavoring a little washed out and bland, and its texture a little pasty instead of flaky (imagine cooked small roe!).  The sausage didn't do anything for me...but then again, I'm not a sausage fan.

Before we knew it, almost 2 hours had elapsed, which is saying a lot when dining with 2 children!  They had sampled quite a few meats, too, and while it may not become their favorite restaurant, I think the "bigness" of the experience kept them from becoming restless, and they both said they enjoyed VBS.

I'm running out of room here..so I'll just say LEAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT!  They also remembered my quick comment about my wife's birthday, and delivered birthday wishes as requested!  Definitely a place to consider for all occasions, but do plan on spending a good deal of time and money (around $150 for the entire experience, even with the generous discounts for the kids, and we aren't wine drinkers).  I hope this place stays around a while!!

Great food and amazing service! They have a much better discount on kids meals than other Brazilian steakhouses. Wait staff is very attentive. The atmosphere is very relaxed for a family especially in Vegas.

Via Brasil is definitely the best brazilian steakhouse in Vegas. The food selection and quality are simply perfect for anyone who wants to have a true brazilian steakhouse experience outside of Brazil. The buffet options are also very good. The staff is very courteous and attentive. Basically, there are not good enough reasons to go to the other brazilian steakhouses in town. I've been to all of them and the last one I went to is Via Brasil - I wish I had gone there first. The price is not that different from the other options in town and the quality is undoubtedly better (meat quality and presentation, amazing cheese bread, good buffet and larger variety of cuts - which composes a more accurate representation of brazilian steakhouses). They also have some traditional brazilian foods that I thought I would never find outside of Brazil (like bolinho de chuva for dessert and chicken hearts).
There are not enough compliments for Via Brasil! I will definitely come back.

Via Brasil is very similar to all other Brazillian steakhouses we've all been to. Except it's a little bit pricier and the meat selections aren't quite as extensive as Texas. Service was decent, just not as authentic or friendly as Texas.

Pros: Food good, not great. Convenient location.

Cons: Pricey, not as many options as other similar restaurants, service just okay.

Would eat here again if someone has a gift card or something but won't go out of my way.

I brought my uncle here for dinner last night and we had an enjoyable dinner.  I have eaten here a few times now and this is one of my favorite restaurants in Summerlin.  The first time I dined here was the best, but each time after has been consistently great as well.  I LOVE their friend bananas!!!  I was a little disappointed last night they did not have the risotto out on the table, but I found plenty of other options to try.  I enjoyed coming for brunch the best as they seemed to have different meat choices and the price is a lot lower.  The pineapple was very good they had during brunch.  I always end my meal with one of their cappuccinos.  The service is always fast and you never go without a full glass of water.  I hope to try their happy hour soon!  Can't wait to come back again.

Been here before and the food was really good. Was seriously looking forward to coming to a costume party tonight. We had a ton of other things going on, so we were very late. When we arrived, the party was hopping! They had hors d'oeuvres set up, and the bar was packed. I asked a waiter if the setup was all for us, the party goers, and he said yes. So, we grabbed a plate and some snacks and found a table. I went waited in line for the bartender,  who had to be flagged down by no less than three people, since I'm apparently invisible, even in full Victorian garb. Once I finally got our drinks, I returned to our table only to find a bill for $58 - for a freaking salad bar! Sixty bucks for a salad? Are you kidding me? I had yet to take a single bite, so I called over a waiter and asked him what was going on. Same one that told us the hors d'oeuvres were part of the party, only now he acted like I was dumb. Told him no way in Hell was I paying $60 for a salad bar. Especially since I hadn't even found the salad, only the hors d'oeuvres for the party. He called over a manager, and he told me that they weren't for us. What? We asked first!! Bitchy waitress chimed in and said we were picking food off other's plates. Um...we sat down with a party of people who offered us hors d'oeuvres. WTF? Ended up telling them to take the plates, now it's principle. Rude bartenders who ignore you, waiters who lie, $60 gold-plated salads, and mean waitresses. Damn.

Amazing restaurant and service! I honestly like it better than Texas de brazil! All the meats were juicy and had tons of flavor!!! The side dishes are amazing as well! I found my new Brazilian steak house. And them rolls! Oh goodness I am in heaven! Cannot wait to come back!

We signed up for the email special offers and promotions.  The brunch specials are terrific!  They offer the full salad bar with hot items (ex.  bacon, scrambled eggs, potatoes, muffins, soups) as well as an omelet/waffle station cooked as requested.  Benedict dishes are also offered and are requested with the servers that come to the table.  Of course, meat selections brought to the table!  I love the buffet experience without having to walk through smokey casinos and it's located close enough to my home to make it a favorite 'buffet brunch' for my family.

Came in for a romantic dinner and so glad I chose this place, not only is it 5 min away from my house but everything was amazing! The sides are just as delicious as the high quality meats. I loved the atmosphere and the service our cute Brazilian server Carolline was a sweetheart and a great up seller. She recommended a nice red wine to go with out meal. Will definitely going coming back.

Vegan paradise in a Brazilian steakhouse? You f***ing bet! 

I've always been super impressed with Via Brasil. But I haven't been in more than 2 years since becoming vegan. I really wanted to take my friend and recalled them having an epic salad bar, so I chanced it. 

Unbelievable. Not only was there plenty of deliciousness at the salad bar, they were happy to modify side dishes and were extra careful to let me know if anything anyone else ordered had dairy. Brazilians favor olive oil to butter, so this didn't effect my choices too much. 

If you're vegetarian or vegan, or have an allergy, this place sure goes the extra mile to accommodate you. 

Five stars from how I remember the meat on visits several years ago, and Five stars still, for being helpful and more than that, just all around excellent service. 

So, vegan or lion or anywhere in between I definitely recommend.

I don't even know how to start this. It was my Anniversary. So we made reservations here. Glad we did. As others had to wait no more than 20-30 mins at about 6:30 so not bad.

When we got sat it wasn't the most desirable table, come to find out it was amazing. We were right next to the Salad Bar. Wasn't bothered by others going to it.

Our server was amazing. We had the 25.00 off coupon, and it was applied no questions asked. She recommended drinks that were amazing. When you get some of them, you are in shock how small they are.... Trust me take a drink. They have a punch, yet still very well balanced. Our server asked if she could surprise us with a round. Let me tell you, the drink was amazing. It was Passion Fruit, Mango, X-Rated... amazing. Just ask they will know.

THE MEAT: All of it tasted great. Though we only saw two different kinds of meat that were exclusive on the Sterling Menu. Though if you ask, they will get it out to you. Huge plus. Everything was exactly what you asked. If they noticed you eat your meat more well done they will try to get some more of your taste out. 

Salad Bar: great selection. The whole time I was there, there was someone changing out plates, even if they weren't empty. They stayed in top of it. I just wished they had the Muscles on the hit plates. Though it just shows how they rotate what they have. 

In all it was an amazing experience. The only thing is the front of the house staff, as in the host stand, and such. Need better communication. It seemed they were the only ones running around with their head cut off. Still polite though. You have Open Table use it. More so with how large your restaurant is. It makes you feel uncomfortable when you are sitting right there.

Food and Service is so worth it. My side comments are just from being in the food industry.

Year after this, this place brings high quality and great service.  Amazing salad bar with a variety of veggies, cheeses, meats, soups, and entrees for you to eat in addition to the Brazilian style meat service.  The veggies are fresh and delicious and the area is always spotless.

I can't say enough good things about this place.  The food quality is excellent.  The meats are perfectly charred and seasoned and the server will cut you a portion depending on how cooked you like it.  

Sides are great too.  We always get mashed potatoes, broccoli, asparagus, and the plantains.  I'm surprised more people don't go.  The price is actually very reasonable for any restaurant let alone one that serves you so much meat (expensive) and has the level of service they do.  My favorite restaurant in the Peccole Ranch/Summerlin area.

Impeccable, attentive service is always a big plus, but it really just comes down to the food in the end, right? Well, Via Brazil does not disappoint. I probably don't have the stomach capacity for this place, but even though I had to skip a few of the selections, I cannot complain. Even the salad bar items were top notch and had more than just the typical carb fillers. I took small portions of mozzarella, mushrooms and roasted peppers as my sides and sampled a couple of the "hot" items like asparagus risotto and coconut chicken (both excellent).

I tried most of the meats, bowing out at times because the service was almost too fast! I could barely keep up, having to temporarily flip my coaster to "red" to avoid plate overload. Everything I tried was tender, flavorful and served up hot and fresh from the skewer. Definitely bring your appetite and a lot of cash- this restaurant is not cheap. Bill for two, with tip, easily topped $100 AFTER the $50 Groupon certificate. Worth every dime. I wish I could have crammed down more than two bites of flan and a small Cappuccino for dessert. 

Atmosphere was chic and ambient and I cannot say a single negative thing about any of the staff. Nothing was "over the top", but it is definitely a nice place for an excellent meal.

I have not tried any of the other Brazilian steakhouses in town, but I've been to a few on the East Coast- Via Brazil tops them all so far. Be sure to try a Passion fruit caipirinha- dang, that's a good drink. I only needed one, I assure you.

I went with my family. They told us on the phone it would be $28 per person. We got there and it was buffet style, all u can eat salad, and various meats brought to your table and sliced onto your plate.  Appetizers were brought to our table also. The atmosphere and food is impressive and they've got 5 stars so far until I get the bill. They charged extra for desserts and drinks which it was assumed came with the buffet. $7 per dessert and about $3 per drink which made the bill about $30 more than expected. Those hidden costs were pretty underhanded because they even brought the dessert cart to the table and asked what we wanted for dessert. It would be just as unfair as finding out that the various poultry meats offered contained an extra charge.There were no menus and nobody told us drinks and desserts wouldn't be included in the buffet. I hope you scammers go out of business for pulling that crap.

Texas De Brazil I feel has a better pre-meal bar. Other than that the in dinner entertainment is great! It was a little difficult to get servers to deliver the premium meats. That being said every thing is SUPER delicious and the servers are AMAZING. loved the beef tar tar.

NOT a place to go for vegan or health food!-LOL.This place is a steak lovers Bomb! A bovine chowin dream! A cow cutters claim.....STEAK is ON! It's not cheap either but when you consider what is offered to you and how much of it you an indulge the glutton in you won't think it was nothing short of a pretty good deal actually! The salads are fresh,place is spacious and meat is all cooked just right! No wonder food lovers and critics flock to Vegas for meals like this! This place is spacious and soothing inside....all the modern amenities you love about casino towns! I don't like pasta but tried it here and was amazed at how good it really is! But cow city calls you moooooing if your a carnivorous sort of chow master! I will most definitely go back next time I go to Vegas!

I have a confession.  Guilty pleasure be damned.  

I am a steak snob.  

Chicago is famous for several things, but alongside the famous deep dish pizzas are their wet aged steaks.  Beef has been a passion ever since at age 8, my brother and I, being as the latchkey kids typical of those times (nod to Stranger Things), we would come home and raid the fridge.
