On this occasion, we found a steak.  Dad loved to cook steak.  He'd sear them perfectly - you'd know because he'd tell my brother and I to grab a towel and start fanning so the smoke detector wouldn't go off.  This particular specimen was a huge slab of chuck roast frozen stiff.  Who knew about defrosting or marinating or any of that - we certainly didn't - all we were certain of was that we were so starved we couldn't bear to wait for Mom or Dad to come home.  We thought we knew.  I knew how to turn on an oven.  And ketchup was good on fries so, in you go.  Forty-five minutes later, dad arrives and smells the kitchen asking if we were cooking something.  Of course we said no.  He found the steak in the trash, where we tossed it.  It was foul.  That's when dad dared not spare the rod.

I discovered churrascarias in the early 2000's starting with Fogo de Chao  and another soon after that was owned by White Sox coach Ozzie Guillen.  This turned into a summer of steak, once dating a girl by taking her on a whirlwind foodie tour on all the churrascarias we could find.  We didn't care - we were still in our 20's and our metabolisms were still on overdrive.  

Needless to say, churrascarias are MY thing.  Fast forward 10 years to Vegas.  My wife and I tried nearly all the churrascarias in town.  The chains.  The ones off strip.  Some good, some bad, some whose quality at first encounter was a shadow of their former glory.

Today, my friends.  We found the best churrascaria ever.  Ever.

Why?  Because their Sunday brunch includes the full on churrascaria menu, but also breakfast.  Yes! Omelette stations and waffles!  The maple syrup (it was national maple syrup day earlier this week) was the real deal.  The kind that refuses mightily to leave the ladle and have to be coaxed gently into each crevice.  But I digress.  Unapologetically, I love waffles.

The salad bar has a decent lobster bisque and they also offer clams, much to my wife's delight.  She also loved the white rice and black beans, which is cooked with a pork or bacon in the traditional Spanish style.

The meats are standard top sirloin picanha, garlic steak, ham, roasted pineapple (delish), beef rib.  The difference is that they are seasoned and cooked just right.  What I mean by that is that the chef has preserved the taste of the beef unique to the cut without overpowering the flavor with spices.  This is the way a churrascaria should be - each and every time.

Mea maxima mea culpa for the lengthy preamble.  I highly recommend and would go so far as saying this is a Las Vegas Best.

If you're on a paleo diet this is The perfect spot for you. 
Plenty of cuts of meats and salad bar with cooked veggies steamed and grilled. 
If you never been to an Brazilian steak house you my friend don't know how to be a foodie fanatic. 
The cuts of meat are premium and cooked to your liking.  if it's not, they will take it , cook it more or less which ever you prefer.  The customer service is super attentive. We need more spot like this in Las Vegas.

Very disappointed with the happy hour. My husband and I arrived at 5ish for their happy hour. No one was in the place.  Pinot Grigio and Pinot noir not on the happy hour. Ordered Pinot anyway and it was old.  Looked at the happy hour bar menu and they had filet mignon sliders priced HH price 4.75 or reg price 2 for 8. Wth!!  Prices were like that throughout menu??? So we had 2 drinks and 2 sliders for 46. Then we Ubered down the road to Siena and had actual hh prices and walked out full and happy!

The food was excellent. I ate the salads first and all were tasty. The omlette was light and tasty. The meats had really excellent flavors. I thought the fruits were very tasty as well and made for a lovely dessert. Service terrific. Went with a large group and we had individual checks!!!! Very nice surprise

I've eaten at Via Brasil well over 2 dozen times and very single time the service is excellent, the food is outstanding and the price is better than other Brazilian or American steakhouses. 

Their specialty is the picanha (or House Sirloin). Its tender slices will melt-in-your-mouth. Another personal favorite is the tangy chicken. 

I've never seen a salad bar that has fresh lobster bisque or watermelon topped with diced jicama. The little bites of Brazilian bread are delectable dipped in the bisque! 

Try the caipirinha--a Brazilian cocktail--but sip it slowly as it's nearly straight alcohol. The light refreshing taste can fool you! 

Sunday Brunch features a good selection of their most popular meats, along with a "made-to-order" omelette and waffle bar and the gourmet salad bar. The mimosas delightfully round out the brunch. 

For tourists, Via Brasil is worth the cab trip off of the Strip to see what else Vegas has to offer. For locals, it's a slice of heaven!

Do you love meat? If you answered yes you MUST eat here. If you answered no we can't be friends. This place is so spectacular. Delicious meat, wonderful salad bar, and the service is seriously the best I have ever received anywhere. Salad bar isn't your typical "salad bar". It had asparagus risotto for crying out loud! Delicious!! Great wine selections too! The meat of course was varied in selection, perfectly seasoned, dripping with juices, tender as all hell, and some of it is wrapped in bacon. The service is perfect. I almost feel like they had too many people there to cater to my every whim. For about $50/person it's not "cheap", so go when you're hungry. When you leave you won't regret a single dollar you spent there.

I usually hit Fogo de Chao when they hit me with 50% deals to my inbox and because of that, I truly forgot how good this place is.

Since I've hit every Brazilian place in town I'll point out the pros and cons of deciding on this place vs. heading elsewhere further down below...

THE OFFERING:
They give you two dinner options. One is $39.99 for 85% of the menu. The other is $49.99 and you get to add on unlimited rack of lamb, shrimp, filet mignon, table side cut ribeye, salmon, etc. Since it's main competition is Fogo de Chao and Texas de Brasil which are both $49.99, we all decided to do the premium dinner anyway and get the full experience (note, Pampas and Bertollucci in town are garbage. AVOID).

PROS:
-Excellent quality meat, very tender and flavorful. Better than Fogo and way better than that Pampas dump, about as good as Texas de Brasil (town square).
-Great service, they're friendly, you tell them what you want, they'll bring it cooked exactly how you like it, even if the entire table likes it's meat cooked differently.
-Beef carpaccio on the salad bar! -was very good and all you can eat. No other place has this.
-Lobster bisque on the bar was excellent, actually better than the bisque at sterling brunch.
-Grilled shrimp had a nice scampi flavor and they are generous with it as they come around.
-Fried, melted mozzarella with oregano, takes me back to the beach in Rio. Delicious and no other churrascaria in town offers this as well. It's good! A must try...
-The atmosphere is nice and the tables are well separated so you feel like you have your own space as opposed to some of the madness at Texas de Brasil. I like the smaller dining room feel and private space.
-The rack of lamb was large and meaty, bigger than most and cooked perfectly.

CONS:
-The pao de queso (cheese bread) wasn't totally hot and fresh and fluffy like I'm used to. My advice is to limit yourself on this addicting, cheesy ball of dough anyway, so not a big deal.
-The banana that I requested them to bring at the end of the meal desperately needed more brown sugar and perhaps a little caramel and a touch of cream. It wasn't sweet like the ones at Texas de Brasil.
-The accompanying sauces are hard to find and should have their own place on the salad bar to grab. I had to ask for mint jelly, the Brazilian style orange colored traditional steak sauce was no where to be found. There wasn't any horseradish (I forgot to ask) and the chimichurri sauce (which was on the salad bar) had next to it such a tiny, yet deep condiment dish that all the good stuff settled to the bottom and it seemed I was dipping the meat into oil rather than being able to dig into that good green stuff. Advice for next time would be to ask for all 4 sauces up front before the meat parade starts your way.
-Seldom do they offer discounts like Fogo de Chao and the occasional ones I find for Texas de Brazil.

OVERALL:
The quality of meat, the grilled shrimp, the lobster bisque, the beef carpaccio and the melted mozzarella are what puts this place towards the very top of the Brazilian steakhouse Vegas cluster. I was very pleased with the service and food and we all walked out a perfectly happy, bloated mess.

Absolutely amazing. The food was delicious, and the staff was great. They even remembered what temperature meat each of us preferred and they go out of their way to ensure you get more of the meats you like or want more of. The red sangria is absolutely delicious too. Happy hour prices are available at the bar (not at your table) so I recommend getting there 10 min early if you want happy hour prices and just bring them to your table. Love this place!

When calling to inquire about the Couples Package they have for Valentines Day you get one price.   Then they advertise via Facebook a different price, which is higher...  Not sure why the person answering the phone would have or give out incorrect information.  But if you can't get the correct information before you get to the restaurant,  I hate to see what could happen once you are there.

The food here is amazing. Its an orgasm in my mouth. The meat is perfectly cooked, and absolutely perfect. I love this place I keep going back for more. I highly recommend this place. If you want great food go here.
One of the best happy hour prices and times in Summerlin. Good sized portions, plenty of options and very delicious food and drinks.

After multiple weeks of craving a churrascaria or..rod√≠zio....we flip-flopped between Texas de, which was a twenty minute drive, with a birthday coupon for $25 off...and the five minute drive to Via....we made same-day resos on OpenTable at Via for 3 @ 7:15pm on Friday night. 
Hello beautiful unabashed protein fix!!
We were sat next to a wall and asked to be moved to a different table. They easily honored our request, even the Hostess helped us move our drinks to a center situated table. 
We all ordered the Sterling level. 
The cheesy rolls, p√£o de queijo ... ehh, I have certainly had much better. They were a bit too gummy and seriously under baked inside.
The salad bar, again...ehh. Much to be desired. As a ranch dressing fiend, it did taste housemade which was nice. But many items from the salad bar were overly and unnecessarily salty, imo. The beef carpaccio has two dabs of green olive puree, not sure why. I was told the lobster bisque was adequate, not great. 
Service -- really was very good. All of the servers, runners and the meat skewer guys were helpful, informative and stopped to check on us the entire evening in a not-so intrusive way. 
Looking at their menu posted online, we pretty much had every option at some point in the evening. Including leg of lamb -decent enough, baby lamb chops, sooo cute, but overcooked. Brazilian pork was moist if you asked not for the crispy part, melted mozz - all of the good parts of a pizza.
Sides were okay, mashed potatoes, asparagus, broccoli, mushrooms, fried bananas. The spinach was not completely wilted, perhaps that was a cost savings procedure? 
We all opted for dessert and espressos and cappuccino...passion fruit mousse - not my thing, but not terrible. Flan, no caramelized sugar sauce, but again not terrible. Chocolate mousse....slightly disappointing. It is one of my few dessert weaknesses...almost could not taste the pudding that was definitely whipped in.
In all, disappointed especially because of the proximity.
Brunch or happy hour seem to have better reviews, perhaps would have been a better visit. :-/

First time visit with my wife and two friends. The restaurant was celebrating their nine year anniversary, so even with reservations, it was a 30 minute wait, but it was totally worth it. They were pouring champagne and brought the meats around quickly. The gauchos had a smile on their face, so that makes for a pleasing experience. Can't wait to return with my wife!

I am from Brazil and was excited to visit Via Brasil with my husband. The restaurant looks beautiful and the staff is excellent. That said, the food wasn't as great as we were expecting and that was a little disappointing.

We had a reservation for 2 at 6:30pm on a Saturday. The place wasn't crowded, so that was nice. 

The service here is Great.  Our waiter was very polite and attentive.  The servers came around with meat quite often...to the point where you're like omgosh I can't handle this meat madness anymore.

The food is Delicious.  There are lots of different meats to try (lamb, sirloin, steak, meat, meat, etc) and unlimited sides (broccoli, garlic bread, corn on the cob, etc etc) as well.  The meat is served to your liking; rare, medium, well done.  There is also a dessert cart with creme brule, chocolate cake, etc all ~$7.50.  They also have a drink cart that makes special Brazillian drinks.  The food bar has salad, rice and potatoes.

Overall, this place has good food and service.  Plan to leave here stuffed!

Love this place! They have happy hour every single day at the bar. The bartenders Fidel and Mariana were great tonight. Came in and was greeted right away by the beautiful and friendly hostesses. I asked about the specials and they told me to try a caiparinha which they informed me is the Brazilian national cocktail. It was a little strong for my taste but it was still good. I ordered the Filet entree which came with mashed potatoes and this sweet red wine sauce that was excellent. The filet was cooked perfectly. I also ordered a side of sauteed spinach which is my favorite and it was awesome. For dessert i tried the brazilian doughnuts; oh my they were delicious. Warm and soft and served with vanilla ice cream. After dinner the manager Anna came to check up on me and told me about their new lunch menu which i can't wait to try. Overall this place is amazing in the bar for happy hour or the main dining for the all you can eat. Can't wait to go back!

This used to be a favorite restaurant of ours. I would often take out-of-town guests or celebrate friends birthdays here because I liked it so much. That has changed since the last 2 visits.

PROS
-AYCE meat
-Nice ambiance 

CONS
-Stingy with the meat selection
-Passed over if you're not sitting in the middle
-Unfriendly female manager
-Waiting a long time for meats to come out
-Meats are in the salty side

The mere suggestion of all you can eat steak in and of itself is a phrase that can ignite the hunger of even almost the most die hard vegan. Too me it's almost the evidence I would need to change my belief and become part of the faithful.

The salad bar is excellent. The meats seasoned and cooked perfectly. The deserts look magnificent but sadly I was too full to have one.

My father ordered a steak sanwhich which was too much for him and he took half of it home. 

Most importantly is the food, service, quality to price ratio and again Via hits the mark. I don't have any reason to rate this place lower than five stars so I won't. Top marks. Worth it!

We came here a few weeks ago. Our experience was sub par at best. We noticed several tables around us unhappy and voicing their concerns to management as well. The problems we encountered were as follows: 1) quality of the meats was not very good 2) they offer a larger menu for an up charge but then take the menu away and don't explain you need to ask for the expanded choices by memory 3) the sides for the table are gross 4) the meat takes so long to get to your table that you become full before you get your money's worth 5) you have to ask repeatedly to get your sides or special meats from the up charge and then they come cold to the table by the time they make it

In comparing this place to Texas de Brazil- go to TDB over this place and don't give it a second thought. Very disappointed with my experience at Via.
Went for the happy hour. The drinks were great, the food was tasty. Had teriyaki sliders and bacon wrapped shrimp. Service was good

A slow Tuesday night, two hungry people and the best service EVER! After a crazy day in our store we both were tired and hungry. Decided to try Via Brasil and head for a food coma early in the week. So glad we did. After debating going into the bar for the happy hour we both decided to eat in the restaurant instead. Food coma notwithstanding I am so glad we did.
 The food was perfect and nicely timed, we never felt rushed and the staff was some of the best I have ever seen. I like rare meat ( ok stop making faces!) Our waiter figured that out pretty fast and started bringing me the nicest meat on a stick to taste ;)   My absolute favorite was the flank steak!
One little snafu misunderstanding about the Yelp check in if it was for a desert each or only one per table (how we even decided to try desert after all that deliciousness!) and they took both off the ticket. 
Absolute great place and will definitely find another reason to go there again!

The selection of meats, and fish was very good. I especially enjoyed the prime rib, and filet mignon wrapped in bacon.  I truly felt the service was average compared to other Brazilian steakhouses that I have visited. Lastly, the one big advantage for the competition was a much greater selection at the salad bar.

The food here is awesome. I absolutely love the house special. The bacon wrapped turkey is really good also. The fried bananas are to die for. Never thought a fried banana would taste so good. The staff is professional and on top of their game everytime I have been here. I like this steakhouse more than Texas de Brazil.

We've been to many steakhouses with my husband. Via Brazil is the best one in Las Vegas for sure. Quality of the meat and it's preparation is unbelievable. We choose sterling menu all the time. Beef ribs and shrimps from here must have!

Fantastic food, beautiful restaurant.  I was very impressed that we were able to order as many sides as we wanted at no extra charge.  The options were endless for both the cuts of meat, salad bar and sides.  Service was very good.  Went on a Sunday so it was a little quiet.  I am a pastry chef and am very critical of restaurant desserts.  We had the cheesecake and it was great!  Not a lot of chain restaurants make their desserts in-house but they do here.  I could taste the difference.  The restaurant manager, Anna, was very hands-on and friendly as well.
So amazing! The service is amazing! Best place ever! I came for my birthday with my husband and parents and we will be back for sure!

We went for their brunch today. It was a horrible experience. No one would come around with the meat. We waited 30 min before one of the waiters came with a last piece. Another 15min went by before someone else came back. We spoke to the waitress twice about it then a manager. I would never go there again . It was a terrible experience to feel like you pay for something and you feel like you have to beg for service.

We've come here on several different occasions, it's closer to home and not a busy as it's competitors. The food is okay, cold buffet has nice selection. I would like if the cuts of beef were in rotation more or equal to the other meats (turkey, chicken, etc.) The lighting and mood is very dark but still has a nice feel. This is definitely the place, I feel for a more casual and slower paced dinner vs the hustle and bustle of some other restaraunts. I have also attended the Sunday morning brunch, surprisingly that was much more busy -- make reservations!!! The Waffle and omelet station was tucked at the end of the cold buffet, one lone cook with a Waffle iron a few topping and a pan for the omelets. As busy as it was there should have been more people to help, the guy at the table next to us eventually cancelled his order because it took way too long. All in all this place isn't on the top of my list but it's not too bad.

If you are meat lover, this is the place! Took my dad and family out for his birthday and it was wonderful.  Sure, it's $45 per person, but it is totally worth it.  You will not regret it after tasting the amazing selection of meats (we all especially loved the lamb!)  And our 2 kids were free.  We will be going back for special occasions.  Oh, and they told us over the phone "formal dining but you can dress casual" so we did...next time I will dress up  just a bit more as everyone else was in suits/dresses.  Awesome customer service!

Tonight we ordered on GrubHub, since my spouse is ill it was for convenience since we have eaten at the restaurant many times it had to be good, right? Well not tonight,
We ordered two steak and fries $24.99 each. It came with saut√©ed mushrooms and fries. We received two steaks, two containers of ketchup, two containers of red wine Demi glaz, and one container of fries. In total there was 12 fries. I called the restaurant assuming one order of fries was forgotten. The manager informed me that I got all I was supposed to get.  He was rude and extremely disrespectful. Why was everything packaged separately except the fries, according to him they very conserving containers, no the truth is you forgot one order and didn't want to have to have someone bring it. If you review the picture on grubhub it show 22 fries that I can count and there is more since it piled on top of each other.  Stop screwing over customers it's really a shame. We will never dine with you all again and definitely not order for delivery. Also, I almost forgot teach the cook to let the steaks rest before placing in the container,  since having it arrive in a pool of blood also isn't very appealing.
Save your money if you want a good steak don't get it here, heck Outback would have been a better choose for sure this night.
Excellent food!!! An amazing variety of meats, excellent sides!!!! The service is superb too!!!!

I have come to this restaurant many times, and I have seen it go from barely ok, to good, to great... and it may now be sliding back down to just "ok" when it come to their service. And please don't get me wrong, I will be brutally honest in this review, but this is only with the intention of helping the leadership team at this restaurant identify some disappointing shortcomings I saw during my last visit. 

As mentioned earlier, this restaurant has worked hard to become a really great churrasqueria in Las Vegas, but yesterday's visit left much to be desired. Let me explain. Hosting several family members for the holidays, I was torn as to what restaurant I could take them to so they could experience a "wow" dining experience, so I chose Via Brazil since they had previously earned my business with great service. In fact, Felipe (our usual waiter) is one of the friendliest and most welcoming waiter there.

Having said that, this visit was disastrous! It started with a long wait for meats to come to the table, then the waiters were slow, uninterested in serving us and borderline rude. For example, after trying to cut a piece of meat off the skewer onto my plate, a waiter spilled steak fat onto my shirt... No big deal as it was an accident. What really upset me was the waiter was completely unapologetic and only asked me if I wanted something to clean myself up with.  With an obvious YES as my response, he walked away for close to ten minutes and the sent a different waiter with a rag to clean up the mess. Really?! You spill food on a customer and this is your attitude?

The second disappointing mishap was their digital frequent diner program. I have been a member for a while but this time it seemed I annoyed the waiter when I asked him to credit me with the visit. In fact, he denied the free desert I had earned (despite there being no disclaimer on the promotion) and then proceeded to give my family members grief about using their frequent diner app because it was "downloaded on the same day of the visit". Are you telling me this restaurant spends money in a rewards program only to have its staff discourage diners from using it? That's a shame. 

Lastly, here are some other turn offs from the visit: dirty coffee cups, table was not bussed throughout the visit and waiters' appearance, service standards and demeanor left much to be desired. 

Please fix this!

**Summary**
       - They bring by skewers of meat and cut it right in front of you.
       - All the meats we had, with the exception of the lamb were perfectly cooked.
       - The top four you must try, in order of deliciousness is Beef Ribs, Top Sirloin, Prime Rib, and the Grilled Salmon with Orange Creme Sauce.
       - The garlic steak and flank steak were good, but a little bland comparatively
       - The pork tenderloin with Parmesan cheese is another thing that you should try.
       - Ones to avoid taking up unnecessary room in your tummy for the good stuff would be the Chicken Drumstick, Leg of Lamb, Beef Tenderloin wrapped in Bacon, Turkey wrapped in Bacon.
       - Decor/Mood - Classy and expensive
**Price**
       - $42.95 for Rodizio Dinner
**Ordered**
       - Salad Bar
              - Cheese Ravioli in Mushroom sauce - I usually don't like ravioli, but this was perfectly creamy and velvety
              - Seafood Mix - All the seafood you'll find in paella without the rice/chicken/sausage
              - Beef Carpaccio - Brio's is better
              - Salad - I'm allergic to chloroplast so I didn't really try it
       - Sides
              - Mashed potatoes - Seasoned and salted perfectly.
              - Cheese rolls - Who doesn't like cheddar biscuits.
              - Broccoli
              - Fried plantains - Best plantains I've ever had. Large, not too sweet, lightly crisp and not soggy.
              - French Fries/Onion Rings/Asparagus by request only.
       - Beef Ribs - So meaty, they cut you a piece off the bone. It's perfectly seasoned and is the only meat I had thirds of. It has just enough fat to melt in your mouth. 
       - Top Sirloin - My second favorite meat. However, the edge slices do tend to be a little salty. The inside slices are just right.
       - Prime Rib - Very moist. One of the juiciest pieces of meat I've ever had. No homo.
       - Grilled Salmon with Orange Creme Sauce - I usually hate cooked salmon, but the orange creme sauce was delicious. It must of been made with fresh oranges because it tasted like freshly squeezed orange juice, but as a creme.
       - Flank Steak - Juicy, but a little bland next to the other meats. 
       - Garlic Steak - Same as the flank, but with a garlic flavor.
       - Pork Tenderloin with Parmesan cheese - Thin layer of fried cheese around a normally bland meat. It was definitely something I didn't mind trying. 
       - Sausage
       - Beef Tenderloin and Turkey, both wrapped in Bacon - Mostly just tasted like bacon.
       - Leg of Lamb - A little dry, but it could of just been the piece I got.
       - Chicken drumstick
**Recommendations**
       - I would definitely recommend this place for a nice evening out or a special occasion. The price is a bit steep, but you're paying for food and an experience.

I have been to Via Brasil a couple of times and I have had an overall great experience. There are some lapses in attentiveness, but they get overwhelmed during peak business hours.

The brunch is phenomenal. With $17 all you can drink mimosas, bellinis, strawberry kir royales, mango champagne, white wine spritzers, and sangria. You cannot get a better deal. $6.50 is not a bad deal either, but you might as well go all in and enjoy yourself. 

The meat selection consisted of 9-10 different cuts of different animals. The picanha, garlic sirloin, prime rib, and pineapple were the group favorites. If the rodizio attendants don't come around regularly enough, you can ask the waiter to send them over.

The salad bar was where I found them to be weaker. I wish I could say that something stood out, but it was all relatively standard. The omelet and waffle bar does make up for it though. They do need a secondary waffle iron, because it was backed up for a majority of the time.

I so wanted to love Via Brasil.  

But I just can't give it more than 2 stars when compared to other Rodizios, even other non-chain Rodizios.  

We were there at 4pm on a Saturday.  We were one of only a handful of tables.  The ambiance is pretty, spacious, even bordering on elegant.  The salad bar has a few standout items (beef carpacio, Greek salad, mushrooms)  But most wasn't.

I liked that there are a selection of items that are brought to the table upon request.  But again, what we tried was lacking.  The spinach as undercooked, the asparagus overcooked.  The cheese bread was too big and rather heard.  The bananas were under ripe and bitter.  The demi-glaze wasn't reduced enough and the mint jelly was overly gelatinzed.

We ordered the Sterling menu and there are supposed to be 21 meats.  We were there for almost 2 hours and only saw 11 meats.  The rib eye and shrimp were probably the only two stand outs.  Both flavorful and well cooked.  But the lamb chops were gristly, the leg of lamb was too gamy and we are huge lamb fans.  The salmon came with a wonderful sauce but was so overcooked.  But worst was that the servers were few and far between.  Even getting a refill of water was hard.   

We eat at rodizios at least twice a month and I have never left one hungry, till here.

I went in there for dinner while I was getting my hair done at the salon next door. I had an ODORLESS black dye on my hair (no bleach) that needed an hour to process and I was hungry, so tried to kill 2 birds with one stone. I sat at the bar cause it was more causal but apparently my hair dye was offensive as the owner exiled us to the back of the restaurant behind a fountain next to the sliding doors that had a crack with all the cold air coming in. We were freezing and humiliated. I went and apologized to the other people at the bar for bothering them assuming someone complained, but they said they didn't notice or care that I had dye in my hair. So, it was definitely the call of the venue alone. Rude! At least the bartender was nice about it. She was so embarrassed for us and trying to make up for  it she made me a free drink!

I found about this restaurant from a TV show in Food Network called "Mystery Diners" where the manager was defrauding people by getting them to save monkeys in rainforest while showing them monkeys from Hokkaido Japan.   So the owner called undercover mystery diners to find out.  I could not hold my curiosity and visited the restaurant with my wife for dinner. This is an upscale Brazilian steak house where they bring in various types of meats to your table and you serve the side orders from a buffet like table.  Environment is trendy, upscale, food pretty good.  You can get different cuts of beef, pork, chicken, sausages and even lamb.  You have full bar and service is good. I recommend you get reservation during weekends but wait time is not bad either.  Price is typical at par with other Brazilian steak house not wickedly expensive and not cheap either.  This is a good place for romantic dinners and with family or friends.  I strongly recommend this restaurant.

Let me start by saying that the food was awesome.

Why not 5 stars then?

When you are paying $50 a plate. You don't really expect to be told that we are out of asparagus? Especially when Smith's is across the road.

Out of Brazilian sausage? You got to be kidding me. It is the part of the $50 plate. Why would you be out of it when you have it on the menu. Now if it was jack in the box, I would totally get it.

Furthermore, no manager came to ask us as to how we were doing? Or offer some compensation or apology for being out of the main menu dishes. Let me remind you, it was a party of 4 with drinks totaling more than $250 plus tip.

No effort was made to apologize for not having the menu items in stock. Now, if they were charging $20 a plate, they would have got 5 stars. 
But for $50 a plate, I expect better service. I do understand that things go wrong, however, no effort was ever made to correct it.

We had no interactions with the manager whatsoever.

Shrimp was never served until begged for.

Been to many Brazilian Steakhouse, this one is slightly different. More items on the salad bar like Chicken Marsala and Lobster Bisque soup etc.
Quality of meat is pretty good. The only one I found really dry was the New York Steak. They have one thing extra i.e Corn on the Cobb which was delicious. Atmosphere is nice and pleasant.

Food 8/10
Service 9/10
Atmosphere 9/10

Ask them to make Filet Mignon with Garlic sauce and thank me later.

Went for brunch...waffle station guy was so lack luster and with no personality.  They only have syrup you put on yourselves - you even have to ask for butter (geez).  They also offer omelets but that too I could have made better myself.  Salad bar was ok but no grilled eggplant and lobster bisque was like water.  It took forever to get our sides and cheese bread so I had to ask twice.  Meats were good but they shave off so little each time.  This was our 2nd time--I doubt we will return because it just isn't worth it.  I've tried Fogo de chao, pampas and Texas de brazil and TDB still wins because of the quality of meats and the better salad bar and lobster bisque.  Brunch was $24.99 and drinks are not included....

Love this place! So yummy! Took my whole family for my guys birthday and they were all so attentive!plan to be stuffed! Only complaint is they frequently bring by the cheaper meat as I wanted more of the filet!oh and they charged my son full price ..I didn't realize till I. Got home..he's 11 and ate well so I wasn't too upset! But they gave my guy a special birthday  dessert that he loved.so all in all we all enjoyed it !

Our sever Carolina was so awesome ! And explained the whole menu and style of cuisine ! Had an amazing date night , I love all the meats so juicy and cooked perfectly . Me and my fianc√© had a lovely bottle of Cabernet with our meal , which Carolina paired perfectly ! I would recommend this place .

This was my first time dining at a Brazilian Steakhouse.  I was out of town visiting family, when it was suggested to try this restaurant.  We went there for brunch, and I believe the cost was $25.99.  I didn't think the cost was bad considering all the options of food.  

I was able to order a fresh made to order waffle and omelet, and I was also able to try different meats, and ordered blueberry mimosas, which was good.  I really liked the Garlic Steak and Brazilian Pork the most.  

Everything was overall good.  Nice service, clean restaurant, and good food.  I would definitely go back to this place whenever I'm back in Las Vegas.

Haven't been here in about a year. Looks like a ghost town. Place is empty. Happy hour used to be packed. Ordered the lamb chops. They used to be the best in Vegas. They brought out a single lamb chop with shaved cucumbers for $12.99. The menu said 5oz but was served maybe 1 oz. When I confronted the waiter about the serving size all he could say I will get the manager. It turns out the manager was the owner. There was no apology, barely an acknowledgement the portion size was wrong and said he would go check with the kitchen if the order was correct. He returned with 2 more chops but did not offer to cover the meal. This place is a total bust. Nothing like it used to be. We will not be returning. What a disappointment.

Okay I used to be a fan of Fogo De Chao but now my go to will now be Via de Brasil.  Firstly I found the service to be much friendlier and attentive.  The food was superior as well.  Anytime I've beenn to Fogo their Fejuada was all beans and really sparse on the meat.  At Via it was full of sausage and pork...delicious.
The meats on the Rodizio were perfectly seasoned and just kept coming.  The entire family had the meat sweats by the end of the meal
All in all this is now my #1 Brazilian steakhouse.  Why it took me so long to try I can't explain.  I will definitely be back.

Have yet to have a bad experience here. The wait staff is extremely tentative down to they remember how you like your meat. Or instance I like my meat on the med rare side my wife likes it well they actually made her own steak and gave her the whole thing. For the price it's a steal don't for get to tip the wait staff they earn it here.

OK. Now I'm not a big meat fan, however my husband is. First of all, you have to serve yourself at a salad bar. Then they start bringing out all the meat and chicken and lamb and the servers swarm around you all the time, even though you put the stop sign up. Very annoying and not comfortable and the food was just so so and not to mention how expensive it was. Too many other wonderful restaurants to eat at. Will not be going back.
Best place.  Best hidden happy hour.  Best lobster tail for happy hour. You just need to experience  a total hidden gem

This review is for the happy hour only.

Happy hour is 5-8pm daily (on the patio, or at the bar), and it is pretty awesome.  There is a very good selection of appetizers for $5-6, and a lot of them are very, very tasty.  I've tried the sliders, empanadas, asparagus risotto, and beef carpaccio.  Everything was great, and  I can't wait to go back to try everything else.  The salads look delicious.
The $5-6 drink specials are great too.  They offer mojitos (classic, or muddled with fruit), and also caipirinhas.  The caipirinha is a pretty strong drink made with lime juice, sugar, and an alcohol made from sugar cane juice (tastes kind of like light rum).  You also have the option of having this with muddled fruit.  It's great with kiwi, and extra lime.
They do get really busy, so service can be a little slow.

Went for super bowl . Had a nice time but the waiter was extremely pushy. He insisted we had to have one of the alcohol packages . We only wanted iced tea and my 13 yr old wanted a coke . The waiter literally told us my sons coke would not be refillable unless we had the $48 alcohol wristbands for myself and husband.  Annoyed but we just agreed and went on with our time there . At the end we received the bill with 20% gratuity added in . Waiter didn't mention it of course . I asked on their FB page since when did they add automatic gratuity for 3 people ? I was asked to call Anna and told they do not auto gratuity 3 people . She was so nice  and apologetic . Told me she would speak to GM . Anna called back and said the GM wanted me to come in today at 4pm. I told her I had hurt my foot and it wasn't easy for me to drive but would have my husband take me . 
Went at 4pm to Speak to GM (assuming the owner ) . He was extremely defensive , rude , kept saying clearly I didn't want to tip the $55 I had tipped . He kept telling me that the auto gratuity was optional and only suggested . WHAT A LIE ! The bill total included the gratuity . Since when do you have the option to not pay your total bill due ? He then told me he would Speak to the server about the pushy attitude he had but that it was still just a suggested gratuity ?!? So , i asked why he asked me to come there when I live 20 min away when he wasn't trying to make the situation right , only arguing with me . He said I had no reason to come in ?!? This place is an absolute joke ! I only went in as they asked me to . 
He said he would give me back whatever part of the tip I wanted . Even proceeded to tell me that the waiter had brought me $55 change while I was at the restaurant ?? The bill was 265.00 .. I gave $280 .. how would he have brought me $55 in change. lol . The waiter never came back with any kind of change .
I ended up telling him quite frankly his customer service skills were shocking and I didn't come up there for free with my husband and kids in the car so I would just take my tip back  . Way to earn business . Been there many times with larger parties and will NEVER be back . 
Was warned by 2 former employees this guy was horrid but definitely saw that for myself now . 
*I was curious about the auto gratuity but My real complaint was only about being told to spend $48x2 people for my son to get refills on his drink . GM turned this into a tip issue and made me look cheap so fine I'll take my tip and give it to someone who wants my business . Thx !

My friends and I went to Via Brazil a couple of weeks ago and enjoyed ourselves tremendously.   We are from out of town and had heard from local friends that this was a good place to go.  I wasn't too sure because I had this idea that this was a place that was all meat, and I was not disappointed, IT IS!!  I love, love, love vegetables, pastas, salads, and also meat, but this comes when I feel like it.  I looked at their menu online and thought "it might not be so bad" after I saw some of their salad bar selection.
I made reservations for all of us, and AM I GLAD WE WENT!  
I absolutely loved all of their selections.  Some of us picked the salad bar and some had the Via Brazil  Rodizio dinner.  I absolutely loved their sauteed  spinach side, as well as their broccoli, asparagus, and mushrooms.  Did not need to make room for dessert since their fried banana was the BEST EVER I have ever had.  Since it was some of us ladies birthdays we also got some flan and have to admit it was sooo good (as good as mine) and that is saying something for me!  Looking forward to going back and trying the meats next time!!!  Love the staff too!  They were very attentive to us as well as the rest of the tables  and the restaurant was full.  They were on top of everything!  Would definitely recommend Via Brazil!

I love this place with every fiber of my being. They never disappoint. I've been a bunch of times and gotten the rodizio, and the Sunday Brunch. I just tried the happy hour for the first time a couple weeks ago and that was lovely as well. The bartender served us and she was fantastic, attentive and made great suggestions. My date enjoyed everything he had and he had two of the cocktails, their signature drinks that I can't remember the name of and they were both wonderful. Love this place, and I am a for life customer!

Me and my husband had dinner here for our date night. He had been raving about this place for a long time. We arrived for our reservation and was seated right away.  Our server was very courteous and patient. Singer had never been here before he explained how it all worked as far as what meads go with what dinner etc.  They have a generous salad bar and sides to choose from. 

We were both stuffed and ended the night with coffee and I had an amazing coconut cake dessert. We will definitely come back.  Not a bad price for the food and a very nice place to go.

My husband and I came here awhile ago before a show, I think it was Jubilee, because I had a restaurant.com certificate.  I really have not been happy with the Brazilian meat fest restaurants in this town so far, and I've tried to Texas de Brazil and Pampas, which were both pretty awful.  Via Brasil Steakhouse was not really impressive either, as I had a huge stomach ache after eating here, but not because of filling up so much.  

A lot of the meat was fairly tough and mostly not that flavorful to me.  However I did like the beef ribs, as they were cut off the bone and delicious.  The salad bar is decent, but if you come to a Brazilian steakhouse for the salad, I would go to Texas de Brazil first.  There's more variety for about the same price.

What makes this restaurant stand out however from other Brazilian steakhouses is the immense amount of sides you can order, which are all complimentary.  Normally, you get a few different sides and the rest is at the salad bar.  Here, there's tons including bananas, different vegetables, fries, and other potato fare.  Loved it!

The service is also very good, almost intrusive as they come around constantly to check up on you.

So I'm going to start this from the beginning. We had reservations and arrived 45 minutes before to have some drinks at the bar. The most redeeming part is the bartenders who even though they had a crowded bar tended to everyone promptly and had conversation. 

The hostesses weren't polite at all. We were sat 30 mins after our reservation, which overall isn't to bad considering other people were waiting over an hour past their reservation time with walking being seated before all of us. When asked an approximate wait the hostesses would immediately grab the phone and try to ignore the large mass of people with the same question. When asking for the manager, everyone was told "she's to busy."

After finally being sat we looked at the side order menu and when then told the only two available from the list were mashed potatoes and asparagus. The salad bar was very lacking. The bread was delivered with raw dough centers. The medium and medium rare meats has a leathery skin. The bacon wrapped filet had raw bacon where the meats touched on the skewer. The waiter was only seen twice in the hour we were seated. The meat servers while polite seemed to come all at once or not at all. The side dishes were a children's portion for a table of four and they would not bring more than one at a time. 

Overall. If you're looking for a nice decor for drinks at a bar I would recommend it with the courteous and excellent bartenders as a Brazilian steakhouse. Save your time and money and go elsewhere.

Our Valentine's plans changed last minute and we were able to make a reservation this afternoon for this evening--I am so glad that we did! 
It was our first time here, so we weren't sure what to expect but everything was perfect! Our waiter explained the fixed menu and the couple's packages they offered as well. 
My boyfriend and I enjoyed trying the various meats. The waiters were constantly coming around with new and fresh meats (chicken,  beef, pork,  steak--all of it was great!) 
The appetizer bar (which is also unlimited)  has a good selection of items that complement the dinner very well.  
The sangria is also very yummy and I reccomend the tres leches cake! 

We also got a bogo coupon for our next two visits!

We will be back again!

Christmas day was amazing

Thank you for being open and for everyone's work this day.

The food was wonderful mainly the prime rib, picanha and the beef ribs

The service was very good the waiter very attentive

Thank you very much and see u guys on new years

This was my 3rd time coming, I've previously been for my birthday rodizio style, happy hour, and now brunch! Let me tell you brunch was AMAZING the waffle and omelet bar wasn't even full with too many guests , the salad bar was stocked and had good traditional breakfast items as well as traditional Brazilian foods. The experience was great everything so fresh so good and then the rodizio style of meats was great! Melt in your mouth meat and the flavor AMAZING!!! I'd def recommend and i will continue to frequent this place.

BEST of VEGAS!!!

This place seriously needs to be put front and center in a major casino on the strip.

Made reservations for a large family event at this fine establishment and they provided food, service and quality far above what was expected. Ben Jardino (hope thats correct) was a truely great host. Made us all feel at home. The food was an absolute pefect meal. Every kind of meat imaginable was provided with our menu selection and it kept on coming.

They cleaniness and overall decor was imaculate also. This place is a true winner and I will send everyone I know heading to Vegas to now eat here.

Brazillian Rotisserie.  I know it tastes great, I know it is a somewhat unique way to dine, but I can never get past the 44 dollar or more price tag so when I received my father's day $29.99 coupon I had to go and take the whole family.  The salad bar was fresh and the lobster bisque was ok, if a little flat.  But we don't come here for the salad, so I turned my card up and said bring on the meat.  The favorites were the pork loin (surprisingly tender and flavorful), the lamb, the pork ribs, and the fillet wrapped in bacon.  The fails were the chicken and turkey which were dry and appeared overcooked.  Also the salmon was bland.  The rest of the meats included beef ribs, sirloin, strip steak, and sausage.  

They come around often and mostly ignore the button, asking you anyway.  The sides are not very good and you don't really need them as your salad bar should give you the illusion of eating something healthy.  Pace yourself and don't be afraid to say no or come back later.

Of note: Kids are 14.99.  Happy Hour is 5-8 pm daily and includes a selection of appetizers and drink specials.  Thursday night is locals night and women are 29.99 and men 39.99 plus the appetizer specials are for the entire restaurant.  Sunday Brunch is 24.99 and includes some of the meats as well as an omelet station.

Bon Appetit

Great food and great service. Bartenders were very sweet and attentive! We got there at 8 on a Saturday and they had a nice menu for happy hour.  5.00 appetizers and the drink prices were cheaper. Not expensive but on the higher side, with that said, the drink were wonderful!

This is place is one of my favorite restaurants Now! All you can eat steak for 39.99 (15 differet options) or 49.99 (21 different options), Wow! It comes with a salad bar stocked with lots of other options. When I say all you can eat Steak I mean all you can eat. ALL THE MEATS ARE WELL SEASONED AND COOKED TO YOUR LIKING! I am a new fan and customer. My first time is the best time! Great customer services and delicious drinks...tip ask for the popular favorite! I LOVE THIS PLACE.

Came here 01/29/16 had reservation for a party of 7  servers were very polite and professional. food was delicious and satisfying.   decor was nice and upscale . I definitely recommend this place *****

Want to know how much we love Via Brazil Steakhouse? We had our reception there 4/9/16! It's our favorite brunch and dinner spot. The food is delicious and the service is unparalleled. The meats are cooked to perfection and you may request any temperature you prefer. My wedding guests raved about the meal and the service. We had a group of 35 and making the arrangements was easy and stress free! Just what every bride needs. Check them out, and you'll be hooked too!

This restaurant has the best happy hour in Las Vegas! The food is amazing and the service is impeccable!  They just got new machines in March and they have created a gamers happy hour like no other!  You will not leave this place hungry or disappointed!

good service, good food, good atmosphere.... happy hour food and drinks are a great deal. I got the vbs filet mignon tournedo. Great meal, perfect combo with the heart of Palm sauce meat was a little over done but good. Calamari was awesome as well as the bacon wrapped shrimp... Karens a great waitress with awesome customer service. Accommodates each customer professionally. Any problems the owner takes care of it quickly and professionally... Will be coming back here soon. Great restaurant.

Been to Fogo de Chao (the standard), Texas de Brazil and now Via Brazil. So comparing Via to Fogo:

Salad bar - Fogo's is bigger but the quality is same. Rice better at Via.
Caipirhina - Via wins for smoothness of this classic drink from Brazil.
Cheese bread - Fogo gets the nod for lighter and fluffier dough.
Meat - tie. You will prefer some cuts at one locale over another but it's a wash in the end
Side dishes - Fogo wins here. Via has no fried polenta and their fried bananas pale in comparison to the maduros at Fogo.
Desserts - too full, couldn't eat any at Via.

Bottom line: Fogo is still the standard but you will not be disappointed by Via and I wouldn't hesitate to go to Via again. Luv that Brazilian churrascaria.

I got to experience first-class service by their most attentive staff constantly asking me if I needed anything and were at times one step ahead of me and knew what we needed! The gourmet salad bar offers grilled Portobello mushrooms, seafood salad, beef carpaccio, fine cheeses, and many more.

My list of absolute faves you should try!
Meats:
Garlic Picanha
Tenderloin Wrapped in Bacon
Picanha (Top Sirloin)
Prime Rib

Side Dishes:
Salgadinhos
Fried Bananas
Grilled Cheese
...And if you want to end your dinner with a huge smile on your face, ask for their Cappuccino!

I love that children ages 5 and under are FREE!
Favorite Brazilian steakhouse in Las Vegas, we take our guests from out of town all the time to Via Brasil. Happy hour drinks were delicious too.

My wife and I wanted to eat at some special places for visit to Vegas, and found one at Via Brasil. Our experience, my wife's first at a Brazilian steakhouse, was memorable, positive, and romantic. The quiet and relaxed atmosphere was well complemented by excellent and attentive service. The meats that were brought around were all excellent, but we both especially loved the bacon wrapped turkey. The selections on the salad bar were extensive, varied, and everything we tried was delicious. The chimichurri sauce must be mentioned, and was bursting with flavor. If there was a single downside as a visitor, it is that the restaurant is a good distance off the Strip, so the cab rides were expensive, but we left feeling it was money well spent

I decided to give this place a second chance as my step father who is 83 likes going here. Ugh 

The food is disgusting how can anyone like this place? Oh because you can get a cheap brunch for $29 but you get what you pay for. 

They have zero business serving Brazilian meat. 

Their meat is flavorless and they obviously cook the meat super cold. The meats are never red nor pinkish they are always a dull brown. 

If you get the filet mignon eggs Benedict the hollandaise sauce taste of just lemon. The filet has zero seasoning. 

Their salad bar is even worse.  The cous cous over cooked, the soups just everything here is POOR QUALITY. 

I honestly feel like only older people enjoy this place because of the price and those who do not really have a refined pallet. 

Has the owner or manager actually ate this food? If so and you still serve it #SlapYourself

The food is great! The service was very good. The staff seem to actually enjoy serving you. We took some friends there for their 28 year anniversary. They really enjoyed trying the different meats. Thanks Via Brazil for making the experience memorable.

There's already a ton of reviews on here so I will just hit some highlights.  If you want a meat dinner, this is a good choice.  Yes they have a salad bar with a lot of nice items but vegetarians will never get full value out of this place.  With that said, I have been to other Brazilian places in town and this is probably the best.  It looks nice inside and the food quality is quite high.  The price, while "high" in a general sense, is pretty competitive within the Brazilian market.

So why not five stars?  To be sure my last visit was quite recent and quite good.  But, in the past, I have experienced some of the knocks others have noted.  Specifically, waiters that seem to walk right by my table while I sit there, sometimes for a long time, waiting for more meat.  Also - in the past I have also experienced a certain level of "grief" when trying to use a coupon that this place sent me!  If it's a problem, don't send it to me!  

Hopefully these things have been corrected, I did not experience them on my most recent visit I am glad to say, and I probably will be back in time.  I also want to make a special note about the mother/father's day brunch:  Really good and also worth your consideration!

The staff were very good and extremely  Attentive. The food was also good, not great. I was disappointed when we ordered the shrimp in the salmon. The shrunk taste good but you received only 6 small shrimp and the salmon had no taste whatsoever. However, when the waiter asked me if I liked the salmon I had told him no he took it off of my bill even though I asked him not to. I wasn't by no means looking for a free meal. It reminds me a bit of a Vegas show girl who's a little tired and past her prime. 
 I very much wanted to expect more. I just kind of had the impression that it is like a Red Lobster of Rodizo's.

What a wonderful experience this place was! Once you walk in, you are kindly greeted by the host. The openness of the restaurant is absolutely amazing. The bar is to the left of the entrance and it's a great size. Good amount of seating and little tables around it as well. They opened the side on the restaurant next to the bar where you can feel the perfect spring breeze while enjoying appetizers and drinks. There is outside seating if you want to enjoy the outdoors. The salad bar was not too overwhelming. They had your salads, one type of soup, little bite size refreshing appetizers and some amazing chilies! We got the "sterling" which is $50.99 per person but you get all the meats on the menu. You can request some meats that you don't see coming out with your waiter and they'll make it for you in the back. Which I think is amazing! Fresh and ready for you in just a few minutes while the cutters come walking around giving you other choices of meats. They are super generous and all of the workers are so kind. We met one of the owners and she is great! Super sweet. My hubby's favorite meat was probably the beef short ribs and I think it was garlic steak. I love the shrimp, chicken hearts and the salmon. The best side was probably the fried bananas! The breading was perfectly done and it wasn't greasy at all. It's amazing! The bartender is awesome too. Ask Miguel to make their special Brazilian drink. Tip him well! He's awesome!! Tip your waiters well too. They do all work hard to make your experience the best. Cheers! Happy eating my fellow Yelpers!

GREAT FOOD!!! Not so good for a person that doesn't eat much. The atmosphere is great especially for dinner. They had a live band and the waiters were attentive, polite, and were friendly. This was my first time eating at a Brazilian steakhouse, so i wanted to try every selection of meat and i was in for a treat!! They come by with the meat on the skewers and cut it right in front of you. :) I loved the beef ribs, it was cooked perfectly, so much flavor with every bite. The garlic steak was also another one i liked. There's also a salad bar. It was clean and FRESH. A good variety to chose from. The cold pasta was so delicious, i wished i can take some home with me! haha. If you can handle the dessert after dinner, go for it! From what i remembered, there were cheese cake, flan, pudding. I had their chocolate cheese cake and peanut butter and chocolate cheese cake. So GOOOOOD!!! It's pricey, but worth it!!!

Dropped in for happy hour. Nice looking bar and patio area. I sat at the bar and ordered a brazilian passionfruit cocktail which was made with sugar rum. Very tasty!
I had a bowl of lobster bisque for $3.50 and followed that with chicken stroganoff which was well prepared in a creamy buttery sauce. $8. Really good food, good service, and overall a nice place. Will return here again.

This restaurant is gorgeous and has EXCELLENT food and service.  Great quality of meats and even the salad bar rocks!  They have a wonderful lobster bisque (who would have thought) and a really good rigatoni ala vodka on the bar in addition to numerous other cold and warm items.  For meats, what a selection!  My favorites are the garlic steak and the prime rib.  My husband loves the filet wrapped in bacon and the tri-tip.  Definitely try the garlic bread...YUM!  This was our first time in here and will not be our last.  James, our server, was fabulous!  We will ask for him again!  GREAT place!  Better than all of the strip buffets, far better quality and service.

This place was amazing! The salad bar had a good variety, and the atmosphere was perfect. I went for the Sunday brunch. It was $25 All you can eat. The staff was very nice, place was clean and the food was delicious. I'm definitely going back soon. Next time I'll try the AYCE dinner!

Meh.  I'll be short and to the point. 

The service was great and the place is beautiful, but the fooood...

Most of the beef (filet mignon, garlic steak, mainly) was over cooked and tough.  Only thing they didn't botch was the flank steak.  The salmon was good as well.

Chicken was greasy.  

Lobster bisque tasted like slurping butter.

It's bad when the salad bar food is better than the meat at a steakhouse.

Over priced for what you get.

Ugh, Valentine's Day service! So many reasons to HATE this place. Here's why: 

Arrived in time for our dinner reservation at 9pm, only to be lied to constantly about the wait time. Wait time? With a reservation??? Apparently so. We hung out at the bar with a lot if other angry people with delayed reservations. Management came and went, never really providing much of an update and obviously had little concern for what was going on. We heard cuss words. Not very professional at all. 

Since we were seated about an hour late, the salad bar was beyond picked over. There wasn't much left and it was messy. 

The side dishes were skimpy. The spinach was salty. Other sides were ok but very small. 

The meat servers never seemed to make it to our table. They circled through the tables on the same pattern, and always ran out of meat just before our table. Awesome. In an hour, we had only been served meat three times. Wow. 

I checked in on Yelp, which offered a free dessert, only to be told that they would NOT honor the free check in coupon because it was a "holiday". Well....THEN WHY DO you HAVE a check in coupon?!?! The dessert we did have was disappointing (watery Tiramisu). 

We have been to all the Brazilian style steakhouses in Vegas, and loved it. Viva does NOT do Brazilian steakhouses justice. In fact, the poor service and bad food make the other steakhouses more appealing. Viva makes McDonalds look appealing. 

I can honestly say that we will NEVER be back and we will tell all our friends, family and coworkers about our horrible experience here. Cannot believe this restaurant will be in business much longer treating customers like this. HORRIBLE.
This place is one of my fav's so far. The staff are always attending you to make sure you have what you need. Their meat is delicious and their drinks are even better.

We came here once for dinner which was a 4.5/5 and again for brunch on Easter which unfortunately I would give a 3/5.
If you are going here just for the meats, then I highly recommend of course. Their pork, bacon wrapped turkey, sirloin, and prime rib are all delicious. For Easter, the salad bar and dessert section was disappointing. There were only 2 dessert options which neither tasted very good and the salad bar was small and minimal choices. For $36/ person it is worth it for brunch if you are eating a lot of meat, otherwise don't expect to have a good choice of sides.
It's only ok.the service is slow. The food is fair.cheap sweet champagne.  Not worth the money for brunch. And does not include dessert

So gave it another try after being invited back after the bad experience last time. It was pretty much like night and day compared to the last time. It was not nearly as busy as last time so I kind of get the feeling that holidays and special occasions are not the best times to visit. Had Gerardo as a server again ( see previous review) and again he was great. Went above and beyond to get a dish to us that was not being offered on the salad bar but had it specially prepared. Meat selection seemed to be much more than before. This visit we had the choice of sides which I liked much better. 

So overall I either came on a bad night the first time, or special occasion nights are too much for them to handle. I still prefer Texas de Brazil given the choice. That being said I had a much more enjoyable meal this time around and very much appreciate them reaching out to me and recognizing a bad customer experience and making it right.

Worst New Year's experience ever. We all were enjoying ourselves when the waitress came to our table and told us rudely "we had to leave" because other parties were waiting. Not nice about it at all. I couldn't believe what I was hearing. We did not even have dessert yet. So after a brief discussion we were able to get dessert. Food was excellent as always. Then we received our check. They billed me for the whole table and again for my half of the bill. I understand it was busy but to try bully us out and then screw the check up. The check was over $250 plus another $125 not including the drinks we had waiting to get our table. We had our firm party here last year. Guess who is not coming back. Just to be clear we were just four adults quietly enjoying dinner.

Went here with some work pals and it was great. Would have given five stars except that we had a hassle about our coupons. There were two couples. The first had a coupon for themselves, good only for th two of them. That was fine. I ahd a coupon with a different deal good for me and up to 8 others I wanted to use for me and my friend. But because we were sitting at the same table they told us we could not use tow coupons. I explained clearly that I did not want any one of us to benefit from both coupons and that it was no different than if we just had them seat us at separate tables and they said sorry, not our policy. After much haggling we were allowed JUST THIS ONCE to use two coupons at one table. COME ON!
New York strip, salmon with honey sauce, and everything that had bacon wrapped around it was phenomenal!! We will be back!

This review is for my visit for Brunch, only available on Sunday! Rodizio style baby!

Brunch is 24.99 pp normally however I joined the on line e-club for free and was immediately sent via email an invite for 19.99 pp, hell yeah! FYI kids under 5 eat free. All you can eat/AYCE!

Wow, I came across this restaurant and brunch info by accident while browsing the web and I am sure glad I did!

The description of the brunch was mouth watering and I have been dreaming of going for four weeks now, was just waiting for a Sunday that my boyfriend did not work.

Complimentary drinks, fresh squeezed pineapple, strawberry and orange juice are available for $3.50 per glass.

They have a beautiful super fresh hot and cold Gourmet salad bar, that includes lobster bisque soup, bacon, sausage, hashed browns, cheese blintz,  and many homemade salads and a delicious ranch dressing! I really enjoyed the Caprese salad mmm yum and they have bottles of the best Olive oils around that you can use. My boyfriend really enjoyed the roasted peppers and eggplant. This is just listing a few as they have close to 35 items in their hot and cold gourmet salad bar!

Fresh omelet station, eggs benedict or eggs any style for your own creation made to order, and Belgium waffles made fresh as well!

You are given a rodizio marker for your table and when you want meat brought to your table you place it on the green side, and when you have had enough or are working on what you have then you flip it over to the red and they will not come to your table.

Mmmm yum they also give you a side of fresh mashed potatoes and some delicious fried bananas which were the best I have ever had in my life!!!!!!

They have a cart of fresh banana bread and another bread,  however once she said banana I knew I must have and did not hear what the other was. It was the best banana bread I have ever had the pleasure of eating! I had seconds on that for sure!

The brunch is rodizio style so there are 6 choices of meats coming around at all times to make the rounds to your table. They are generous and are constantly on the move making sure you are satisfied and have everything you need or could ever want! 

List of meats cut table side. Top sirloin, tenderloin wrapped in bacon, turkey wrapped in bacon, prime rib, chicken drumsticks, smoked ham and pineapple. Keep in mind this selection is only for brunch, their dinner service has closer to 16 meats. 

The bacon wrapped turkey was an explosion of flavor all up in my mouth! The prime rib was delicious and melted in my mouth like butta!

The service was Amazing, everyone on staff catering to our every need, refills of iced tea galore, my glass never even had the chance to get half full at any point! 

They cleared plates, brought plates, folded our napkins back up every time we left the table, they were on it! This restaurant for sure values and appreciates their customers!

Heather was an Amazing Server by the way, her smile and sweet, helpful, knowledgeable personality was refreshing. If I owned a restaurant I would love to have her on my staff!

This was a real treat for my sweetie and I also was my first time for rodizio style meat service it sure was a winner!

We will be back because I know I will be dreaming about this place and be itching to get back really soon!

The best service ever in all of my dining experiences I swear! I told my boyfriend that I feel like a Queen totally treated like royalty in every way! They totally spoiled us with anything and everything, I am still Amazed and super happy with our experience. 

Top quality food and very tasty and creative!
My first time here and my second time at a Brazilian steak house. I liked the picanha better here. Service was really good and friendly.

Bad customer service asked for 2 high chairs multiple times, no one came to bring drinks. Every one was getting taken care off but us, If you have kids this is not the place they look at you like weird animals we walked out, never felt so uncomfortable in my life!! Very disappointed I actually been there before and the server was great this is why I decided to take my husband here for our anniversary... never going there again!

Visited Via Brasil Stakehouse recently with a group of 8, and of course.. WE WENT ALL OUT and got the All You Can Eat. We were there on business in Las Vegas, and didn't want to do the usual "On the Strip" experience.. It's located in a nice, seemingly newly developed area with a parking lot with plenty of parking.

Highlights:
+ Very wide selection of meats and seafood
+ Customer service was spot on, and they keep the food coming!
+ Was close to the Strip (about 15-20 minutes)

Final Thoughts:
I'm "jelly" of the people that live closer to this place. Would be great to have something as fairly priced and with the nice environment out where we live. The food was awesome, customer service was great, and if you love to eat A LOT of food this place has it all.. meats, seafood, buffet, and salad bar.

The place is great for friends family or date night with your special someone..Te service is great on point. Got try out the variety of their salad bar and the meats are cooked to perfection.. The lamb, prime rib , shrimp, and sweet chicken are amazing but the bacon wrap filet is the best .. Can't wait to come and try more

This place is fantastic! The beef ribs are the BEST! Staff has always been super friendly and attentive. The sides don't really seem to change though. Kids prices are amazing as kids under 3 are free and 3-5 are only $5! I would love to give this place 5 stars but my favorite is fogo de chao. For a closer/cheaper alternative come here! Good stuff!! Oh and the bar is pretty cool. Beautiful, modern and always busy!

Amazing!  Be prepare to eat. The host was great he explain how the dinning experience works.  Staff will come around with different type of meat and you can select what you want. Expensive but worth it.

Meat!!!!!!!!! First time last night with a friend. Went to the bar before our seating and the acai caipirinha was delish. Bartender was very sweet and cool. The manager was very kind and checked on us to make sure we were having a good time. Once we got seated we started and my plate was never empty. I had everything on the selection at least once along with our sides. I am in a meat coma. Will definitely come back again despite the fact I live on the other side of the valley.

This place is okay considering being a consistent customer to Brazilian steakhouses. Much rather spend it at FogoDe Chao than anywhere else here in town. Over this one and over Texas . Service is kinda boring here staff have no smiles no expressions on them. Just flat out boring. Meats okay kept getting burnt while asking medium well. Save your bucks for fogo they treat you better than anyone

Awesome food, terrific service, super manager, fair price = 5 stars!

Have always wanted to try Via Brasil Steakhouse, since it is so close to home, and with the Groupon promotion it was a no brainer.

Their self-serve salad bar is excellent.  The variety of food and the taste was outstanding, even though it is not the main reason for visiting Via Brasil, it was a nice treat and helps break up the all-meat-fest.

I enjoyed almost all the BBQ meats that was served by the waiter. But I really like the sausage, the lamb, chicken hearts (not on the menu, but you can ask for it, as it is one of the things served in this kind of restaurant in Brazil). I didn't care for the baked salmon, even though the passion fruit sauce that was served with it was good).  But you should definitely pace yourself and try everything and find out what you like and ask for more if you still have room in your tummy.

The servers were all very friendly as they make their round with whatever they bring out from the kitchen and identifying what it is so you don't have to guess. 

If you have room for dessert after your meal, they have a dessert cart to help visually entice you for some after meal sweets.  I tried their Coconut Flan, and thought it was good.  I liked the creamy richness and the coconut flavor.

As a nice restaurant in Summerlin, they probably should have more customers, but when I went they weren't too busy.  So making a same day reservation just hours ahead was not an issue for me.  I spoke to the manager and he told me they were getting more business with the Groupon promotion (and they just recently ran another Groupon offer) so the strategy is working.

Anyway, because of the awesome service from the waiter to the manger, and the good food I will definitely be back.  And having more Groupon to use will keep my tummy and wallet on my future visits. 

Decor: 5/5  The self-serve salad bar was nicely decorated and kept clean.  The restaurant was sophisticatedly (is that a word?) decorated.
Food: 4/5  Overall I am very pleased with it.  
Service:  5/5  Servers were friendly.  The manager that made the rounds and speaking to the guests was genuinely friendly.
Location:  Great for locals living in the SW, but will be too far of a trip if coming from the Strip via a cab.
Price: 4/5  Definitely take advantage of Groupon or other offers when available.
Ambiance: 5/5  Very classy and upscale, yet very relaxing as well.

This place is great!! I am from Brazil and live in LA. I went to Via Brazil with friends Jenna and Newton Cazarro for the first time in March 2016. Since then, every time I go to Vegas I MUST eat at Via Brazil. The Brazilian Barbecue is the best. They also have a huge and diverse salad buffet. For happy hour I definitely recommend the traditional caipirinha and the salgadinhos! It was delicious. Can't wait for my next visit to Vegas end of February.

Service was incredible.  Everyone friendly and with a sense of humor.

The food was amazing.  The meats kept coming and I didn't want to turn the card to red.  I tried about everything they had.  The salad bar and sides were also nice, offering great accompaniments to the meats.

For dessert we had the bananas flambe.  This was the BEST dessert I have ever had anywhere.  Trust me, you HAVE to get this at some point.  The presentation and taste of this is on a different level.

Overall, the people, atmosphere and food make this a place I want to go to again and again.  Also, I am anxious for the brunch which seems great

We've been semi regulars at Via Brasil for about 5 years.  Everything has always been PERFECT. This visit was for my wife's 40th birthday; I told them why were coming when I made the reservation.  The restaurant was about half full when we arrived right on time for our reservation.  The hostess welcomed us, and wished my wife a happy birthday.  The service, as usual, was spot on.  The head waiter checked on us on a regular basis, making sure we had everything we wanted/needed.  The wait staff refilled our drinks without being asked to do so, and despite what others have said, the "premium" meats came by on a VERY regular basis.  The meal is definitely a splurge, but WELL WORTH IT!!!

Excellent 
Food was excellent 
Drinks were excellent 
Service is excellent 
Area,  Ambience, No wait time all excellent ! 
Loved it ! 
Will definitely be back!!

I don't care how hungry you are you will always surrender before they run out of food. Don't fill up on the salads and sides just let the meat keep coming and you keep eating. 

Save up and come hungry I think you'll enjoy it.
